SUMMARY:
Image caption Steve Hewlett 1958-2017Full text of the lecture as delivered at the Royal Television Society on 28 September 2017:I am honoured to be asked to deliver this, the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture.
Thank you to the RTS, the Media Society and to Rachel for inviting me to deliver it.
It's great to have Steve's boys - Freddie, Billy, Bertie - here, his sister Sue and other members of the family too.
Steve's death was news - national news - which, had he been here to see it and to see you all gathered here for the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture - would have produced one of those characteristically laconic Hewlett chuckles.
It was news, of course, because millions had grown used to turning up the car radio or stopping the ironing or waiting before turning on the kettle to make sure they not miss the latest weekly instalment of the Hewlett cancer chronicle - in which a middle aged man described the pain in his oesophagus; the splitting of his nails or chapping of his feet; the search for the drug or the treatment that might buy him some relief and some more time before the end which he sensed and we sensed was coming all too fast.
TEXT:
Image caption Steve Hewlett 1958-2017

Full text of the lecture as delivered at the Royal Television Society on 28 September 2017:

I am honoured to be asked to deliver this, the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture.

Thank you to the RTS, the Media Society and to Rachel for inviting me to deliver it. It's great to have Steve's boys - Freddie, Billy, Bertie - here, his sister Sue and other members of the family too.

Steve's death was news - national news - which, had he been here to see it and to see you all gathered here for the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture - would have produced one of those characteristically laconic Hewlett chuckles.

It was news, of course, because millions had grown used to turning up the car radio or stopping the ironing or waiting before turning on the kettle to make sure they not miss the latest weekly instalment of the Hewlett cancer chronicle - in which a middle aged man described the pain in his oesophagus; the splitting of his nails or chapping of his feet; the search for the drug or the treatment that might buy him some relief and some more time before the end which he sensed and we sensed was coming all too fast.
TITLE: Nick Robinson

SUMMARY:
Taoufik Moalla thinks police should have sent him on his way once they realized nothing was wrong.
A Montreal driver's singing hit a sour note with some police officers, who ticketed him for screaming.
Moalla told CTV Montreal that four officers â€” two on each side â€” approached to check the inside of his car.
After checking his licence and registration, Moalla said police fined him $149 for "screaming in a public place," according to the Montreal Gazette.
Moalla doesn't know if the fine reflected his poor singing abilities, but apparently his wife isn't surprised.
TEXT:
Taoufik Moalla thinks police should have sent him on his way once they realized nothing was wrong.

A Montreal driver's singing hit a sour note with some police officers, who ticketed him for screaming.

Taoufik Moalla was a short distance from his house when he started singing along to his favourite song, '90s classic "Gonna Make You Sweat (Everybody Dance Now)" on Sept. 27.

He heard police sirens behind him and was signalled to pull over.

Moalla told CTV Montreal that four officers â€” two on each side â€” approached to check the inside of his car.

Is there something that forbids that, or did I really bother anyone?

"Then they asked me if I screamed. I said no, I was just singing."

After checking his licence and registration, Moalla said police fined him $149 for "screaming in a public place," according to the Montreal Gazette.

He told CBC News he was "really upset" by the ticket, and thinks police should have sent him on his way once they realized nothing was wrong.

"I was singing loudly in my car," he said. "Is there something that forbids that, or did I really bother anyone?"

Wife not surprised

He pointed out to CTV that if the Montreal Canadiens won a game, all the fans screaming out of their cars probably wouldn't all be given tickets.

Moalla doesn't know if the fine reflected his poor singing abilities, but apparently his wife isn't surprised.

"She told me, if it was for singing, I'd have given you a ticket for $300," he said.
TITLE: Taoufik Moalla, Montreal Driver, Fined $149 For Singing While Driving

SUMMARY:
To raise awareness of the mighty yet little-known dam, we asked sexual health charity FPA all of the questions you're too afraid to.
They're not suitable for use during penetrative sex and for oral sex involving a penis and mouth, a condom can be used.
Generally the risk of STIs associated with oral sex is less than vaginal or anal sex, but some STIs are more easily passed on during oral sex than others.
But they are thin enough to enable pleasure and stimulation, which means you can still enjoy great oral sex.
Knowing you're protected from STIs can actually make oral sex feel even better as you can relax a bit more.
TEXT:
A dam is a small square of soft plastic which makes performing oral sex a whole lot safer. It sits over the female genitals or anus - kind of like a safety blanket - so that oral sex can be performed with less risk of catching STIs. While dams may not be commonly used, that's not to say they are unimportant. A new study revealed men who smoke and perform oral sex with five or more partners have the highest risk of developing a type of head and neck cancer triggered by the human papilloma virus (HPV). Dr Peter Greenhouse, a sexual health adviser for the government, has also warned that more and more people are contracting sexually transmitted infections (STIs) through oral sex. And dams are just one way of preventing this. To raise awareness of the mighty yet little-known dam, we asked sexual health charity FPA all of the questions you're too afraid to.

Dynamic Graphics via Getty Images

What is a dam? A dam is a latex or polyurethane (soft plastic) square or rectangle, which can be used to cover the anus or female genitals. It acts as a barrier to help prevent sexually transmitted infections passing from one person to another. They're not suitable for use during penetrative sex and for oral sex involving a penis and mouth, a condom can be used. Where can you get them from? You can get dams at some genitourinary (GUM) and sexual health clinics, contraception clinics and pharmacies. Don't be too surprised if your local clinic doesn't hand them out though, as they may not get asked for them very often. They are also widely available from online shops which sell condoms.

How does it stay in place? To keep a dam in place during oral sex you simply hold it with your fingers. It doesn't matter which side you put against the vulva or anus, but you shouldn't turn the dam over once you've started using it. You also shouldn't move a dam from the anus to the vulva because bacteria that live harmlessly in the anus can cause infection in the vagina. Does public hair matter? Pubic hair doesn't matter too much, though there may be some rearranging to be done to enable the dam to directly touch the vulva and allow stimulation from lips and the tongue. Remember the dam can only protect the area it is covering, so, for example if someone with pubic lice was receiving oral sex, it would be possible for this to be passed on to a partner if there is hair to hair contact beyond the edges of the dam. If you stick to the middle of the dam, it should be big enough to provide protection. If you've fashioned a condom or latex glove into a dam, just be careful if the surface area isn't quite as big as a regular dam would be. SEE ALSO: This Is The Perfect Response When Someone Says They Don't Use Condoms Young People And Gay Men Should Be Given Free Condoms 'To Reduce STIs' 10 Awful Sex Education Lessons That Will Make You Cringe What do dams protect against? In the same way as condoms, dams form a physical barrier to prevent STIs (bacterial, viral and parasitic) from being passed from one person to another. Generally the risk of STIs associated with oral sex is less than vaginal or anal sex, but some STIs are more easily passed on during oral sex than others. These include Herpes simplex (which causes genital herpes), gonorrhoea and syphilis. Why aren't they offered as much as condoms? Dams possibly aren't offered as much as condoms because people don't ask for them as much, and perhaps because the risk of STIs with oral sex is not as well known or commonly talked about. However we know that oral sex is very popular. In one of the biggest studies into sexual behaviour in Britain, 70% of 16-24-year-old women and 80% of 25 to 34-year-old women. Among men, figures were almost the same:71% of 16 to 24-year-olds and 80% of 25 to 34-year olds said they'd given or received oral sex in the last year. In the FPA Sexual Health Week survey, most people said they hadn't learned about the risk of STIs and oral sex when they were at school, and the majority said they didn't know STIs could be passed on during oral sex.

How much do they cost? Bought on their own, dams are around Â£1 to Â£1.50, depending on the kind, or it's possible to get multipacks more cheaply. They are also free from some clinics. Can they break? A dam shouldn't break just from being used as a protective barrier during oral sex. However, some can be damaged by lubricants, depending on the material. You can use water-based lubricants with latex dams, and it is safe to use oil-based lubricants with polyurethane dams. Using lube can help make receiving oral sex more pleasurable. What flavours are there? Dams come in a whole range of flavours including chocolate, blueberry, mint (tingly), banana, vanilla, grape and cola - to name a few. What do they feel like? In a similar way to condoms, dams won't make the user feel like they are directly touching a partner's genital area with their lips or tongue, and vice versa. But they are thin enough to enable pleasure and stimulation, which means you can still enjoy great oral sex. Knowing you're protected from STIs can actually make oral sex feel even better as you can relax a bit more.
TITLE: Oral Dams: We Asked Experts The Questions You're Too Afraid To Ask

El problema, relata el administrador del 58, era que la estructura de celdas solares del edificio derrumbado quedÃ³ "volando", lo que significaba que habÃ­a posibilidades de caer en el inmueble conjunto, ademÃ¡s de que los severos daÃ±os en el nÃºmero 56 tambiÃ©n hacÃ­an latente el derrumbe total y, por lo tanto, un peligro para los vecinos.
Nos dijeron que esa estructura hasta el momento no ha colapsado, pero en cualquier momento podrÃ­a llegarse a caer hacia el edificio de a lado, que es el 58", dijo Erick JimÃ©nez, administraciÃ³n del edificio.
El que se derrumbÃ³ tenÃ­a nueve meses de haber sido entregado a los propietarios; el de a lado, el nÃºmero 58, tenÃ­a tres aÃ±os de ser habitado.

TEXT:
Aunque su edificio no tiene ni una ventana rota, los vecinos del condominio que se derrumbÃ³ tras el sismo en la calle de Zapata 56, en la colonia Portales Sur, tienen mÃ¡s de un mes sin poder regresar a su casa.

El martes 19 de septiembre, luego de que un sismo de magnitud 7.1 sacudiÃ³ en Ciudad de MÃ©xico, una tercera parte del edificio "Residencial San JosÃ©", en la calle de Zapata 56, se derrumbÃ³. Dentro quedaron atrapadas en los escombros dos mujeres, de 30 y 63 aÃ±os, que trabajaban en labores de limpieza en uno de los departamentos.

En el inmueble de a lado, con el nÃºmero 58, los habitantes tambiÃ©n habÃ­an desalojado sus casas en el momento del sismo, pero despuÃ©s no pudieron regresar a ellas, a pesar de que la estructura de su edificio no tenÃ­a daÃ±os.

El problema, relata el administrador del 58, era que la estructura de celdas solares del edificio derrumbado quedÃ³ "volando", lo que significaba que habÃ­a posibilidades de caer en el inmueble conjunto, ademÃ¡s de que los severos daÃ±os en el nÃºmero 56 tambiÃ©n hacÃ­an latente el derrumbe total y, por lo tanto, un peligro para los vecinos.

"En ProtecciÃ³n Civil nos hicieron una observaciÃ³n. Nos dijeron que esa estructura hasta el momento no ha colapsado, pero en cualquier momento podrÃ­a llegarse a caer hacia el edificio de a lado, que es el 58", dijo Erick JimÃ©nez, administraciÃ³n del edificio.

Los dos edificios son de muy reciente construcciÃ³n. El que se derrumbÃ³ tenÃ­a nueve meses de haber sido entregado a los propietarios; el de a lado, el nÃºmero 58, tenÃ­a tres aÃ±os de ser habitado. Uno se cayÃ³, en el otro no hubo ni una ventana rota.

Sin casa

Imagen de la estructura derrumbada en el edificio de Zapata 56.

Estar poco mÃ¡s de un mes sin hogar ha sido difÃ­cil para los vecinos de Zapata 58: algunos tuvieron que desplazarse a viviendas de familiares en zonas mucho mÃ¡s alejadas de sus trabajos; otros, sienten desesperaciÃ³n por no poder regresar a sus espacio, a su departamento; y los pocos inquilinos que pagaban una renta decidieron irse del edificio.

"Ha sido complicado. Yo estoy viviendo con uno de mis hijos, pero no es lo mismo estar en tu casa con las comodidades y facilidades de poder hacer lo que quieras en cuanto quieras, que estar en una casa ajena que aunque es de tu familia, hay que tener ciertos lÃ­mites para convivir", dijo Manuel Ruiz Carrillo, vecino del edificio Zapata 58 y lÃ­der del ComitÃ© de Seguridad Vecinal.

ExplicÃ³ que la experiencia de quedarse sin hogar fue mucho mÃ¡s dura para otros vecinos porque Ã©l ya es pensionado y no tiene que desplazarse todos los dÃ­a en la ciudad para ir a trabajar.

"Muchos de nuestros vecinos tienen muchos problemas por la lejanÃ­a a la que se fueron de sus trabajos. Yo no tengo trabajo, me conduzco con la facilidad de tiempo que requiero, pero la gran mayorÃ­a sÃ­ tiene sus ocupaciones y a todos los ha afectado sobremanera", dijo.

Ruiz Carrillo explicÃ³ que se realizaron dos revisiones al edificio: una privada hecha por un Director Responsable de Obra (DRO) y, la otra, es un dictamen de ProtecciÃ³n Civil de la delegaciÃ³n Benito JuÃ¡rez. TambiÃ©n asegurÃ³ que se avalÃ³ ante un notario que el inmueble de Zapata 58 "estÃ¡ en perfectas condiciones".

Acciones... un mes despuÃ©s

Los dÃ­as posteriores al sismo, los vecinos de Zapata 58 trataron de conseguir ayuda en la DelegaciÃ³n Benito JuÃ¡rez para que trabajadores pudieran retirar la estructura del edificio de a lado, reinstalar el servicio de gas y, con ello, poder regresar a sus departamentos.

Los vecinos reconocen que la demanda de ayuda era mucha en la delegaciÃ³n Benito JuÃ¡rez, la demarcaciÃ³n con el mayor nÃºmero de edificios daÃ±ados o derrumbados en la capital del paÃ­s: 334. La segunda con mÃ¡s daÃ±os fue la CuauhtÃ©moc, con 62, segÃºn datos del Atlas de Riesgos del Gobierno Federal.

Ante ninguna respuesta oficial a su peticiÃ³n, los vecinos de Zapata 58 colgaron una manta afuera de su edificio y cerraron una calle aledaÃ±a a las instalaciones de la delegaciÃ³n Benito JuÃ¡rez.

"No tenÃ­amos apoyo al principio, tuvieron que hacer los vecinos del 58 un plantÃ³n afuera de la delegaciÃ³n (Benito JuÃ¡rez). DespuÃ©s ya tuvimos un acercamiento y plÃ¡ticas, pero fue haciendo presiÃ³n", dijo Erick JimÃ©nez, administrador del edificio.

Un dÃ­a antes de que se cumpliera un mes del sismo, el miÃ©rcoles 18 de octubre, la delegaciÃ³n enviÃ³ trabajadores para retirar la estructura de celdas solares del edificio derrumbado, pero entre los vecinos del 58 aÃºn existe la preocupaciÃ³n del proceso de demoliciÃ³n.

"Esperemos que no haya daÃ±os, porque cuando empiecen a tirar el edificio eso podrÃ­a ocasionar", dijo Erick. "(A los vecinos) les preocupa que cuando lo estÃ©n tirando, si no lo hacen cuidadosamente, pueden llegar a afectar al edificio 58", dijo el administrador.

AÃºn con el retraso, los vecinos estÃ¡n agradecidos por las grÃºas y trabajadores que enviÃ³ la Benito JuÃ¡rez para retirar la estructura que pone en riesgo a su edificio.

"Nos hicieron el ofrecimiento de que iban a hacer lo necesario para ayudarnos y lo han hecho. Pensamos que podrÃ­a ser mÃ¡s rÃ¡pido, pero dentro de todos los problemas que hay en la ciudad creemos que con tres semanas o cuatro que se tardaron, estamos agradecidos", dijo el vecino Manuel Ruiz.

A pesar de que no hubo pÃ©rdidas de vidas ni daÃ±os materiales en su edificio, la incÃ³gnita sobre cuÃ¡ndo podrÃ¡n regresar a sus departamentos y sobre la construcciÃ³n del inmueble derrumbado sigue presente entre los vecinos, los otros afectados de Zapata 58.

"SÃ­ estÃ¡n afectados porque no pueden estar viviendo en su inmueble. Lamentablemente, la construcciÃ³n de a lado no la hicieron de forma correcta. Yo no soy experto en la materia, pero sÃ­ me parece que deberÃ­an poner mÃ¡s atenciÃ³n a los permisos de construcciÃ³n", dijo el administrador.
TITLE: Los otros afectados del edificio Zapata 56 que se derrumbÃ³ en el sismo

I've always been a traditionalist, my friends at school used to laugh at my 'old fashioned ways'.
Should we take be taking further steps in settling our children (and us) into the school community?
Was the first thing you thought about a material thing or was it time you spent with your parents?
Super Mum, Super Nurse, & Super Tired!
In reality, we're just like any other family where one parent has to have time away with work.
TEXT:
Why Our Children Need Us To Love Ourselves... As parents we cannot take all responsibility all the time for the meaning our children create from everything they experience, but we can support them to feel loved and to create more feelings of love in their life. Transformational Guide, Coach, Social Entrepreneur, Writer, Speaker.

A Journey Through IVF And Beyond I was walking hand in hand with Keith, bum poking out from my hospital gown, cheeks clenched so not to shoot out my pessary, wrists labelled up like a lab rat, and we had an entourage of unfamiliar faces watching, as we dragged our third wheel, infertility down the corridor for the last time. Writer and poet

He's Leaving Home - What next? I've always been a traditionalist, my friends at school used to laugh at my 'old fashioned ways'. As a parent the educational path of your child is pretty traditional and easy to follow, you have lots of messy fun with them and then off to school until, well pretty much until they leave home. So off we both went on to another stage of our lives. Comedy Writer & Performer , Blogger, Presenter & Head of Drama on Community Radio

Starting School: Different Families So, do those of us with 'different families' feel any additional anxiety surrounding their children starting school? Should we take be taking further steps in settling our children (and us) into the school community? Mother of Two | Director of Family Facilitation | TechPixie

The Family We Built In a big family house by the sea, I watch my four-year-old blonde daughter launch herself across the couch to gleefully 'body slam' her doppleganger blonde father. One and the same Mr Happy our sperm donor, Scott is now my husband and Leila's dad. Author of How I Met Your Father - the true story of a woman who overcame tragic losses to find love and happiness in a most unexpected way.

How Home-Schooling Can Help Families To Thrive! Over eight years ago, my family started a new journey: Home Education. It was a journey ahead that felt extremely frightening, as I knew I would be wholly responsibility for my children's learning, and super exciting as I knew that there would be many adventures ahead! Lisa is a blogger, she writes at www.AnOrdinary-Life.blogspot.co.uk Lisa writes about Homeschooling and Step by Step educational resources!

How Can You Tell If Your Parenting Is Good Enough? We get so carried away with making everything perfect all the time. Trying to reach that elusive parenting dream, thrust upon us by advertising. We forget that it's not the big gestures. It's that cuddle, that story, that time spent together. Think back to your childhood memories. Was the first thing you thought about a material thing or was it time you spent with your parents? Super Mum, Super Nurse, & Super Tired!

A Letter To My Little Boy, Whatever The Weather There was a moment when I knew, beyond any doubt, what it meant to be your mother. But it wasn't the day you were born. It wasn't the first time I knew about you, even - a long-awaited pink line forming in front of my eyes as I sat, perched on the edge of the cold bath, waiting. Editor, writer, blogger, wife and mother

Living Beyond The Norm. What It's Like Being The Family To A Big Wave Surfer His drive and focus is what keeps him going and we know that whenever he goes away, whether it is for a few days or a few weeks, he'll always be back to make up for lost time. In reality, we're just like any other family where one parent has to have time away with work. It's just that ours involves a little bit more risk and adventure. Globe-trotter | Mother of two | Married to a big wave surfer

Me, The Boys And The Game Of Cricket At the moment, I am the Dad who watches from the sideline. From the point of view of a thriving family, we have found a sport that both our sons seem to want to play, One of the great things about cricket is the way that it can make a family feel part of a community and a community spirit. Lecturer. Sport. Medical matters. Sport and medical matters.

Why I've Stopped Reading Parenting Articles I've found recently the amount of articles explaining what NOT to do is becoming overwhelming and actually hindering me to the point of utter indecision. We are bombarded daily by articles telling us how to parent Stay at home Mum and writer

To The Partner Of The Parent At Home So, my point here is that as the partner of a parent at home, you, whether you realise it or not, provide much of that validation. Next to our children, you are the most important people in our lives. You are the other half of this parenting team and your opinion means a LOT Stay at home Mum and writer

I Am An Older Mum. Get Over It (Everyone)! When I look back on this wobbly route to motherhood I am heartened to learn that far from damaging my child by being older I am potentially giving him a better life by virtue of me being wealthier, more stable and experienced. Clinical Psychologist, part time writer, people person and mother. Passionate about sharing psychological science with human beings.

What Makes A Strong-Mum? So what is a 'Strong Mum'? We throw these words around as if it's a description, when in actual fact there doesn't seem to be a way to define the term. I think it's clear that being strong isn't just about lifting weights and eating healthy, there are times when in order to be strong you have to make a tough decision, or be brave when you're scared or juggle multiple activities. Health & Fitness Expert, Pre & Postnatal Exercise Specialist & Wellness Commentator

Families Must Adapt To Thrive The dynamics of families can change, the dynamics will switch and I'm very lucky that within the Harper clan this has always been how we've worked. A family can only work if it adjusts itself to suit each person in it. Theatre Director, Tutor, Writer, Son, Brother, Partner and Friend.

TEXT:
Der Berliner Farid Boucher wird in der U-Bahn von einer Frau dazu aufgefordert, sich nicht neben sie zu setzen

Er entschlieÃŸt sich dazu, seine Erlebnisse aufzuschreiben, da er eine Bitte an alle Menschen in Deutschland hat

Im Video oben seht ihr, wie alltÃ¤glich Rassismus in Deutschland ist

Eigentlich ist es nicht meine Art, Dinge, die mich persÃ¶nlich betreffen, jedem auf die Nase zu binden. Aber dieses Mal muss ich es einfach tun. Und ich hoffe, es hilft, euch alle wachzurÃ¼tteln und klarzumachen: Nein, es ist nicht alles okay in unserem Land.

Es passiert immer Ã¶fter, was mir passiert ist.

Vor einigen Tagen stieg ich in Berlin an der SamariterstraÃŸe in die U5 Richtung Alexanderplatz. Die Bahn war ziemlich voll. Ich setzte mich auf einen der Klappsitze, weil ich dachte, das sei fÃ¼r alle FahrgÃ¤ste platztechnisch das Angenehmste.

Auf dem Sitz neben mir saÃŸ eine groÃŸe Frau mit weiÃŸem Haar, blauen Augen und einem Buch in der Hand. Ich schÃ¤tzte sie auf Ende 50, Anfang 60. Uns gegenÃ¼ber saÃŸen zwei blonde Jungs um die 18 Jahre alt, direkt neben uns standen zwei dunkelhÃ¤utige Jungs im selben Alter.

"Das ist mein Land. Ich will nicht, dass so jemand wie du neben mir sitzt"

Kaum hatte ich Platz genommen, drehte sich die Frau zu mir und sagte mit eiskalter Miene: "Es sind noch andere PlÃ¤tze frei". UnglÃ¤ubig, perplex und in dunkler Vorahnung, was gleich folgen kÃ¶nnte, fragte ich, bemÃ¼ht um Freundlichkeit: "Wie bitte?". Sie darauf: "Warum setzt du dich neben mich? Das ist mein Land. Ich will nicht, dass so jemand wie du neben mir sitzt."

So langsam wurden auch andere FahrgÃ¤ste auf unsere Konversation aufmerksam.

Ich erwiderte der Frau: "Nun, wissen Sie, mir scheint, als sei das einzig und allein Ihr Problem, und wie Sie bereits treffend bemerkt haben: Es sind noch andere PlÃ¤tze frei. Es hindert sie also niemand daran, sich umzusetzen." Sie: "Ja du bist ein ganz Schlauer, was? Du armer brauner Wicht." Ich: "Die einzige Person, die mir ein brauner Wicht zu sein scheint, sind Sie."

Die beiden blonden Jungs gegenÃ¼ber lachten lautstark, andere schmunzelten, einige schienen mich fÃ¼r das Problem zu halten.

Einer der beiden dunkelhÃ¤utigen Jungs sagte zu mir: "Lass es, das ist es nicht wert." Ich sagte ihm, dass es das sehr wohl wert sei und dass ich mit niemandem ein Problem habe, aber anscheinend jemand mit mir.

Einige schienen noch immer mich fÃ¼r den StÃ¶rfaktor zu halten

Mittlerweile kam es mir vor, als blitzten die Augen der Frau vor Hass. "Wo kommst du kleiner Wicht Ã¼berhaupt her?", fragte sie mich. Ich antwortete ihr: "Ich bin Deutscher. Nicht, dass Sie das etwas anginge." Sie: "Ja klar. Ach komm, guck dich doch mal an. Und deine Eltern?" Ich: "Die sind ebenfalls Deutsche" Dann gab es fÃ¼r die Frau kein Halten mehr: "Ja klar, auf dem Papier, du...."

An dieser Stelle fing sie an, in einer Sprache auf mich einzureden, die ich nicht ganz verstand. Ich bin jedoch sicher, dass es ein plattdeutscher Dialekt war.

Ich entgegnete ihr daraufhin, dass sie schon Deutsch mit mir reden mÃ¼sse, wenn sie denn wolle, dass ich sie verstehe. Daraufhin fingen ein paar mehr Leute an zu kichern, die Jungs gegenÃ¼ber konnten sich kaum halten und ein, zwei schienen immer noch mich fÃ¼r den StÃ¶rfaktor zu halten.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: "Alle FlÃ¼chtlinge sind doch schwarz!" - was es bedeutet, in Deutschland dunkelhÃ¤utig zu sein

Die Dame wurde immer wÃ¼tender, fing erneut an, mich auf Plattdeutsch zu beschimpfen. Dann sagte sie, dass die Zeiten sich sowieso wieder zugunsten der "wahren Deutschen" Ã¤ndern wÃ¼rden.

Ich wurde immer fassungsloser, was sich da abspielte. Ich wollte mich aber auf keinen Fall von ihr unterkriegen lassen, entschied mich, auf eine Mischung aus AufklÃ¤rung und verbalem Konter zu setzen.

"Das kÃ¶nnen wir ja mal abwarten. Das letzte Mal, als ich nachgesehen habe, waren die Nazis diejenigen, die eine Niederlage einstecken mussten. Und dass wird auch wieder so kommen. Deutsche wie ich werden dafÃ¼r sorgen", setzte ich ihr entgegen.

"Was lesen Sie da eigentlich? Mein Kampf?"

Daraufhin erwiderte sie, dass sich ihresgleichen darum kÃ¼mmern wÃ¼rden, dass das beim nÃ¤chsten Mal anders laufe. Verschwunden seien die Nazis ja sowieso nie. Die hÃ¤tten noch immer wichtige Positionen und Ã„mter inne.

Nun war der Vorhang endgÃ¼ltig gefallen. Ich hatte es also mit einem waschechten Nazi zu tun: "Ach, sieh mal an, war doch nicht so schwierig, kommen Sie, nur keine Scheu, lassen Sie es raus. Geil Massenmord, gell? Geil, Genozid gell?"

Sie: "Ja ja, du wirst schon sehen, die Ã–fen sind noch intakt." Ja, wirklich, das hat sie ernsthaft gesagt.

Ich: "Was lesen Sie da eigentlich? Mein Kampf?"

Die Menschen um uns herum konnten sich kaum halten vor Lachen. Angebracht war das vielleicht nicht, aber immerhin trug es zur Frustration der Frau bei, was mir ehrlich gesagt Genugtuung verschaffte. Sie fing wieder an, mich als kleinen braunen Mann zu bezeichnen.

Ich wollte es noch einmal vermittelnd versuchen. "Wissen Sie, was traurig ist? Wir sitzen eigentlich im selben Boot und ich glaube, Sie hassen mich auch eigentlich gar nicht wirklich. Sie hassen das, was 'die da oben' machen, davon sind Sie und er und er und sie und ich alle gleichermaÃŸen betroffen, sagte ich und zeigte auf andere Menschen in der NÃ¤he. Aber anstatt dass Sie sich gegen die Ursachen Ihrer Probleme wehren, schlagen Sie immer nach unten auf die, die es noch beschissener haben."

Ich zeigte auf die Frau und sagte: "Nazi, nicht Deutsche"

Sie sei nicht sauer auf mich, sondern auf Deutschland, pflichtete mir einer der beiden dunkelhÃ¤utigen Jungs bei.

Inzwischen hatte es der Frau die Sprache verschlagen. Ich stand von meinem Sitz auf, gab den beiden blonden Jungs die Hand, gab den beiden dunkelhÃ¤utigen Jungs die Hand, zeigte nacheinander auf sie alle und sagte: "Deutscher, Deutscher, Deutscher, Deutscher." Dann zeigte ich auf mich und sagte: "Deutscher". Ich zeigte auf die Frau und sagte: "Nazi. Nicht Deutsche".

Ich wollte mich wieder hinsetzen, doch die Frau versuchte, mit ihrem Arm den Sitz zu blockieren. Davon lieÃŸ ich mich nicht abbringen und klappte den Sitz wieder runter.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Ich bin dunkelhÃ¤utig und Deutsche - trotzdem werde ich oft wie eine Fremde behandelt



Den Rest der Fahrt starrte sie mich schweigend an. Beim Ausstieg an der Endstation Alexanderplatz beleidigte sie noch die beiden dunkelhÃ¤utigen Jungs als Affen. Die versuchten, es gelassen zu nehmen.

Einer der beiden sagte: "Ja ich bin ein Affe. SchÃ¤tzen Sie sich doch glÃ¼cklich, normalerweise begegnet man denen nur im Zoo" und fÃ¼gten in meine Richtung hinzu, es sei schade, dass ich kein Politiker sei - ihre Stimme hÃ¤tte ich.

Ich bin froh, dass mir das passiert ist und nicht jemand anderem

Ich bin froh, dass mir das passiert ist und nicht jemand anderem, denn ich weiÃŸ mich zu wehren. Es war auch nicht das erste Mal, dass ich so etwas erlebt habe. Trotz Wut, EnttÃ¤uschung und Fassungslosigkeit hat mich das Erlebnis gestÃ¤rkt.

Doch etwas ganz anderes bereitet mir Sorgen. Jeden Tag sind viel zu viele Leute von solchen fremdenfeindlichen Attacken betroffen. Viele davon reagieren darauf nicht so selbstbewusst wie ich. Vielen von ihnen hilft keiner. Sie werden zurÃ¼ckgelassen mit einem GefÃ¼hl von Ohnmacht, Isolation, Angst.

Ich habe eine Bitte: Lasst uns gemeinsam dafÃ¼r einstehen, dass unser gesellschaftliches Klima nicht immer weiter verroht. Lasst uns wachsam sein, andere unterstÃ¼tzen.

Und wenn ihr solche Angriffe seht, mÃ¶gen sie verbaler oder kÃ¶rperlicher Art sein, helft den Betroffenen, sich zu wehren. Und zeigt ihnen, dass Deutschland besser ist.

Der Text wurde aufgezeichnet von Uschi Jonas.



Oft schauen wir auf gesellschaftliche Entwicklungen nur aus einer abstrakten Perspektive: Experten sprechen Ã¼ber Probleme anhand von Studien. Politiker loben, was gut lÃ¤uft, anhand von grauen Statistiken - all das hat mit dem Alltag der Menschen, die von diesen Entwicklungen betroffen sind oder sie prÃ¤gen, oft wenig zu tun. Diese Menschen kommen jetzt in der HuffPost zu Wort. Denn wie fÃ¼hlt sich Armut in einem reichen Land jenseits der Statistiken an? Wie sieht Deutschland aus der Perspektive eines Obdachlosen aus? Vor welchen Problemen steht ein gerade angekommener FlÃ¼chtling? Wer hat mit seiner Initiative ein gravierendes Problem gelÃ¶st? All das ist Thema in HuffPost-Voices. Diskutiert mit und schickt uns eure Erlebnisse an Blog@huffingtonpost.de.

#MeToo geht um die Welt. Unter dem Hashtag posten gerade Frauen auf der ganzen Welt ihre Erfahrungen mit sexueller BelÃ¤stigung und Gewalt.

Trotz dieser erschreckenden Zahl, trotz vieler Aktionen zum Thema sexuelle Gewalt gegen Frauen, ignorieren viele Menschen noch immer das Problem.

Deshalb will die HuffPost dem Problem ein Gesicht geben. Frauen haben uns erzÃ¤hlt, was ihnen widerfahren ist. Wir wollen damit darauf aufmerksam machen, wie furchtbar allgegenwÃ¤rtig sexuelle BelÃ¤stigung und sexuelle Gewalt fÃ¼r viele Frauen in unserem Land sind.

TEXT:
Brian Conley is the latest star to be eliminated from â€˜Strictly Come Dancingâ€™.

The comedian became the fourth celeb to be voted off the BBC dance show after losing out in the dance off with chef Simon Rimmer on Sunday night.

Simon and his dance partner Karen Clifton performed their Charleston to â€˜Fit As A Fiddle (And Ready For Love)â€™ by Gene Kelly and Brian and Amy Dowden did their Jive to â€˜Itâ€™s Not Unusualâ€™ by Tom Jones.

BBC Brian (right) faced Simon Rimmer in the dreaded dance off.

Choosing to save Simon and Karen, Craig Revel Horwood said: â€œWell both couples actually made mistakes in that, one fell-over and then the other one blanked before they went into a back-drop so it made it a really, really difficult choice. But the couple I am going to save just for that little bit of swivel is Simon and Karen.â€

Darcey Bussell also chose to save Simon and Karen, saying: â€œThis is incredibly difficult with these two fabulous men and itâ€™s not easy at all to choose between them. But I am going to save the person who had a more finished performance which was Simon and Karen.â€

BBC

Head Judge Shirley Ballas agreed with her fellow judges and said she too would have saved Simon and Karen.

When asked by host Tess Daly if he had enjoyed his time on the show, Brian said: â€œI have loved everything about this, I truly have. Itâ€™s one of the greatest shows, itâ€™s a family show. And you know what, there has been someone by my side all the way through this journey who has been just there every moment and that is... Aston! I love him and I am really going to miss him (laughs).â€

BBC

Brian continued: â€œI want to say something about this lady here. Amy, if I was only thirty years younger... and not fussy! Me and you, I am not kidding! I love this lady and I want her to be on this show for ever and ever because I want everyone out there to know how special this lady is because she is a star and I love her to bits.â€

The remaining eleven couples will take to the dancefloor again next week for the much-loved Halloween special.

10 Celebs You Forgot Had Done 'Strictly'
TITLE: â€˜Strictly Come Dancingâ€™: Brian Conley Is The Fourth Celeb To Leave The Competition
2011 Game Changers

Die ZwangsmaÃŸnahmen Madrids weist er als "Putsch" zurÃ¼ck

Der katalanische Regierungschef Carles Puigdemont will sich der spanischen Zentralregierung nicht beugen. In einer Fernseh-Ansprache am Samstagabend in Barcelona wies er die beschlossenen MaÃŸnahmen Madrids mit scharfen Worten zurÃ¼ck.

Er bezeichnete sie gar als "Putsch" sowie als "inakzeptablen Angriff auf die Demokratie". Es sei die "schlimmste Attacke" gegen Katalonien seit der Diktatur von Francisco Franco (1939-1975), sagte Puigdemont.

Puigdemont will "weiter kÃ¤mpfen"

Der spanische MinisterprÃ¤sident Mariano Rajoy hatte zuvor am Samstag unter anderem die Absetzung der katalanischen Regierung sowie die Ausrufung von Neuwahlen zum Regionalparlament innerhalb der nÃ¤chsten sechs Monaten angekÃ¼ndigt.



Dazu sagte Puigdemont: "Die Absetzung einer demokratisch gewÃ¤hlten Regierung ist mit einem Rechtsstaat unvereinbar." Man werde aber "weiter kÃ¤mpfen", beteuerte der Katalane ohne Bekanntgabe von MaÃŸnahmen.

Puigdemont will das katalanische Regionalparlament zu einer Sitzung einberufen, um Ã¼ber die Krise zu beraten, berichtet die Nachrichtenagentur AFP.

â€œDas Schiff fÃ¼r die Ãœberfahrt ist sehr groÃŸ, es gibt sogar einen Pool und ein Kino an Bord.â€â–º MenschenhÃ¤ndler nutzen hÃ¤ufig die Ã¤ltesten und billigsten Boote, die sie bekommen kÃ¶nnen.
Auch wenn es ein Bedarf an ausgebildeten FachkrÃ¤ften gibt, werden Migranten, die Deutschland illegal erreichen, keinen Job bekommen.

TEXT:
Eine Internetseite der Bundesregierung klÃ¤rt Ã¼ber die sieben grÃ¶ÃŸten LÃ¼gen unter FlÃ¼chtlingen auf

Die Mythen werden von Schleusern in Nordafrika und im Nahen Osten verbreitet, um FlÃ¼chtlinge zur Ãœberfahrt nach Europa zu motivieren

Dadurch sollen nicht allein die Schleuser die Deutungshoheit im Netz besitzen

Tausende FlÃ¼chtlinge wagen noch immer jeden Monat die lebensgefÃ¤hrliche Ãœberfahrt Ã¼ber das Mittelmeer. In der Hoffnung auf ein besseres Leben in Europa â€“ und oft mit vÃ¶llig fehlgeleiteten Vorstellungen vom Leben in ihren ZiellÃ¤ndern.

Die Bundesregierung verstÃ¤rkt nun ihren Kampf gegen systematisch von Schleuserbanden verbreitete Fehlinformationen.

An diesem Montag soll die Internetseite â€œRumoursAboutGermany.infoâ€ freigeschaltet werden, auf der den falschen GerÃ¼chten Ã¼ber die Aufnahme von FlÃ¼chtlingen in Deutschland Fakten gegenÃ¼bergestellt werden. Die Informationen werden auf Arabisch, FranzÃ¶sisch und Deutsch verbreitet.

"Wir wollen verhindern, dass sich Menschen in ohnehin schwieriger Lage mit verklÃ¤rten Vorstellungen und falschen Erwartungen auf den Weg machen", erklÃ¤rte das AuswÃ¤rtige Amt zum Start der Internetseite. "Deshalb setzen wir der brodelnden GerÃ¼chtekÃ¼che objektive Informationen entgegen."

Die sieben grÃ¶ÃŸten LÃ¼gen der Schleuser â€“ und die Antworten des AuÃŸenministeriums

Auf der Seite werden die "sieben grÃ¶ÃŸten LÃ¼gen der Schleuser" aufgelistet, die Ã¼ber das FlÃ¼chtlingsziel Deutschland und den Weg dorthin verbreitet werden:

1. â€œDas Schiff fÃ¼r die Ãœberfahrt ist sehr groÃŸ, es gibt sogar einen Pool und ein Kino an Bord.â€

â–º MenschenhÃ¤ndler nutzen hÃ¤ufig die Ã¤ltesten und billigsten Boote, die sie bekommen kÃ¶nnen. Viele dieser Boote sind kaum seetauglich. Dadurch kÃ¶nnen die Schleuser ihren Profit maximieren. Allein 2016 starben mehr als 5000 Menschen, als sie das Mittelmeer in solchen Booten Ã¼berquerten.

2. "Deutschland hat 800.000 PlÃ¤tze alleine fÃ¼r afghanische FlÃ¼chtlinge reserviert."

â–º Falsch! Es gibt keine Kontingente fÃ¼r FlÃ¼chtlinge aus bestimmten LÃ¤ndern, jeder Fall wird individuell betrachtet. Nur in besonderen FÃ¤llen gibt es Kontingente fÃ¼r FlÃ¼chtlinge. Wie zum Beispiel in den Jahren 2013 und 2014 fÃ¼r syrische Asylsuchende.

3. â€œWir haben 25 Jahre Erfahrung und der Transport nach Europa ist 100 Prozent legal und ausfÃ¼hrbar.â€

â–º MenschenhÃ¤ndler sind Kriminelle und nur an Deinem Geld interessiert, nicht an Deinem Leben! Tausende von Migranten ohne Asylgrund werden jedes Jahr abgeschoben. Und traurigerweise sterben viele auf der gefÃ¤hrlichen Ãœberfahrt.

4. â€œGroÃŸe deutsche Unternehmen brauchen stÃ¤ndig neue FachkrÃ¤fte, sodass Deutschland tÃ¤glich 5000 Migranten einstellt.â€

â–º Auch falsch. Es existiert keine Arbeitsquote fÃ¼r Migranten. Auch wenn es ein Bedarf an ausgebildeten FachkrÃ¤ften gibt, werden Migranten, die Deutschland illegal erreichen, keinen Job bekommen. Beachte auch, dass die deutsche Regierung keine Jobs fÃ¼r FlÃ¼chtlinge bereitstellt.

5. "Jeder FlÃ¼chtling erhÃ¤lt ein Willkommensgeld von 2000 Euro."

â–º Entgegen der GerÃ¼chte und Falschinformationen, die absichtlich von MenschenhÃ¤ndlern verbreitet werden, stellt Deutschland kein Willkommensgeld bereit. Durch die Verbreitung solcher LÃ¼gen bringen die MenschenhÃ¤ndler das Leben von Menschen bewusst in Gefahr.

6. "Deutschland schenkt jedem FlÃ¼chtling ein Haus."

â–º Niemand wird ein eigenes Haus geschenkt. Fakt ist, dass es in Deutschland immer schwieriger wird, einen Platz zum Leben zu finden, vor allem in GroÃŸstÃ¤dten. Beachte auch, dass du deinen Wohnort nicht frei entscheiden kannst, solange du Asyl suchst, und du mÃ¶glicherweise an einem abgelegenen Platz bleiben musst, an dem niemand deine Sprache versteht.

7. "Wenn es Dir in Deutschland nicht gefÃ¤llt, geben Sie Dir einfach ein Visum fÃ¼r Kanada."

â–º Das ist vÃ¶lliger Schwachsinn. Es gibt keinerlei Vereinbarung zwischen Deutschland und Kanada oder irgendeinem anderen Land fÃ¼r solche FÃ¤lle."

GroÃŸplakate in Afghanistan, Pakistan und Afrika

"Das wichtigste Ziel der Kampagne #RumoursAboutGermany ist es, die Deutungshoheit im Netz nicht allein den Schleusern zu Ã¼berlassen", heiÃŸt es im AuswÃ¤rtigen Amt.

Die neue Internetseite ist Teil einer Kampagne, die seit 2015 lÃ¤uft. In Afghanistan, Pakistan, Nord- und Westafrika wurde mit GroÃŸplakaten, Buswerbung, Blogs, TV- und Radiosendungen AufklÃ¤rungsarbeit betrieben. Die neue Internetseite soll die bisherigen AktivitÃ¤ten der Kampagne im Netz bÃ¼ndeln.

TEXT:
Die Harvard Medical School konnte fÃ¼nf Lebensmittel ausmachen, die sowohl Hirn- als auch Herzfunktionen unterstÃ¼tzen

Dies ist besonders wichtig, um Krankheiten im Alter vorzubeugen

Die gesamte Liste seht ihr auch im Video oben

In einer Studie der Harvard Medical School wurden fÃ¼nf Lebensmittel festgestellt, die nicht nur das Herz gesund halten, sondern auch die LeistungsfÃ¤higkeit unseres Gehirns nachhaltig verbessern.

Generell empfehlen die Mediziner eine ausgewogene ErnÃ¤hrung aus FrÃ¼chten, GemÃ¼se, Getreide und HÃ¼lsenfrÃ¼chten, dazu Fett aus Fisch und OlivenÃ¶l.

Diese ErnÃ¤hrungsweise kann helfen, ohne Medikamente Alterskrankheiten vorzubeugen. Gesondert nennen die Mediziner allerdings auch noch einmal fÃ¼nf Lebensmittel, die besonders gut fÃ¼r Herz und Hirn sein sollen.

â–º 1. GrÃ¼nes GemÃ¼se

Spinat, GrÃ¼nkohl oder Brokkoli kÃ¶nnen das Gehirn dabei unterstÃ¼tzen, so lange wie mÃ¶glich fit zu bleiben, denn sie sind reich an Vitamin K, Lutein, FolsÃ¤ure und Beta-Carotin.



â–º 2. Fettfische oder Avocado

Zu den Fettfischen gehÃ¶ren unter anderem Hering, Sardine oder Wels. Diese enthalten wertvolle Omega-3 FettsÃ¤uren sowie ungesÃ¤ttigte FettsÃ¤uren. Diese kÃ¶nnen die Beta-Amyloid Konzentration senken. Dabei handelt es sich um das Protein, das zu schÃ¤dlichen Ablagerungen im Gehirn fÃ¼hrt, die in Folge Alzheimer verursachen kÃ¶nnten.

Die Experten empfehlen, zwei Mal pro Woche Fisch zu essen, am besten mit niedrigem Quecksilber-Anteil (Lachs oder Thunfisch). Vegetarier kÃ¶nnen fÃ¼r den gleichen gesundheitlichen Nutzen zu Flohsamen oder Avocados greifen.



â–º 3. Beeren

Ebenfalls durch eine Studie aus Harvard belegt ist die Wirkung, die Beeren auf das GedÃ¤chtnis haben. Ein Stoff namens Flavonoid gibt den Beeren ihre Farbe und hilft, gegen GedÃ¤chtnisprobleme anzukÃ¤mpfen - vor allem bei Frauen.



â–º 4. Kaffee

Eine Studie des "Journal of Nutritionâ€ legt nahe, dass die Teilnehmer, die tÃ¤glich Koffein konsumierten aufmerksamer und konzentrierter waren. Ihr KurzzeitgedÃ¤chtnis war ebenfalls besser, als das der Probanden ohne Koffein.

â–º 5. WalnÃ¼sse

NÃ¼sse liefern sowohl Proteine als auch gesunde Fette. Die Walnuss hilft sogar dem GedÃ¤chtnis. SUMMARY:
Mothers who give birth in the winter or spring months are less likely to suffer with postnatal depression (PND) than women who deliver during the summer or autumn, according to a new study.
Whereas in the winter, it is more seasonally appropriate to spend lots of time at home, and have people visiting you.
And women with a higher body mass index (BMI) were more likely to suffer with postnatal depression because they required more outpatient follow-ups and had more pregnancy-related complications, affecting their maternal outlook.
Postnatal depression, which affects 10% of women in the UK within a year of giving birth, is classified by the NHS as a â€œcommonâ€ type of depression.
PANDAS Foundation managing director, Donna Collins, told HuffPost UK that mums should be honest and upfront if they are feeling this way.
TEXT:
Mothers who give birth in the winter or spring months are less likely to suffer with postnatal depression (PND) than women who deliver during the summer or autumn, according to a new study.

These findings might seem counterintuitive as we often associate colder, darker months with worsening mental health, especially for those with seasonal affective disorder - linked to lack of light and Vitamin D exposure.

But the research found that having a child with a birthday in this half of the calendar actually goes some way to â€œprotectingâ€ mothers against the illness.

Summer Yukata via Getty Images

The study did not explore the reason for this difference but the research team from Brigham and Womenâ€™s Hospital, Boston, US, theorised that this is could be because regardless of when your baby is born, new mothers will find themselves spending more time at home.

During the summer this could leave you feeling alone and distanced from social activities that require time spent outside.

Whereas in the winter, it is more seasonally appropriate to spend lots of time at home, and have people visiting you.

Additionally, friends and family are less likely to have holidays abroad booked, meaning they rally around with greater psychological support in the colder months, according to the team.

The research, which reviewed medical records of over 20,000 women, wasnâ€™t just looking at time of delivery, but many other factors including race, pregnancy duration, and motherâ€™s weight, that can increase likelihood of PND.

Jie Zhou, lead study author, said: â€œWe wanted to find out whether there are certain factors influencing the risk of developing postpartum depression that may be avoided to improve womenâ€™s health both physically and mentally.â€

They also found that the longer your pregnancy lasts, the less likely you are to suffer PND.

â€œIt is expected that the mother will do better and be less mentally stressed when delivering a mature, healthy baby,â€ said Zhou.

Not having anaesthesia (such as an epidural) during delivery also increases your risk, possibly because the pain associated with labour may have been traumatising.

There was no link between delivery mode and risk factor. Caucasian women also had a lower risk compared to women of other races.

And women with a higher body mass index (BMI) were more likely to suffer with postnatal depression because they required more outpatient follow-ups and had more pregnancy-related complications, affecting their maternal outlook.

Postnatal depression, which affects 10% of women in the UK within a year of giving birth, is classified by the NHS as a â€œcommonâ€ type of depression. It can also affect fathers and partners, although this is less common.

Symptoms are a persistent feeling of sadness and low mood, lack of enjoyment and interest in the wider world, lack of energy and feeling tired all the time, difficulty bonding with your baby and withdrawing contact from other people.

Although this can just be â€˜baby bluesâ€™ which is a short-term feeling of low mood that can last up to two weeks after delivery. If your symptoms have persisted for longer than this, then you might have postnatal depression.

PANDAS Foundation managing director, Donna Collins, told HuffPost UK that mums should be honest and upfront if they are feeling this way.

â€œItâ€™s very hard to bare your soul to people you donâ€™t know very well,â€ she said. â€œTake someone with you to an appointment who you can trust or, if you canâ€™t say the words, write it down and give it to the healthcare professional.â€

Useful websites and helplines:
TITLE: Mums Who Give Birth In Winter And Spring Are Less Likely To Have Postnatal Depression

SUMMARY:
In light of the countless number of women using the hashtag #MeToo to share their stories of sexual harassment, one woman has turned attention to one form of harassment that is often overlooked: shaming breastfeeding moms.
"Speaking of sexual violence how is telling a woman and child to cover up not sexual violence?
Stop sexualizing breastfeeding," mom Diana Channing wrote on Instagram.
Since boobs are considered a sexual body part, breastfeeding in public has become taboo because people sexualize the act.
Thus, Channing notes that shaming mothers for nursing their babies can be considered sexual harassment because the comments are not only unwanted, but uncalled for â€” similar to comments made to women who are catcalled.
TEXT:
In light of the countless number of women using the hashtag #MeToo to share their stories of sexual harassment, one woman has turned attention to one form of harassment that is often overlooked: shaming breastfeeding moms.

"Speaking of sexual violence how is telling a woman and child to cover up not sexual violence? Stop sexualizing breastfeeding," mom Diana Channing wrote on Instagram. "Motherhood is so fucking fierce. What could be more perverse than asking a woman to feel shame for nurturing an innocent life in the way she was biologically designed to do?"

Since boobs are considered a sexual body part, breastfeeding in public has become taboo because people sexualize the act.

Thus, Channing notes that shaming mothers for nursing their babies can be considered sexual harassment because the comments are not only unwanted, but uncalled for â€” similar to comments made to women who are catcalled.

We should start to question why we continue to see so many of these stories in the news and why we allow this behaviour to continue.

While Channing applauded the hashtag #MeToo for shedding light on obvious forms of sexual harassment â€” such as when a coworker touches you inappropriately at work â€” she noted that the movement "should have you going deeper pushing past the norms."

"I was thinking a lot about what we allow and subscribe to in the media, circumcision of course and now breastfeeding," she wrote.

Channing's note about the media is an important one, as many things seen in the news, magazines or movies should be questioned rather than simply accepted. Bustle, for instance, created a list of famous rom-com "heroes" who actually sexually harassed their love interest, such as Noah from "The Notebook," shedding light on what unacceptable behaviour is when it comes to dating.

But digging deeper, as the mom says, we should now turn our attention to breastfeeding shaming and start to question why we continue to see so many of these stories in the news and why we allow this behaviour to continue.

When we speak up we make the world a safer place.

"When we speak up we make the world a safer place," she concluded.

Breastfeeding mamas should never be made to feel ashamed, unsafe or uncomfortable simply because they are nursing their babies. In Canada, it is also legal for mothers to nurse in public, and women should know their rights.

British Columbia and Ontario are the two provinces that have laws specifically to protect women's breastfeeding rights, stating that it is discriminatory to ask them to "cover up" or be more "discreet."

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Shaming Breastfeeding Mamas Is Form Of Sexual Harassment, Says Mom Diana Channing

SUMMARY:
Without deliberately setting out to, organisers realised they had booked a lineup where 50 percent of the acts were either female solo artists or included female members.
HuffPost Australia chatted to a few of them to get their thoughts about how women are included (or not) at the festival level in Australian music.
"There are so many, not only females but other diverse musicians, doing such incredible things, that you should work your festival around them.
"Then they start to come out of the woodwork and develop their own talent and creativity, and become new female acts, then there are more female musicians to actually put on the thing.
"When there weren't as many women on the bill, there would be one or two types of female artists and now we get such a range.
TEXT:
Wollongong hosted the Yours And Owls music festival on the October long weekend, two days of sun, fun and bands just a stone's throw from the beach on the beautiful NSW south coast. HuffPost Australia has visited the festival before, calling it "Australia's coolest small festival", but the "small" tag doesn't exactly fit anymore as the event has expanded to a two-day, four-stage format featuring the likes of The Presets, At The Drive-In, The Preatures, Dune Rats and an impressive lineup of Australia's biggest musical acts.

While winning well-deserved plaudits for being a well-run, fun and innovative festival in its own right, Yours And Owls also accidentally became a pioneer for gender equality during its 2016 iteration. Without deliberately setting out to, organisers realised they had booked a lineup where 50 percent of the acts were either female solo artists or included female members. While other Australian festivals -- most notably, Canberra's Spilt Milk that same year, which booked only one female act on its lineup -- fail to include gender parity and representation as part of its rationale for putting together a festival, Yours And Owls organisers said they didn't struggle to book such a diverse lineup in 2016.

Bands perform at Yours And Owls 2017

"Our process is I go out and hunt around for a lineup and come back to everyone with what I've got and one of the guys pointed out it was half girls," Owls organiser Ben Tillman said at the time.

"I was just trying to get the best line-up, these were the acts that were available and this is a testament to how much great music there is being made by women."

In 2017, a quick check of the Yours And Owls lineup found at least one third of the bill either being solo female artists or featuring female talents, from key drawcards The Preatures and Montaigne; through to newer talents like Alex Lahey, Ruby Fields, Bec Sandridge and Ali Barter; and a swag of smaller and local acts. HuffPost Australia chatted to a few of them to get their thoughts about how women are included (or not) at the festival level in Australian music.

"I know promoters book acts who will bring numbers to festivals. It seems our most popular acts, musically, universally, not just nationally but in the world, are white dudes," said Montaigne, real name Jessica Cerro.

"The fact of the matter is these people are booked because they will sell tickets. But in seeking out those kind of acts, like minorities, those acts then become popular, or the music gets better, or other people who have maybe denied their own potential because they don't think they can make it because of who they are, will have the confidence to come out. It's all about confidence."

Rising and much-hyped Sydney indie band Body Type, who count four women in their ranks, said it was "lazy" for festivals to not consider gender when assembling lineups.

"It's completely important. The excuses promoters throw out, like 'it's actually based on genre and there were no women doing this', is bullshit and so lazy," said frontwoman Sophie.

"There are so many, not only females but other diverse musicians, doing such incredible things, that you should work your festival around them. You listen to what you want to listen to, then you build it and curate it in that way."

"Why would you not want to listen to amazing artists, regardless if they were a man or woman or seagull?"

Montaigne said getting more women on lineups would encourage and inspire other women to pick up instruments, start singing or join bands, kickstarting a snowball effect which would lead to more talented female acts in the long-run.

"Once women have representation and women who ordinarily think 'it's a man's world and industry', they start to see that and think 'I can do that too'," she said.

"Then they start to come out of the woodwork and develop their own talent and creativity, and become new female acts, then there are more female musicians to actually put on the thing. Once you have representation, like any minority whether that's people of colour or queer people, it normalises you and you're not afraid to go out into the public and show yourself."

Festival-goers dance at one of the smaller stages at Yours And Owls

Melbourne artist Ali Barter, who we recently profiled, has been running around the country with her guitar in recent months, bringing her electric new album to fans nationwide. She told HuffPost Australia there was a simple reason to inject more diversity on festival lineups.

"It's more fun. It's more interesting to get a range of artists," she said.

"When there weren't as many women on the bill, there would be one or two types of female artists and now we get such a range. We get Ecca Vandal, and Alex Lahey, and then there's The Preatures, women who do completely different things."

Barter said, if nothing else, festival fans wanted to see a variety of acts.

"It just makes it more interesting. It's fairer but it's just better. You want to see a range, you don't want to go and see the same thing over and over again," she said.

"People want to hear it. People are ready for it."
TITLE: Female Musicians On Why Music Festivals Need Gender Fairness

SUMMARY:
Two plus-size models asked a photographer to heavily photoshop them to make an important point about body image.
Diana Sirokai and Callie Thorpe posted the before and after images to their Instagram accounts to show just how misleading heavily retouched photos in media can be.
To see the original image, before photoshop, hover on the right-hand edge of the photo and click the arrow button.
â€³[We] have asked our photographer to use photoshop on us,â€ explained Diana in the caption.
Own who you are and slay.â€Callie Thorpe (right) said in the caption of her post: â€œItâ€™s no wonder women are laden with insecurities.
TEXT:
Two plus-size models asked a photographer to heavily photoshop them to make an important point about body image.

Diana Sirokai and Callie Thorpe posted the before and after images to their Instagram accounts to show just how misleading heavily retouched photos in media can be.

A post shared by D I A N A S I R O K A I (@dianasirokai) on Oct 17, 2017 at 3:25pm PDT

Diana Sirokai (left) and Callie Thorpe. To see the original image, before photoshop, hover on the right-hand edge of the photo and click the arrow button.

The pair have hundreds of thousands of followers on Instagram and are powerful voices in the social media siteâ€™s body positivity community, where models, bloggers and influencers share unretouched photos celebrating the glorious diversity of the human body.

The pair called on photographer Karina Poltavtceva, whom Diana has worked with previously, to edit their photos - making them much slimmer and cellulite-free.

â€³[We] have asked our photographer to use photoshop on us,â€ explained Diana in the caption.

â€œThe purpose of this was to show you all how magazines and the media takes editing to a different level. Models and celebrities do not even look like theirselves. We live in such a fake world its time to bring real back. Own who you are and slay.â€

Callie Thorpe (right) said in the caption of her post: â€œItâ€™s no wonder women are laden with insecurities. For years we have been subjected to perfect airbrushed and often altered images across the media. Whilst photoshop has its place and need in some parts of industries this is the extreme when it comes to editing, it just goes to show how much we can really alter ourselves.

â€³[We] look perfect just as we are, two friends smiling for a photo. We want to show women that itâ€™s okay to look â€˜normalâ€™ to have cellulite, stretch marks and tummies that arenâ€™t flat and toned. Be happy with you who you are and the skin you are in.â€

Our Body Image Heroes
TITLE: Two Plus-Size Models Post Dramatic Before And After Pics To Show How Misleading Photoshop Can Be

SUMMARY:
Let me inform Amanda I have spent some of my education in segregated schools as I am an immigrant.
My beautiful religion Islam teaches exactly this, to love my country and remain loyal to my country.
Islamic values are not very different from British values.
Mutual respect for and tolerance of those with different faiths is part of the British values.
I am a qualified science teacher with a Masters in education, planning on completing a doctorate in education.
TEXT:
Ofsted stated segregation in a Birmingham Islamic faith school left girls 'unprepared for life in modern Britain'. On which research did Ofsted's Amanda Spielman make this statement?

Let me inform Amanda I have spent some of my education in segregated schools as I am an immigrant. I am now a secondary school science teacher who covers her head in accordance with her religion. I organise numerous activities whilst being part of the Ahmadiyya Muslim Women's Association, UK. Only yesterday I organised an event involving raising awareness of the poppy appeal in allegiance with the Royal British Legion. Last year I organised a charity walk raising money for the 'War Child' charity. Visiting sick children in hospitals and giving them presents at the occasion of Christmas is a regular occurrence. Most women who are part of the Ahmadiyya Muslim Women's Association help out in such events throughout the country. We as a community are guided by our spiritual leader, Hazrat Mirza Masroor Ahmad, who regularly reminds us of the true teachings of Islam which are devoid of violence and extremism.

Am I not upholding British values? Do I look like I am "unprepared for life in modern Britain"? Of course not!

I immigrated to England because I was not allowed to practice my religion freely in Pakistan. After my immigration, I call England my home. I love England. It gives me so much security and allows me to practice my own religion without any fear. My beautiful religion Islam teaches exactly this, to love my country and remain loyal to my country.

Islamic values are not very different from British values. As a teacher I try my utmost to ensure my pupils gain British values and become good citizens of the UK. Mutual respect for and tolerance of those with different faiths is part of the British values. I myself encourage mutual respect in my pupils as is expected of teachers. Islam is not different from British values. Islam tolerates and allows everyone to practice their own religion without fear.

Surely the whole point of a faith school is for children to grow up in an environment which adheres to their religion. I understand sex discrimination is an important law and when exercised appropriately is a necessity to ensure men and women are treated equally. The faith school stated boys and girls were treated equally despite being segregated. Segregation does not hinder education, so why should schools be given lower Ofsted ratings if they chose to segregate pupils? Segregation certainly didn't hinder my education. I am a qualified science teacher with a Masters in education, planning on completing a doctorate in education.

Let me tell you I feel so comfortable when I am in a separate ladies area at my mosque. Yet I have fully integrated within the British society. It is possible to do both!
TITLE: A Reply From A Muslim Woman Who Had A Segregated Education

ComposÃ©e de 33 lames d'aluminium, ce panneau de 288 m2 recouvre les cinq Ã©tages du bÃ¢timent qui abrite les activitÃ©s du groupe RTL depuis 1932. Ces derniers jours, journalistes, riverains et curieux ont pu admirer cette oeuvre une derniÃ¨re fois avant son dÃ©crochage.

RachetÃ© par M6, le groupe RTL quitte donc ses locaux historiques pour s'installer dans un immeuble de l'avenue Charles-de-Gaulle Ã  Neuilly-sur-Seine prÃ¨s de son nouveau propriÃ©taire. Le dÃ©mÃ©nagement des activitÃ©s du groupe n'inclut toutefois pas cette oeuvre dont les motifs concentriques reprÃ©sentent la propagation d'une onde: RTL en a fait don Ã  la Fondation Vasarely situÃ©e Ã  Aix-en-Provence.

"On est ravis, bien sÃ»r, mais on ne sait pas encore prÃ©cisÃ©ment ce qu'on va en faire, a expliquÃ© au Parisien Pierre Vasarely, petit-fils de l'artiste et prÃ©sident de la fondation. Dans l'idÃ©al, j'aimerais qu'elle soit accrochÃ©e Ã  un nouvel immeuble. Ce serait aussi formidable de la prÃ©senter lors de la rÃ©trospective qui sera organisÃ©e au Centre Pompidou dÃ©but 2019".

TEXT:
Die Stiftung zeigt wie kaum eine andere Institution, wie eng im Iran Glaube, Profit und Macht verbunden sind: Die FrÃ¶mmigkeit des Volkes legitimiert das religiÃ¶se Regime und bringt ihm finanziellen Gewinn, den es zur Stabilisierung seiner Macht nutzen kann. Umgekehrt investiert das Regime in die religiÃ¶se Infrastruktur und fÃ¶rdert die Pilgerreisen nach Maschhad und zu anderen HeiligtÃ¼mern, um seinem Anspruch als Stellvertreter der Imame und als Verteidiger des Islam gerecht zu werden und seine Lesart der Religion unter das Volk zu bringen.

Seit der Revolution 1979 ist der Schrein enorm ausgebaut worden. Zu den alten Hallen und HÃ¶fen, die unter den Safaviden und Kadscharen im 17. und 19. Jahrhundert erbaut worden waren, sind zahlreiche SÃ¤le und HÃ¶fe hinzugekommen, um Platz fÃ¼r die gestiegene Zahl der Pilger zu schaffen, zudem wurden riesige SanitÃ¤ranlagen, Einkaufszentren und Tiefgaragen errichtet. Dabei stand die Entwicklung ganz im Zeichen der Effizienz, wie die Architektin und Anthropologin Samar Saremi berichtet, die zur Baugeschichte des Schreins forscht.

Wie der Schrein behandelt wurde, habe sich kaum von anderen urbanen Orten mit Verkehrs- und Zugangsfragen unterschieden, sagt die Architektin und verweist auf die Rolltreppen, die in die mittelalterliche Architektur integriert wurden. Obwohl die Art, wie sich ein Pilger einem Heiligtum nÃ¤here â€“ ob zu FuÃŸ oder per Auto â€“ die Bedeutung des Akts und die Wahrnehmung des Orts Ã¤ndere, habe bei der Gestaltung ein pragmatischer Zugang vorgeherrscht mit dem Ziel, die Pilgerschaft mÃ¶glichst effizient zu organisieren.



Der Kontrolle durch die Politik entzogen: Die Stiftung "Astan-e Qods-e Razavi", die das Heiligtum verwaltet, seit der Revolution 1979 zu einem weitverzweigten Firmenimperium entwickelt, das sein Kapital unverhohlen profitorientiert einsetzt und in groÃŸem MaÃŸstab im Irak, in Syrien und im Libanon investiert.

Es ist Mittag und die inneren HÃ¶fe haben sich mit GlÃ¤ubigen fÃ¼r das Mittagsgebet gefÃ¼llt, die "BrÃ¼der" auf der einen, die in schwarze Tschadors gehÃ¼llten "Schwestern" auf der anderen Seite. WÃ¤hrend von den DÃ¤chern der Gebetsruf hallt, eilen immer weitere Pilger Ã¼ber die schattenlosen Ã¤uÃŸeren HÃ¶fe heran, bis alle PlÃ¤tze auf den Teppichen belegt sind, die schwarzuniformierten WÃ¤chter den inneren Bereich absperren und die NeuankÃ¶mmlinge in die unterirdischen Hallen winken, die unter den alten HÃ¶fen errichtet wurden.

Irans PrÃ¤sident ohne Einblick oder Kontrolle

Am Ausgang wartet Keyvan fÃ¼r eine Tour durch Maschhad. "Kennst Du eine andere Stadt, in der so viele Hotels auf so engem Raum stehen?", fragt der Bauingenieur, wÃ¤hrend er seinen Wagen in den Verkehr einfÃ¤delt, und weist auf die HoteltÃ¼rme um den Schrein. Sie alle leben von den Pilgern, nicht wenige gehÃ¶ren "Astan-e Qods". Doch nicht nur das: Die Stiftung besitzt auch Einkaufszentren, Fabriken, Banken; die HÃ¤lfte der Immobilien in der Millionenstadt ist in ihrer Hand und ein GroÃŸteil des Landbesitzes in der umliegenden Provinz Chorasan.

"Die Stiftung nimmt sich mit Gewalt, was sie will", sagt Keyvan, der eigentlich anders heiÃŸt. Niemand kÃ¶nne sich ihr widersetzen, wenn sie Anspruch auf ein GrundstÃ¼ck oder GebÃ¤ude erhebe. Der Bauingenieur mit der randlosen Brille und dem kahlrasierten SchÃ¤del hat noch nie fÃ¼r sie gearbeitet, da ihre BauauftrÃ¤ge nur Ã¼ber Kontakte zu bekommen seien. In der Stadt sei die Stiftung verhasst, wohltÃ¤tige Arbeit mache sie nicht, sagt Keyvan. Dabei genieÃŸt die Stiftung deshalb eigentlich Steuerfreiheit und Autonomie gegenÃ¼ber der Regierung.

Wie die anderen religiÃ¶sen Stiftungen untersteht "Astan-e Qods" RevolutionsfÃ¼hrer Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, wie die TÃ¼binger Ethnologin Katharina MÃ¼ller sagt, die zu den Strukturen der Stiftung forscht. Doch selbst Chamenei hat nur bedingt Mitspracherecht in der Stiftung, wÃ¤hrend der Regierung von PrÃ¤sident Hassan Rohani jeder Einblick und jede Kontrolle fehlt. "Astan-e Qods" sei kein ausfÃ¼hrendes Organ der Regierung, betont MÃ¼ller, sondern ein eigener, sehr selbstbewusster politischer Akteur, der in Politik und Wirtschaft einen eigenen Kurs verfolgt.

Im MÃ¤rz ist zwar der langjÃ¤hrige Stiftungsvorsitzende Ayatollah Abbas Vaez-Tabbasi gestorben, der wegen seiner MachtfÃ¼lle auch als "Imperator von Chorasan" bezeichnet wurde. Ob Khamenei damit aber seine Kontrolle Ã¼ber die Stiftung stÃ¤rken kann, wird sich noch zeigen mÃ¼ssen. Zwar wird der neue Vorsitzende Ebrahim Raisi kaum die Position seines VorgÃ¤ngers erlangen kÃ¶nnen, der "Astan-e Qods" durchgehend seit der Revolution 1979 fÃ¼hrte, doch wird die Stiftung nach Ansicht von MÃ¼ller schon darauf achten, ihre EigenstÃ¤ndigkeit zu bewahren.



Tunnelsystem Imam Reza: In dem Gestank der Abgase und dem LÃ¤rm der Autos ist kaum vorstellbar, dass sich nur wenige Meter entfernt das Grab des Imam befindet. Ãœber die mehrspurige SchnellstraÃŸe, die von vier Seiten durch autobahnartige Zubringer erschlossen wird, verlÃ¤uft ein GroÃŸteil des Verkehrs der Stadt. Von ihr gehen auch die unterirdischen ParkhÃ¤user ab, von denen die Pilger direkt in das Heiligtum gelangen kÃ¶nnen.

Abgeschottet und autark

Die Stiftung versteht sich als HÃ¼ter der Tradition und der Werte der Islamischen Revolution. Eine Liberalisierung von Politik und Kultur lehnt sie ab, und auch die Ã–ffnung der Wirtschaft, wie sie von PrÃ¤sident Rohani angestrebt wird, sieht sie kritisch. Dies liegt auch daran, dass eine Ã–ffnung des Landes viele Firmen und Fabriken von "Astan-e Qods" in ihrer Existenz bedrohen wÃ¼rde, da ihr Ã¶konomisches Modell nur funktioniert, solange das Land abgeschottet und die Wirtschaft nicht der internationalen Konkurrenz ausgesetzt ist.

Keyvan lenkt seinen Wagen zurÃ¼ck auf die unterirdische RingstraÃŸe, die unter den Ã¤uÃŸeren HÃ¶fen um den Schrein fÃ¼hrt. In dem Gestank der Abgase und dem LÃ¤rm der Autos ist kaum vorstellbar, dass sich nur wenige Meter entfernt das Grab des Imam befindet. Ãœber die mehrspurige SchnellstraÃŸe, die von vier Seiten durch autobahnartige Zubringer erschlossen wird, verlÃ¤uft ein GroÃŸteil des Verkehrs der Stadt. Von ihr gehen auch die unterirdischen ParkhÃ¤user ab, von denen die Pilger direkt in das Heiligtum gelangen kÃ¶nnen.

Doch Keyvan bleibt lieber drauÃŸen. Wie viele junge Iraner ist der 33-JÃ¤hrige vom Islam entfremdet. Zwar zeigt das Heiligtum von Maschhad wie stark der Glaube, wie wichtig der Islam noch immer fÃ¼r viele Iraner ist, doch belegen Studien seit Jahren auch, dass die ReligiositÃ¤t im Iran rÃ¼cklÃ¤ufig ist, und sich gerade die junge Generation wegen des politischen Missbrauchs der Religion durch das Regime in Massen vom Islam abwendet.

Keyvan ist von der stÃ¤ndigen religiÃ¶sen Propaganda genervt und der andauernden PrÃ¤senz der Mullahs in den Medien Ã¼berdrÃ¼ssig. Die Inbrunst der Pilger, wenn sie sich aus Trauer Ã¼ber den Tod des Imams weinend auf die Brust schlagen, ist ihm unangenehm, und die SchÃ¶nheit der Architektur, das satte Gold der Kuppel, das tiefe Blau der Portale lassen ihn kalt. In den Schrein kommt er nur ein Mal im Jahr, wenn er seine Mutter zum Gebet begleitet. Wenn der Glaube das Kapital der Stiftung ist, hat Keyvan dazu nichts beizutragen.

Ulrich von Schwerin

TITLE: Die Wirtschaftsmacht religiÃ¶ser Stiftungen im Iran: Glaube und Profit am Grabmal des Imam

Nearly three quarters of Conservative councillors are worried about government funding cuts to childrenâ€™s centres, a new poll has revealed.

Craig Brough / Reuters Tracy Brabin said the closure of children's centres should 'shame' government ministers.

TEXT:
Nearly three quarters of Conservative councillors are worried about government funding cuts to childrenâ€™s centres, a new poll has revealed.

The research, which saw 508 Tory local government representatives quizzed by charity Action for Children, showed 72% believe long-term funding for childrenâ€™s services is a major concern for their council.

More than half say budget restrictions are making it harder for councils to meet their responsibilities towards children and young people, while 38% believe there is a â€œlack of clear direction and fundingâ€ from government.

Sir Tony Hawkhead, chief executive of Action for Children, said: â€œOur findings show the growing fear that the government is failing in its pledge to give all children the best start in life.

PA Archive/PA Images The introduction of Sure Start centres was a flagship New Labour policy.

â€œAround a third of children in England â€“ nearly 200,0000 â€“ fell behind by age five last year and with one childrenâ€™s centre closing every week, weâ€™re deeply concerned struggling families are being abandoned.

â€œEarly years services are one of the key lifelines for families living in poor housing, in financial trouble, with mental health issues and those whose own childhood experiences affect their parenting. These lifeline services are being hollowed out, fragmented and cut, and children are bearing the brunt.

â€œThe government needs a bold vision that will give direction and provide local authorities with adequate funding to make sure all our children get the best start in life.â€

One Conservative council cabinet member who took part in the survey said the impact of further cuts would be â€œsignificantâ€ and that their local authority had already been forced to scrap some family support services.

Figures show more than 350 Sure Start centres have closed since 2010.

Craig Brough / Reuters Tracy Brabin said the closure of children's centres should 'shame' government ministers.

Tracy Brabin, Labourâ€™s shadow early years minister, said the government was making it â€œimpossibleâ€ for councils to provide the support children and families needed.

â€œIt should shame ministers that theyâ€™re overseeing such a dramatic fall in these services when nearly half of children fail to meet developmental milestones by age five,â€ she added.

â€œIt goes to show â€˜social mobilityâ€™ is nothing but a catchphrase to them.

â€œWith Sure Start centres closing across the country at an alarming rate, as their funding continues to be slashed, there are more and more children who need support, but are not able to access it because of this government.
TITLE: Three Quarters Of Tory Councillors Worried About Cuts To Children's Centres, Poll Reveals

Afin de sauver les apparences, invite-t-il son prÃ©dÃ©cesseur Ã  dÃ©jeuner dans un restaurant asiatique? Constate-t-il alors que les clients viennent demander des autographes Ã  Chirac? "Pour Ãªtre aimÃ©, soupire-t-il, il ne faut rien faire..."

Le mÃªme Sarkozy, pourtant, rend respectueusement visite Ã  son domicile Ã  l'ancien prÃ©sident ValÃ©ry Giscard d'Estaing, dÃ©testÃ© par Chirac, pour le consulter sur l'Europe. De son cÃ´tÃ©, Emmanuel Macron reÃ§oit Ã  diner Ã  l'ElysÃ©e non FranÃ§ois Hollande et Julie Gayet, mais le couple Nicolas-Carla Sarkozy.

Bernard Cazeneuve dÃ©crit Macron dans un livre ("Chaque jour compte") regardant "la droite avec des yeux de ChimÃ¨ne".

Comme si chacun des Ã©lus Ã  la fonction suprÃªme de la RÃ©publique Ã©tait enclin Ã  se tourner avec intÃ©rÃªt et mÃªme avec admiration vers ses prÃ©dÃ©cesseurs â€“pourvu que ceux-ci appartiennent au camp adverse- mais incapable de reconnaÃ®tre les moindres qualitÃ©s et mÃ©rites Ã  ceux qui appartiennent au mÃªme camp et qui l'ont directement prÃ©cÃ©dÃ©. Chanter les louanges de Giscard devant Chirac, impossible! Celles de Chirac devant Sarkozy...trÃ¨s difficile! Et celles de Hollande devant Macron! "Deux crocodiles dans un marigot, observait FranÃ§ois Mitterrand. La nature est lÃ , qui t'invite et qui t'aime: le plus gros mange l'autre..." Le nouvel Ã©lu, en tout cas, ne supporte pas de se voir concurrencer par son aÃ®nÃ©.

Observez au contraire deux rivaux fÃ©roces appartenant Ã  des camps adverses: Mitterrand et Chirac. On se souvient de leurs duels tÃ©lÃ©visÃ©s Ã  mort. Et de leur cohabitation qui ne fut que la poursuite de leur long combat. Mais voici que, parvenu Ã  la fin de son rÃ¨gne et lassÃ© des siens, Mitterrand prÃ©fÃ¨re favoriser, en 1995, l'Ã©lection de Chirac plutÃ´t que de voir un socialiste comme Lionel Jospin lui succÃ©der. Premier prÃ©sident socialiste de la VÃ¨me RÃ©publique, il veut rester le seul dans sa catÃ©gorie. DÃ¨s lors, Chirac, adoubÃ©, fait assaut d'amabilitÃ©s et mÃªme d'affection sincÃ¨re. Son allocution tÃ©lÃ©visÃ©e du 8 janvier 1996 Ã  la mort de Mitterrand est le tÃ©moignage d'admiration et d'amour d'un fils pour son pÃ¨re. Mitterrand, que les gaullistes appelaient naguÃ¨re "l'arsouille", est devenu pour lui un grand homme qui "dÃ©bordait sa vie", un chef aimÃ© des FranÃ§ais et qui avait "un ami dans chaque village"...

Emmanuel Macron reÃ§oit Ã  dÃ®ner Ã  l'ElysÃ©e non FranÃ§ois Hollande et Julie Gayet, mais le couple Nicolas-Carla Sarkozy.

Dans le mÃªme camp, au contraire, les haines sont inexpiables. Trop d'admirations dÃ©Ã§ues, trop de blessures, trop de mauvais souvenirs. Georges Pompidou organise en 1970 pour le GÃ©nÃ©ral Ã  qui il a succÃ©dÃ© l'annÃ©e d'avant des obsÃ¨ques grandioses. Il se pose en hÃ©ritier et dÃ©clare "La France est veuve". Mais la plaie de l'affaire Markovic, alimentÃ©e par quelques fidÃ¨les de "l'homme du 18 juin", reste affreusement vive. FranÃ§ois Hollande, mÃ©prisÃ© par FranÃ§ois Mitterrand, se rÃ©clamera certes de lui pour se faire Ã©lire, mais il n'aura jamais pour celui que les FranÃ§ais appelÃ¨rent "Tonton" l'estime et l'affection manifestÃ©es Ã  Chirac. Si Emmanuel Macron, en marche devant la Pyramide du Louvre, dÃ©sire quant Ã  lui imiter le premier prÃ©sident socialiste dit "le sphinx", c'est parce que de longues annÃ©es les sÃ©parent... et parce qu'il pense briller un peu de son Ã©clat.

Les annÃ©es et la distance, voilÃ  peut-Ãªtre ce qui a manquÃ© Ã  Mitterrand et de Gaulle pour finir par s'estimer sinon par se rÃ©concilier, eux qui furent de droite et de gauche, eux que les FranÃ§ais placent toujours en premier sur la liste de leurs chefs d'Etat les plus populaires. Mais leur rivalitÃ©, qui dura de 1941 Ã  1969, avec des Ã©clipses et des moments d'affrontements violents, fut trop longue et profonde. L'Histoire ne les effacera pas.

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Pourquoi un PrÃ©sident voue toujours une haine fÃ©roce Ã  son prÃ©dÃ©cesseur direct (et chante les louanges de celui d'avant)
