TEXT:
EUROPE - Les 28 pays de l'UE vont tenter ce lundi 23 octobre de s'accorder sur la rÃ©forme de la directive du travail dÃ©tachÃ©, au cÅ“ur d'une vive bataille l'Ã©tÃ© dernier entre Paris et les pays de l'Est, Pologne en tÃªte.

Plus de dix-huit mois aprÃ¨s une proposition de la Commission europÃ©enne de rÃ©viser les rÃ¨gles europÃ©ennes encadrant le dÃ©tachement -- un systÃ¨me permettant Ã  des EuropÃ©ens de travailler dans un autre pays que le leur, tout en cotisant dans leur pays d'origine --, les ministres du Travail de l'Union se rÃ©unissent sur la question Ã  Luxembourg.

"J'espÃ¨re que nous arriverons Ã  une percÃ©e", a dÃ©clarÃ© samedi Ã  la radio France Inter la commissaire europÃ©enne aux Affaires sociales, Marianne Thyssen, Ã  l'origine de la rÃ©forme.

L'objectif majeur, a insistÃ© Marianne Thyssen, c'est d'avoir un "salaire Ã©gal, Ã  travail Ã©gal, sur un mÃªme lieu de travail". En effet, dans la directive initiale, qui date de 1996, il est simplement spÃ©cifiÃ© que les travailleurs dÃ©tachÃ©s doivent toucher le salaire minimum du pays d'accueil.

Dumping social

Or, l'Ã©largissement de l'UE Ã  l'Est en 2004, avec l'arrivÃ©e de dix nouveaux pays aux niveaux de vie et salaires plus bas, a bouleversÃ© la donne, engendrant une concurrence dÃ©loyale entre entreprises et du dumping social.

En rÃ©visant la directive, l'exÃ©cutif europÃ©en veut dÃ©sormais que toutes les rÃ¨gles valables pour les travailleurs locaux s'appliquent aux dÃ©tachÃ©s: ainsi, par exemple, si le pays d'accueil prÃ©voit une prime de froid, de pÃ©nibilitÃ©, d'anciennetÃ©, un treiziÃ¨me mois, ces bonus devront aussi leur Ãªtre versÃ©s.

Le prÃ©sident franÃ§ais Emmanuel Macron, qui Ã  peine Ã©lu avait rÃ©clamÃ© un durcissement de la rÃ©forme, s'en prenant Ã  la Pologne et aux trois autres pays du groupe de Visegrad (Hongrie, RÃ©publique tchÃ¨que, Slovaquie), partisans d'un statu quo, a indiquÃ© vendredi "souhaiter finaliser le plus rapidement possible un accord".

Trois points posent cependant encore problÃ¨me:

La durÃ©e du dÃ©tachement: l'exÃ©cutif europÃ©en a proposÃ© de le limiter Ã  24 mois, mais la France, qui a rÃ©ussi Ã  convaincre l'Allemagne, les pays du Benelux et l'Autriche, plaide pour 12 mois. La date d'application de la nouvelle directive: Paris souhaiterait qu'elle s'applique dans les deux ans suivant son adoption. La Commission a proposÃ© trois ans, les pays de l'Est rÃ©clament cinq ans. Le transport routier: ce dernier point est particuliÃ¨rement dÃ©licat, car les pays de Visegrad, mais aussi l'Espagne et le Portugal, s'inquiÃ¨tent des consÃ©quences nÃ©gatives de la rÃ©forme sur leurs chauffeurs. Et s'ils s'opposent ensemble Ã  une rÃ©vision, un accord ne pourra pas Ãªtre trouvÃ©.

Jeudi soir, Emmanuel Macron a profitÃ© d'un sommet de l'UE Ã  Bruxelles, pour Ã©voquer ce dossier en tÃªte Ã  tÃªte avec le Premier ministre espagnol Mariano Rajoy.

L'Espagne comme le Portugal, qui n'ont que la France comme porte d'entrÃ©e sur l'Union, effectuent des opÃ©rations de cabotage -- une pratique qui consiste Ã  quitter un pays avec un vÃ©hicule et Ã  charger puis dÃ©charger, Ã  plusieurs reprises, dans un autre pays -- dans l'Hexagone et concurrencent ainsi les routiers franÃ§ais.

Selon deux sources proches du dossier, un compromis pourrait se dessiner, en appliquant aux chauffeurs routiers l'ancienne directive du travail dÃ©tachÃ© concernant la rÃ©munÃ©ration -- c'est-Ã -dire qu'ils recevraient le salaire minimum du pays d'accueil, mais pas les primes --, jusqu'Ã  ce qu'une autre rÃ©forme consacrÃ©e au transport routier spÃ©cifie les rÃ¨gles pour ce secteur.

Il y a une semaine, une premiÃ¨re Ã©tape avait Ã©tÃ© franchie pour la rÃ©vision de la directive, avec l'adoption par la commission de l'Emploi et des Affaires sociales du Parlement europÃ©en d'un texte un peu plus dur que celui de la Commission europÃ©enne.

Si ce texte est adoptÃ© cette semaine lors de la session plÃ©niÃ¨re au Parlement europÃ©en Ã  Strasbourg, et si les ministres de l'UE parviennent de leur cÃ´tÃ© Ã  un accord, alors pourront commencer les tractations sur un texte final entre ces deux organes lÃ©gislatifs, chapeautÃ© en trilogue par la Commission, l'exÃ©cutif europÃ©en.

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Travailleurs dÃ©tachÃ©s: Les trois points qui bloquent la rÃ©forme voulue par Emmanuel Macron

SUMMARY:
J'en ai chiÃ© d'ailleurs, mais maintenant, je le sais: tout peut basculer du jour au lendemain.
Et que la gestion, les chiffres, toussa, ce n'est pas un jeu.
Et je n'aurais pas cette sensation de sÃ©rÃ©nitÃ© si je n'Ã©tais passÃ©e par toutes ces phases au prÃ©alable.
Le rythme de travail est celui que j'ai choisiJe dis souvent Ã  mes proches que je suis dans "le rush".
(tu sais, comme quand on dit que les soirÃ©es improvisÃ©es sont les meilleures).
TEXT:
J'aime bien prendre un peu de recul de temps en temps. Et puis, le blog est fait pour Ã§a: pour vous partager mes Ã©tats d'Ã¢me, le backstage de la vie de Freelance, casser les prÃ©jugÃ©s, les thÃ©ories... Aujourd'hui, je reviens sur les 8 choses que j'ai apprises depuis que je suis livrÃ©e Ã  moi-mÃªme financiÃ¨rement, dans mon business, et dans ma vie d'adulte en gÃ©nÃ©ral.

Tout peut basculer du jour au lendemain

Je le sais. Je l'ai vu. Je l'ai expÃ©rimentÃ©. J'en ai chiÃ© d'ailleurs, mais maintenant, je le sais: tout peut basculer du jour au lendemain. Ce qui est acquis aujourd'hui ne le sera pas forcÃ©ment demain. Que ce soit mes clients, toi lecteur du blog, mes amis, etc: tout peut disparaitre, ou en tout cas changer. Alors j'apprends Ã  profiter de l'instant prÃ©sent tout en Ã©tant consciente qu'il faut me prÃ©parer au futur, sans cesse.

Avoir une entreprise n'est pas un jeu

MÃªme si ta passion c'est les pantoufles taille 43 et que tu veux monter un e-shop pour les commercialiser. En fait, Ã  partir du moment oÃ¹ ton entreprise, aussi petite qu'elle soit, te prend du temps, te coÃ»te de l'argent (en investissements notamment), et t'en fait gagner: ce n'est pas un jeu. Tout simplement car des frais de gestion en dÃ©coulent. Et que la gestion, les chiffres, toussa, ce n'est pas un jeu.

L'importance de s'Ã©couter

J'ai longtemps travaillÃ© de longues heures sans m'arrÃªter. Le jour, la nuit, en sautant des repas, en nÃ©gligeant ma vie sociale. Je n'ai rÃ©coltÃ© que des problÃ¨mes. J'avais une micro-entreprise qui fonctionnait au top, mais au dÃ©triment de tout le reste. Alors j'ai fait le choix qu'Ã©quilibrer, d'Ã©couter mes envies, mes besoins. Maintenant, je ne culpabilise plus quand j'arrÃªte de travailler pour X ou Y raison. Car avec le recul, je vois que m'autoriser des break me rend encore plus productive et bien plus positive sur le long terme.

Continuer d'apprendre est vital

Et mÃªme au-delÃ  du fait que ce soit vital pour mon business, c'est essentiellement vital pour mon cerveau. J'ai besoin d'apprendre de nouvelles techniques, j'ai besoin d'approfondir des sujets pour me dÃ©tacher du syndrome de l'imposteur que j'ai traÃ®nÃ© dans mes premiÃ¨res annÃ©es de Freelance. Je n'ai pas toujours aimÃ© l'Ã©cole, mais c'est tellement diffÃ©rent lorsqu'il s'agit de se former sur des sujets qui te passionnent.

J'ai mis du temps Ã  me sentir bien

Pendant longtemps (Ã§a se compte en annÃ©es), j'ai Ã©tÃ© tiraillÃ©e par plusieurs sensations. La premiÃ¨re est commune Ã  95% des Freelance: le syndrome de l'imposteur. Mais je suis aussi passÃ©e au tout dÃ©part par la phase "personne ne me comprend car tout le monde pense que le CDI c'est le graal". Et puis par la phase "je travaille 60h/semaine pour ne rien gagner et ne pas pouvoir sortir boire des verres avec mes potes le week-end". Aujourd'hui je me sens bien, Ã©quilibrÃ©e. Et je n'aurais pas cette sensation de sÃ©rÃ©nitÃ© si je n'Ã©tais passÃ©e par toutes ces phases au prÃ©alable.

Le rythme de travail est celui que j'ai choisi

Je dis souvent Ã  mes proches que je suis dans "le rush". En vÃ©ritÃ©, c'est toi qui choisis dans quelle atmosphÃ¨re tu travailles. Perso, je n'aime pas travailler dans l'urgence mais j'aime savoir que j'ai une TONNE de trucs Ã  faire. Ã‡a me stimule. Ã‡a me pousse Ã  m'enfermer dans une bulle de travail. Le rythme de travail que j'ai choisi est celui qui me correspond (c'est mieux hein). Alors qu'au dÃ©part j'essayais de me calquer sur des horaires de bureau. Trouver son rythme Ã  soi prend du temps. Mais une fois trouvÃ© on voit nettement les rÃ©sultats en terme de productivitÃ©:)

J'ai la solution pour faire face Ã  la difficultÃ©, Ã  la pression ou Ã  la tristesse

Si tu me lis depuis longtemps, tu sais que je n'ai pas ou peu de filtre. Je parle beaucoup de la pression, de la tristesse, ou des angoisses que peuvent provoquer une vie professionnelle en Freelance. Les premiÃ¨res annÃ©es ont Ã©tÃ© compliquÃ©es car j'ai Ã©tÃ© livrÃ©e Ã  moi-mÃªme bien trop brutalement. Aujourd'hui je sais m'entourer pour faire face Ã  ces Ã©motions: mes amis, un mentor, des business besties...:)

TEXT:
The O Project se realizÃ³ en colaboraciÃ³n con Smile Makers , una empresa de juguetes sexuales que estÃ¡ tratando de normalizar la sexualidad femenina y empoderar a las mujeres para que no escondan su deseo sexual.

Este proyecto, titulado The O Project, estÃ¡ precedido por otro que tambiÃ©n alcanzÃ³ gran popularidad, 3 Glasses Later , que pretende mostrar cÃ³mo cambia el aspecto de los participantes tras beber una, dos y tres copas de vino .

Las participantes fueron seleccionadas entre las mujeres que respondieron al anuncio que publicÃ³ Smile Makers en Facebook buscando participantes. Pertenecen a diversas nacionalidades y etnias, ya que proceden tanto de paÃ­ses que se suelen considerar como sexualmente liberales, como los Estados Unidos y Francia, como de paÃ­ses teÃ³ricamente mÃ¡s conservadores en ese aspecto, como China y Singapur.

El mensaje de fondo de esta sesiÃ³n fotogrÃ¡fica es que "toda mujer merece tener el control de su propia sexualidad, independientemente de sus circunstancias".

La sexualidad no es un tabÃº y disfrutar plenamente de la vida sexual es un buen comienzo.

A la pregunta de cÃ³mo se siente al ver las fotos, Cassie, una de las participantes fotografiadas, responde: "Emocionada es poco. Estoy fascinada y me siento empoderada. El mensaje que les estamos mandando a todas las mujeres es que este no es un secreto del que haya que avergonzarse. Es real, natural y precioso".

Camille, otra de las participantes, aÃ±ade: "Formar parte de este proyecto ha sido genial porque les hemos dicho a todas las mujeres que su sexualidad no es un tabÃº y que disfrutar plenamente de su vida sexual es un buen comienzo. Las mujeres no deberÃ­an tener miedo de sentir placer. Te da felicidad, bienestar y es una faceta importante en la vida de todo el mundo. Me alegro de haber participado porque fue un desafÃ­o para mÃ­ y ahora me siento mÃ¡s preparada para explorar mi propia sexualidad".

No obstante, aunque el proyecto quiere transmitir un mensaje serio, Marcos Alberti anima a los espectadores a intentar ver tambiÃ©n el lado gracioso de los orgasmos: "Espero que los espectadores disfruten viendo las fotos y se puedan visualizar a sÃ­ mismos en esa situaciÃ³n. Quiero que las mujeres se sientan libres y empiecen a hablar sobre el tema sin miedo".

En un comunicado, Fan Yang, gerente de Smile Makers, aÃ±adiÃ³: "La sexualidad femenina suele estar rodeada de vergÃ¼enza y secretismo. Nuestra colaboraciÃ³n con Marcos Alberti nos ha permitido llevar a cabo esta sesiÃ³n fotogrÃ¡fica para dejar atrÃ¡s el estigma social que envuelve la sexualidad femenina y fomentar la normalizaciÃ³n del placer femenino".

Quiero que las mujeres se sientan libres y empiecen a hablar sobre el tema sin miedo. Marcos Alberti

"Todas las mujeres fotografiadas aquÃ­ se sorprendieron al verse, especialmente al contemplar la Ãºltima de las cuatro fotos, en la que aparecen luciendo una radiante sonrisa. Esa fotografÃ­a final de una mujer fuerte sonriendo a una cÃ¡mara es justo lo que queremos que vea la gente. Esperamos que todas aquellas personas que vean este proyecto se sientan mÃ¡s seguras con su cuerpo y con su sexualidad. Solo hace falta una sonrisa en cada ocasiÃ³n", concluye Fan Yang.

Descubre las demÃ¡s fotos del proyecto a continuaciÃ³n o visita la web de Marcos Alberti para conocer todos sus proyectos.
TITLE: Las caras de estas mujeres al tener un orgasmo demuestran lo engaÃ±oso que es el porno

Am Samstag hat in MÃ¼nchen ein Mann acht Menschen mit einem Messer verletzt, die Polizei informierte und warnte die BevÃ¶lkerung auf Twitter.
Oktober 2017Twitter-Nutzer baten die Polizei um TÃ¤terhinweiseWas war passiert?
Anfangs suchte die Polizei nach einem etwa 40 Jahre alten Mann, beschrieb Kleidung und Fahrrad.
Erst spÃ¤ter prÃ¤zisierte die Polizei dann: korpulent, mittelblond, unrasiert.
"Diese 'Sehnsucht' nach TÃ¤tern mit Migrationshintergrund ist widerlich"Mut macht, welche Reaktionen der Tweet der Polizei an die Hetzer auslÃ¶ste.
TEXT:
Am Samstag hat ein Mann in MÃ¼nchen acht Menschen mit einem Messer verletzt

Die Polizei bestÃ¤tigte nach Spekulationen rechter Hetzer noch einmal auf Twitter, dass der TÃ¤ter Deutscher sei

Der Tweet begeisterte mit seiner klaren Botschaft tausende Menschen

Ist das traurig? Oder macht das Mut? Vermutlich beides.

Am Samstag hat in MÃ¼nchen ein Mann acht Menschen mit einem Messer verletzt, die Polizei informierte und warnte die BevÃ¶lkerung auf Twitter. Und sah sich am Abend zu folgendem Tweet genÃ¶tigt: "Nachdem viele Hetzer ihre Frage wieder lÃ¶schen, weil die Antwort offenbar nicht in ihre Schublade passt: Geburtsland des TV: Deutschland."

Nachdem viele Hetzer Ihre Frage wieder lÃ¶schen, weil die Antwort offenbar nicht in ihre Schublade passt: Geburtsland des TV -> Deutschland. â€” Polizei MÃ¼nchen (@PolizeiMuenchen) 21. Oktober 2017

Twitter-Nutzer baten die Polizei um TÃ¤terhinweise

Was war passiert? Es dauerte gut drei Stunden, bis ein Spezialeinsatzkommando den VerdÃ¤chtigen fand. In dieser Zeit war es fÃ¼r MÃ¼nchner wichtig zu wissen, vor wem sie sich in Acht nehmen sollten.

Anfangs suchte die Polizei nach einem etwa 40 Jahre alten Mann, beschrieb Kleidung und Fahrrad. Erst spÃ¤ter prÃ¤zisierte die Polizei dann: korpulent, mittelblond, unrasiert.

Insofern wirkt nachvollziehbar, wenn viele via Twitter anfangs um weitere Hinweise baten, die weniger vage sind und nicht austauschbar wie Kleidung oder Rad - und dazu zÃ¤hlen etwa Haar- und Hautfarbe. So heikel diese Angaben auch sind.

Allerdings kann es dauern, aus vielen Zeugenaussagen belastbare herauszudestillieren. Dass einige User der Polizei deshalb unterstellten, sie wolle die Herkunft des TÃ¤ters verschweigen, ist eine bÃ¶se Unterstellung.

Noch bÃ¶swilliger ist die Einstellung, die sich aus diversen Posts ablesen lieÃŸ: Es kÃ¶nne doch nur ein AuslÃ¤nder, Islamist oder Mensch mit Migrationshintergrund hinter der Attacke stecken. Das ist Rassismus.

"Der Festgenommene ist in Deutschland geboren, auch wenn's nicht in Ihre Schublade passt"

Die Diskussion ging weiter, auch nachdem die Polizei in ihrer Pressekonferenz am frÃ¼hen Nachmittag den inzwischen festgenommenen VerdÃ¤chtigen als Deutschen identifiziert hatte.

Deutscher, das heiÃŸe nichts, er kÃ¶nne auch Migrationshintergrund haben, war auf Twitter zu lesen. Man solle seinen Namen verÃ¶ffentlichen.

Die Polizei antwortete: "Der Festgenommene ist in Deutschland geboren, auch wenn's nicht in Ihre Schublade passt!" Und weiter: "Abgesehen, dass wir die PersÃ¶nlichkeitsrechte auch von TatverdÃ¤chtigen schÃ¼tzen, kÃ¶nnen wir Ihnen sagen, Sie wÃ¤ren enttÃ¤uscht."

Abgesehen, dass wir die PersÃ¶nlichkeitsrechte auch von TatverdÃ¤chtigen schÃ¼tzen, kÃ¶nnen wir Ihnen sagen, sie wÃ¤ren enttÃ¤uscht. â€” Polizei MÃ¼nchen (@PolizeiMuenchen) 21. Oktober 2017

Soweit zum traurigen Teil.

"Diese 'Sehnsucht' nach TÃ¤tern mit Migrationshintergrund ist widerlich"

Mut macht, welche Reaktionen der Tweet der Polizei an die Hetzer auslÃ¶ste. Innerhalb von 15 Stunden wurde er 1700 Mal geteilt und 5300 Mal gelikt. Mehr als jeder andere Tweet der Polizei Ã¼ber den Vorfall.

Und nicht nur Prominente wie der ARD-Moderator Fritz Frey geiÃŸelten die Hetze: "Diese 'Sehnsucht' nach TÃ¤tern mit Migrationshintergrund ist widerlich und den Opfern gegenÃ¼ber zynisch", schrieb er.

Viele User dankten der MÃ¼nchner Polizei, fÃ¼r den "fantastischen Tweet" und dafÃ¼r, "dass Sie sich gegen die Hetzer stellen", dafÃ¼r, dass man den Hetzern "radikal hÃ¶flich eins auf die Fresse" gebe.

Ein User antwortete den Hetzern mit bitterem Sarkasmus: "Stellen Sie sich vor: TatsÃ¤chlich kann man voll echter deutscher Gene sein und trotzdem eine Psychose haben."

Andere machten sich Ã¼ber die offenbar krampfhafte Suche nach der "Schuld" eines AuslÃ¤nders lustig und schrieben: "Aber der Mann muss doch zumindest auslÃ¤ndische Nachbarn gehabt haben" â€“ "Oder schon mal ein DÃ¶ner gegessen."

Die Geschichte zeigt, wie viel Hass, viel Vorurteile es gibt. Aber sie zeigt auch, dass sehr viele Menschen nicht bereit sind, das zu akzeptieren.

(lm)
TITLE: Nach Messerattacke: MÃ¼nchner Polizei begeistert mit einem Satz tausende Menschen

SUMMARY:
The diverging fortunes of the two African giants in recent years is a sombre tale for the South African observer: the east African carrier, humbly built from the ground up over decades, today cruises steadily above the (avoidable) South African wreckage below.
Meanwhile, over at South African Airways, commercial viability had by then already become somewhat of an urban legend.
READ: Treasury Approves R3bn SAA Bailout Using National Revenue FundHow then, have our not-so-nearby African neighbours soared while SAA -- a formidable South African flop -- sinks further into shame?
The economy class cabin of an Airbus A350-900 of Ethiopian Airlines is photographed during a site-inspection at Fraport airport in Frankfurt, Germany, May 22, 2017.
Ethiopian Airline planes are seen parked at the Bole International Airport in Ethiopia's capital Addis Ababa, January 26, 2017.
TEXT:
Thomas Gabreyohannes, Director for Germany and Central Europe of Ethiopian Airlines walks down the gangway of an Airbus A350-900 during a site-inspection at Fraport airport in Frankfurt, Germany, in May this year.

COMMENT & ANALYSIS

Ethiopian Airlines on Tuesday announced the east African carrier has fully digitised its operations, removing paper from its entire system as it moves into the 'fourth industrial revolution'.

Along with the airline's paper trail, Ethiopian is progressively disposing of its biggest African counterpart -- South African Airways -- into the dustbin of aviation history.



The diverging fortunes of the two African giants in recent years is a sombre tale for the South African observer: the east African carrier, humbly built from the ground up over decades, today cruises steadily above the (avoidable) South African wreckage below.



Ethiopian Airlines' latest annual report for 2015/6 revealed it reached record profitability despite deflation of African currencies putting a slight damper on its margins. In the year leading to June 2016, it raked in a staggering 6.12 billion Birr (approximately R4.08 billion*), almost doubling its profits from the year before.

Meanwhile, over at South African Airways, commercial viability had by then already become somewhat of an urban legend. In its 2015/6 year, by comparison, it posted a loss of R1.5 billion which its then-acting chief executive called "pleasing" given the R5.6 billion loss the year before. By 2016/7, any illusion of recovery had fully dissipated, and the tragicomedy reached even greater heights, bailout by bailout and scandal by scandal.

READ: Treasury Approves R3bn SAA Bailout Using National Revenue Fund



How then, have our not-so-nearby African neighbours soared while SAA -- a formidable South African flop -- sinks further into shame?

In a 2016 interview with Greg Mills for Daily Maverick, the airline's group CEO Tewolde Gebremariam gave SAA a few clues on how to build a winning airline, even during turbulent times:

Ethiopian Airlines' first pillar, he said, was affordability on sustainability. Remaining creditworthy was paramount as the airline has "no other means of funding growth" and "doesn't get a cent from government".

Ethiopian Airlines is a 100 percent government-owned organization, but ownership and management of the airline are completely separate. Tewolde Gebremariam

Some of the other key dimensions to the airlines success, he has revealed in a range of interviews, are as follows:

A clear long-term vision for the airline which must come from government and policymakers: "The government has to answer the question about whether it sees the airline as a strategic asset or simply business". The airline's Vision 2025 aims to realise USD $10 billion in revenue, USD $1 billion in profit and flights to 120 international and 26 domestic destinations by that year.

Frugality and adjusting the airline's operating model in accordance with its available funds: Unlike SAA, for example, Ethiopian has not adopted a huge 'discount' model for government departments or corporate clients: "You can't be as lavish as South African Airways and expect to survive".

Strict principles of non-interference from politicians: the first time a top army official attempted to interfere in the airline, he was "publicly executed** as a deterrence to others who might dream of eroding the independence of the airline" (an otherwise unconfirmed claim reported by This Day). According to Gebremariam in an interview with Skift, "Ethiopian Airlines is a 100 percent government-owned organization, but ownership and management of the airline are completely separate".

Aggressive investment in infrastructure, skills development, backward-and-forward industry linkages: The airline trains 4,000 students at a time, possess the largest cargo terminal in Africa.

Hiring professional management staff based on merit rather than motivated by patronage and cronyism: Ethiopian Airlines' management team had over 421 years of airline industry experience between them, according to former researcher at the Helen Suzman Foundation, Andrew Barlow.

The economy class cabin of an Airbus A350-900 of Ethiopian Airlines is photographed during a site-inspection at Fraport airport in Frankfurt, Germany, May 22, 2017. REUTERS/Kai Pfaffenbach

There are, still, exogenous factors beyond both airlines' immediate control that can be beneficial or threatening. For Ethiopia, its geography undoubtedly gives the airline a considerable strategic and competitive advantage to build a "multi-hub" network, whereas South Africa doesn't share the same unearned advantage. At the same time, dominant players including Emirates, Etihad and Qatar Airways are merely across the pond and, no doubt, are a constant worry for Ethiopia's long-term planners.

Factors beyond the airlines' control aside, Ethiopian Airlines' is a winner because it is first and foremost a competitive business rather than a politically distorted, bloated and endlessly controversial entity.

Where Ethiopian has long-term vision and short-term strategy, SAA can barely see a month into the future. Where Ethiopian is extremely strict about affordability and sustainability, SAA has become accustomed to running to the state like a spoilt child who keeps blowing their pocket money.



While Ethiopian has engendered a commitment to "national duty", according to Gebremariam, SAA evokes only national shame given the scarcity of resources spent propping up a shoddy operation that could be better spent on functional developmental expenditure.

Ethiopian Airline planes are seen parked at the Bole International Airport in Ethiopia's capital Addis Ababa, January 26, 2017. Picture taken January 26, 2017. REUTERS/Amr Abdallah Dalsh



Where Ethiopian has developed considerably strict and reliable internal controls, SAA's inner machinations are hard to discern and raise red flags. The 2015 Ernst & Young forensic investigation into 48 tenders at SAA, for example, reported severe problems or irregularities with more than half these deals. As recently argued by Simon Mantell, the evidence suggests SAA suffers from "systemic weakness in internal control" that lend to wasteful and irregular expenditure.

READ: SAA Bailout: We're Shooting Ourselves In The Foot - Mike Schussler

If there is a crucial lesson (among the many, many lessons) for SAA in Ethiopian's long-term success story, it is surely this: when the piggy bank is empty, it's empty, and there's no way around it other than to change your strategy.

*In 2016 value: Conversion rate of 1 ETB = 0.66600 ZAR on 01/06/2016

** To be clear, this is not an endorsement of this extreme, inhumane method of punishment.
TITLE: Ethiopian vs SAA: Africa's Pride And Shame

SUMMARY:
Standard treatment for migraines normally relies on ibuprofen, lying in a dark room, and waiting for the nausea to pass.
But now patients could potentially be given a dose of ketamine after a 75% success rate in experimental trials.
The powerful anaesthetic is commonly used for pain relief during surgery and treating depression, but a team in the USA has been testing lower doses as a way to stop the debilitating headaches.
Squaredpixels via Getty ImagesAccording to the NHS, migraines affect 20% of women in the UK and 1 in every 15 men.
On a scale of 0-10, the average migraine headache pain rating at admission was 7.5, compared with 3.4 on discharge.
TEXT:
Standard treatment for migraines normally relies on ibuprofen, lying in a dark room, and waiting for the nausea to pass. But now patients could potentially be given a dose of ketamine after a 75% success rate in experimental trials.

The powerful anaesthetic is commonly used for pain relief during surgery and treating depression, but a team in the USA has been testing lower doses as a way to stop the debilitating headaches.

And it could be most powerful for patients who have not been helped by other treatments.

Squaredpixels via Getty Images

According to the NHS, migraines affect 20% of women in the UK and 1 in every 15 men. Beginning in early adulthood, most people only have a migraine occasionally but for others they can occur up to several times a week.

With symptoms including a moderate or severe headache, felt as a throbbing pain on one side of the head, nausea, vomiting and increased sensitivity to light or sound, migraines can make attending work difficult.

The Migraine Trust says almost 1 in 5 had lost a job through the condition.

As a result it is crucial to find a treatment for those who have failed to have success with conventional solutions.

The study, presented at the Anesthesiology 2017 annual meeting, took 61 patients who have so far failed to find an effective course of treatment for their migraines and placed them at an inpatient infusion centre for a three to seven day course.

On a scale of 0-10, the average migraine headache pain rating at admission was 7.5, compared with 3.4 on discharge.

The average length of infusion was 5.1 days, and the day of lowest pain ratings was day 4. And adverse side effects were generally mild.

Eric Schwenk, director of orthopedic anesthesia at Thomas Jefferson University hospital, said: â€œOur study focused only on short-term relief, but it is encouraging that this treatment might have the potential to help patients long-term.â€

Schwenk said he could not categorically say that the ketamine was â€œentirely responsibleâ€ for the pain relief, but the initial results were promising.

The treatment is not widely available at the moment, but the hospital is opening a new infusion centre later this year, Schwenk said: â€œOur work provides the basis for future, prospective studies that involve larger numbers of patients.â€

The exact cause of migraines is unknown, although theyâ€™re thought to be the result of temporary changes in the chemicals, nerves and blood vessels in the brain.
TITLE: Ketamine Could Actually Help Treat Migraines

ADVERTISEMENTSupreme Court's ban on the sale of firecrackers made Diwali a comparatively quiet affair in the Delhi NCR this year.
However, the order did little to help keep the pollution levels in control.
Some areas in the city recorded a steep hike in pollution levels with more than 24 times the average level.
But in comparison to last year, pollution levels this year seems much lower.
In 2016, the day after Diwali, the Air Quality Index was recorded at 431, as compared to 319 this year.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Supreme Court's ban on the sale of firecrackers made Diwali a comparatively quiet affair in the Delhi NCR this year.

However, the order did little to help keep the pollution levels in control. According to NDTV, data from the Central Pollution Control Board reflected Delhi's Air Quality Index (AQI) value at 319, putting it in the "very poor" category. Some areas in the city recorded a steep hike in pollution levels with more than 24 times the average level.

As per the indicators of pollution monitoring systems, on Friday morning Delhi's RK Puram monitoring station recorded PM2.5 and PM10 at 878, which is quite hazardous.

But in comparison to last year, pollution levels this year seems much lower. In 2016, the day after Diwali, the Air Quality Index was recorded at 431, as compared to 319 this year.

In 2016, particulate matter (PM)10 and PM2.5 was recorded at over eight times the safe limit. This year, however, PM10 and PM2.5 levels were over two and half times the satisfactory limit.

Several news agencies and people from the city have been tweeting images of smog and pollution from Friday morning.

Here is a post showing India Gate a day after Diwali from 2016 and 2017.

Delhi: Visuals of #Smog from NH 24 near Pandav Nagar pic.twitter.com/N1beGXWzJU â€” ANI (@ANI) October 20, 2017

Its not Venusian surface its Delhi with runaway green house gas. Special ğŸ™ to parties who made this even worse. #delhipollution pic.twitter.com/sC7unqxmnR â€” Dhrithi Manohar (@DhrithiManohar) October 20, 2017

Next day of Diwali

Time 8:30AM

Location: Chirag delhi, CR Park pic.twitter.com/pDSNuQj0ZS â€” kanishka proothi (@imkproothi) October 20, 2017

TITLE: Air Quality In Delhi Was Slightly Better This Diwali, But Is That Enough?

Googleâ€™s parent company Alphabet has deployed its 4G-connected balloons to the hurricane-hit island of Puerto Rico.
Project Loon was devised by Alphabet as a series of inter-connected high-altitude balloons that work with each other to bring 4G mobile connectivity to places where networks are either scarce or have been damaged.
Project LoonWorking in partnership with the Puerto Rican government, AT&T and FEMA, Project Loon is currently working to provide a strong and stable internet connection to parts of the island that were hit the worst.
â€œThis is the first time we have used our new machine learning powered algorithms to keep balloons clustered over Puerto Rico,â€ explains Alastair Westgarth, head of Project Loon.
Once they reach the stratosphere, Googleâ€™s own machine-learning algorithms can then actually predict and navigate the airflow currents, helping the balloons reach their intended destination.
TEXT:
Googleâ€™s parent company Alphabet has deployed its 4G-connected balloons to the hurricane-hit island of Puerto Rico.

Project Loon was devised by Alphabet as a series of inter-connected high-altitude balloons that work with each other to bring 4G mobile connectivity to places where networks are either scarce or have been damaged.

Project Loon

Working in partnership with the Puerto Rican government, AT&T and FEMA, Project Loon is currently working to provide a strong and stable internet connection to parts of the island that were hit the worst.

â€œThis is the first time we have used our new machine learning powered algorithms to keep balloons clustered over Puerto Rico,â€ explains Alastair Westgarth, head of Project Loon.

â€œAs we get more familiar with the constantly shifting winds in this region, we hope to keep the balloons over areas where connectivity is needed for as long as possible.â€

This isnâ€™t the first time Project Loon has been used in a real-world emergency environment, however it is the first time that the team have been able to test out their new machine-learning algorithm for navigating the balloons to their destination.

Project Loon

â€œProject Loon is still an experimental technology and weâ€™re not quite sure how well it will work, but we hope it helps get people the information and communication they need to get through this unimaginably difficult time.â€ said Westgarth.

The idea is remarkably simple, but the execution is fantastically complicated.

Each balloon contains effectively its very own cell tower along with the ability to relay signals between itself, other balloons and cell towers down on the ground.

The balloons are then inflated and launched at Project Loonâ€™s Nevada HQ using a specially built autolauncher. Once they reach the stratosphere, Googleâ€™s own machine-learning algorithms can then actually predict and navigate the airflow currents, helping the balloons reach their intended destination.

Project Loon

Each balloon can stay aloft for at least 100-days, upon which time itâ€™s safely brought back to Earth and another balloon takes its place.

The idea is that there is a constant network available that can then be navigated to where it needs to be and can provide a stable internet connection.
TITLE: Alphabet's Project Loon Is Providing 4G Connectivity For Puerto Rico

SUMMARY:
The tortoise partner they introduced him to worked wonders.
That's how it was recently discovered that Jonathan, probably the oldest known living creature, was a little bit gay.
Jonathan was given as a gift to the remote island of St Helena back in the 1882, along with three other tortoises.
The news comes as St Helena, a tropical island in the South Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Africa, faces a debate on legalising same-sex marriage.
The tiny British territory which is one of the most remote islands in the world has a population of just 4,534.
TEXT:
Jonathan the tortoise is blind and can't smell, but has excellent hearing.

Jonathan, a 186-year-old Seychelles giant tortoise, met the love of his life way back in 1991.

His carers decided he needed a special someone after the active 150-ish-year-old became irritable and difficult to deal with.

The tortoise partner they introduced him to worked wonders. Jonathan and his partner enjoyed doing almost everything together -- sleeping, eating, and their frequent mating sessions.

For years though, Jonathan's owners had been confused as to why the two -- her name was Frederica -- weren't producing any offspring.

But one day when Frederica required medical care for a lesion on her shell, they realised the reason why. Frederica was male.

That's how it was recently discovered that Jonathan, probably the oldest known living creature, was a little bit gay.

What's even sweeter -- in a St Helena Government press release it was noted that "Jonathan came over and would not leave our side the whole way through" the treatment of his companion.

Jonathan was given as a gift to the remote island of St Helena back in the 1882, along with three other tortoises. While he has since lost his sense of smell and capacity to see, Jonathan retains good hearing.

The exact date of his birth is unknown, but a photograph of Jonathan taken around 1886 suggests that he is around 185 years old.

The news comes as St Helena, a tropical island in the South Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Africa, faces a debate on legalising same-sex marriage. The tiny British territory which is one of the most remote islands in the world has a population of just 4,534. The Legislative Council is currently taking submissions on the matter, and a full Supreme Court hearing will most likely occur in January of next year.
TITLE: The Oldest Animal In The World Is Probably Gay

SUMMARY:
No quiero incomodar a nadie por mi ansiedad y por ser la persona que soy.
Deben saber que mi ansiedad no es algo sobre lo que haya que bromear o de lo que burlarse.
La cosa es que la ansiedad es muy real.
Ya sÃ© que puede resultar frustrante, pero es lo que necesito para sentir cierta seguridad, para sentir que puedo confiar en ustedes.
Mi ansiedad es una batalla, pero he tomado la decisiÃ³n de ponerme la armadura para hacer frente a ese gigante.
TEXT:
Escrito por Kaley Brown

Lo siento.

Mi vida ha sido una continua serie de lo sientos. A veces, ni siquiera sÃ© quÃ© ni por quÃ© lo siento. Esas dos palabras simplemente se me escapan. La mayorÃ­a de las veces lo siento porque noto que arrastro una gran carga conmigo y me veo como un estorbo.

No quiero incomodar a nadie por mi ansiedad y por ser la persona que soy. No quiero que nadie me juzgue, pero eso es algo que escapa de mi control. No me gusta decir "lo siento", pero es que sinceramente lo siento.

Durante muchos aÃ±os, me he visto a mÃ­ misma como un estorbo por mi ansiedad, asÃ­ que siempre me he metido en mi burbuja, pensando que, si bajaba la guardia, notarÃ­an mis rarezas y me acusarÃ­an de ser demasiado dramÃ¡tica. Supongo que ese miedo surge de las veces que he oÃ­do algo como "estÃ¡s siendo un poco dramÃ¡tica".

Curiosamente, la ansiedad no consiste en actuar de una determinada manera. Se puede manifestar de muchas formas, pero tener ansiedad no significa ser una dramÃ¡tica, de modo que, por favor, no me digan lo contrario. Ya he escuchado lo ridÃ­culo que le parece a mucha gente que me preocupe por algunas cosas por las que no me "deberÃ­a preocupar". OjalÃ¡ fuera tan sencillo.

Si pudiera apagar mi ansiedad con un botÃ³n, lo harÃ­a, pero no funciona asÃ­.

Â¿De verdad creen que me gusta estar preocupada? Â¿Es posible que alguien crea que disfruto cuando mi estÃ³mago se vuelve loco? Â¿O que siento placer cuando me tiembla el cuerpo, el corazÃ³n me va a 100 por hora y no paro de darle vueltas a la cabeza? Supongo que pueden responder a esas preguntas ustedes solitos. EstarÃ­a bien que entendieran que, si pudiera apagar mi ansiedad con un botÃ³n, lo harÃ­a, pero no funciona asÃ­.

Molestarme por mi ansiedad y mi pÃ¡nico no es gracioso. Ya sÃ© que son bromas, pero siempre hay una verdad en la que se fundamentan esas "simples bromas". Mi ansiedad viene aparejada de una mayor sensibilidad.

Soy una persona frÃ¡gil. No soy capaz de tomarme tan a la ligera sus palabras. Deben saber que mi ansiedad no es algo sobre lo que haya que bromear o de lo que burlarse. Es una enfermedad.

La ansiedad no viene con un libro de instrucciones. Puede atacar en el momento menos esperado, en cualquier lugar, y dejarte tirado en medio del suelo. Me ha pasado cientos de veces.

La cosa es que la ansiedad es muy real. Es dolorosa. Es incapacitante. Es una gran bola de miedo, pensamientos negativos enredados y preocupaciones. Cuando sufro un episodio de ansiedad, no soy capaz de pensar con claridad. Me centro demasiado en las cosas. Cuando digo "me centro", es mÃ¡s bien "me obsesiono".

Por alguna extraÃ±a razÃ³n, pienso que cuanto mÃ¡s le de vueltas a lo mismo, antes desaparecerÃ¡ de mi mente arrastrando mis preocupaciones y miedos. Â¿Pueden adivinar cuÃ¡ntas veces me ha funcionado? Cero.

Por favor, sean amables conmigo. Llevo en mi cuerpo el precinto de "frÃ¡gil". No puedo esconder mis sentimientos. Me implico emocionalmente al mÃ¡ximo con todo.

A menudo, cuando estoy sufriendo un episodio de ansiedad, no soy capaz de escuchar lo que me dicen porque los pensamientos que hay en mi cabeza me hablan mucho mÃ¡s alto. A veces, no necesito que digan nada. Basta con un abrazo. Con hacerme compaÃ±Ã­a. Con sentarse a mi lado. Simplemente con estar ahÃ­. Es lo Ãºnico que necesito cuando entro en esa espiral de ansiedad.

Por favor, no desprecien mis preocupaciones y mis miedos. Eso solo complica mÃ¡s la situaciÃ³n. Aunque me digan que han cerrado la puerta, necesito comprobarlo. Si me aseguran que van a hacer algo, por favor, cumplan su palabra, y seguramente se los pida cuatro o cinco veces para asegurarme de que lo hacen.

Ya sÃ© que puede resultar frustrante, pero es lo que necesito para sentir cierta seguridad, para sentir que puedo confiar en ustedes. No es porque piense que son mentirosos, es solo que necesito controlar de alguna forma mi mente.

Mi ansiedad es una batalla, pero he tomado la decisiÃ³n de ponerme la armadura para hacer frente a ese gigante. La ansiedad no me define, pero es una faceta enorme de mi vida y ya he logrado asumirla. Soy quien soy y aunque mi mente y mi cuerpo estÃ©n plagados de ansiedad, aÃºn creo que soy capaz de cambiar las cosas.

Este post fue publicado originalmente enâ€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹ The Mighty, apareciÃ³ posteriormente en HuffPost Estados Unidos y ha sido traducido del inglÃ©s por Daniel Templeman Sauco para El HuffPost.

*Este contenido representa la opiniÃ³n del autor y no necesariamente la de HuffPost MÃ©xico.
TITLE: Cuando la ansiedad te hace sentir que eres un estorbo

Dieter Bohlen traf beim "Supertalent" einen seiner grÃ¶ÃŸten Fans

Die 50-JÃ¤hrige weinte vor Freude, ihren Schwarm persÃ¶nlich kennenlernen zu dÃ¼rfen

Dieter Bohlen ist fÃ¼r seine markigen und teilweise harten SprÃ¼che bekannt. Doch nicht deshalb brachte er bei der RTL-Show "Das Supertalent" am Samstagabend eine Zuschauern zum Weinen. "So nah, das hÃ¤tte ich nie gedacht"

Auf der BÃ¼hne brach sie dann in TrÃ¤nen aus - und Bohlen umarmte sie ganz fest. "Ich liebe dich seit 30 Jahren. Es war ein Geschenk der Kinder zum Geburtstag, dich zu sehen", sagte Seehafn. "Aber so nah, das hÃ¤tte ich nie gedacht. Jetzt kann ich sterben, jetzt ist mir alles egal", scherzte sie.

Der Juror wollte daraufhin wissen, was sie an Bohlen besonders liebe. Seehafn sagte zu ihrem Schwarm: "Dich, deine Musik, deine SprÃ¼che - alles, Dieter, alles. Was fÃ¼r ein GlÃ¼ck, du lieber Gott."

Plus, Kesha's triumphant return sparked a discussion about the most effective pop comebacks of recent years, with Rihanna getting the thumbs up from the group (which is more than can be said for Lady Gaga). HuffPost UK's entertainment podcast

How Whitney Houston Taught Me To Forgive My life was ruined. I felt like a big piece of me had also died. No one wanted to work with me. The media made me out to be a horrible person. And my singing meant nothing. Because Whitney was dead. Singer, actress and Celebrity Big Brother Housemate 2017

The Voice vs. The X-Factor: A Fair Comparison In the UK, X-Factor 2016 ended a few days before the new year emerged. Some days after 2017, The Voice started. I have been watching talent shows for ... All-around freelance writer

Has ITV Given The Voice The 'X Factor' And Unearthed A Pop Star? Step forward Mo Adeniran. The very first week of the new series on ITV and a star has fallen into their laps. The BBC must be secretly kicking themselves that no-one like Mo had deigned to audition while on their channel. Despite all The X Factor's misgivings, the show certainly knew how to launch a star and it seems that The Voice UK now has one of its own. Writer & Blogger who loves to comment about TV, music & entertainment

Are We Living In A 'Fame' Crisis? The industry is lacking in authenticity. Now, people want to be famous for the sake of being famous even though they don't necessarily have the talent in a particular area, so the world of 'celebrityism' has been filled up with Big Brother winners and X Factor dropouts. Founder and Director at Creative Industry Hub

Why Are We Getting Honey G For Life And Not Just For Christmas? With The Voice looking to start the new year with a bang, it seems unfortunate that The X Factor has become a ministry of blandness this time but a Saara win could be enough to show the new singing competition in town that the old dog still have some bite and shouldn't be put down quite yet. Writer & Blogger who loves to comment about TV, music & entertainment

Predicting The Winner Of The X-Factor I believe that all of them will have a career in music, as well as singers that left the X-Factor before them. SUMMARY:
Una historia que tiene dos escenarios principales, dos cÃ¡maras: el Senado y el Parlament.
Y en este juego de tiempos: el presidente catalÃ¡n estudia comparecer en la CÃ¡mara Alta (algo que podrÃ­a suceder el jueves por la tarde o el viernes por la maÃ±ana).
En el Parlament catalÃ¡n tienen previsto celebrar un pleno monogrÃ¡fico el jueves, en el que podrÃ­a incluso aprobarse una declaraciÃ³n unilateral de independencia.
Â¿DeclararÃ¡ la independencia el Parlament el jueves por la tarde antes de que el Senado apruebe definitivamente el 155?
El 155 tambiÃ©n es cortante en la vida interna del PSOE y su relaciÃ³n con el PSC.
TEXT:
Una semana de infarto, dÃ­as histÃ³ricos, choque de trenes. Se agotan las expresiones y los lugares comunes que acompaÃ±an a la crisis catalana. Y es que los acontecimientos van mÃ¡s rÃ¡pido que los diccionarios y mutan constantemente. Cada segundo un giro, un cambio de guiÃ³n.

Pero sÃ­, esta semana es crÃ­tica. Se vivirÃ¡n cosas en EspaÃ±a que nunca imaginamos. Una historia que tiene dos escenarios principales, dos cÃ¡maras: el Senado y el Parlament. En la primera se tramitarÃ¡ definitivamente la aplicaciÃ³n del artÃ­culo 155, y en la segunda se harÃ¡ un pleno el jueves, como avanzÃ³ Carles Puigdemont, para responder al "ataque" que suponen las medidas del Gobierno y actuar "en consecuencia", con la posibilidad de una declaraciÃ³n unilateral de independencia. Y en este juego de tiempos: el presidente catalÃ¡n estudia comparecer en la CÃ¡mara Alta (algo que podrÃ­a suceder el jueves por la tarde o el viernes por la maÃ±ana).

Este lunes ha servido para marcar los territorios y las hojas de ruta a seguir. El Senado, tan criticado en la vida polÃ­tica y entre los ciudadanos por su aparente irrelevancia, ya estÃ¡ preparado para dar el visto bueno a una de las decisiones mÃ¡s duras de nuestra democracia. Durante esta jornada, los grupos parlamentarios han registrado los nombres de los 27 senadores (15 del PP, 6 del PSOE, 2 de Podemos y un representante de ERC, PDeCAT, PNV y del Grupo Mixto, respectivamente), que participarÃ¡n en la comisiÃ³n del 155, antes del Pleno definitivo del viernes.

ECHA A ANDAR LA TRAMITACIÃ“N DEL 155 EN EL SENADO

El trÃ¡mite parlamentario es el siguiente: la ComisiÃ³n se constituirÃ¡ este martes a las 13 horas y posteriormente nombrarÃ¡ a una Ponencia, que elaborarÃ¡ un dictamen sobre las medidas aprobadas por el Consejo de Ministros extraordinario (que suponen, entre otros aspectos, el cese de Puigdemont y sus consellers y la convocatoria de elecciones en un plazo mÃ¡ximo de seis meses). Desde este martes hasta el jueves por la maÃ±ana, se abre un periodo para que se puedan registrar enmiendas por parte de los grupos y para que pueda presentar documentos y alegaciones Puigdemont o alguien de su Govern.

GarcÃ­a-Escudero ofrece a Puigdemont que hable en el Pleno extraordinario del Senado el viernes

El presidente estÃ¡ estudiando aparecer en persona en el Senado para defenderse ante la aplicaciÃ³n del artÃ­culo 155. TodavÃ­a no lo ha confirmado, pero tiene la disposiciÃ³n de hacerlo. Â¿Y cuÃ¡ndo serÃ­a el momentazo en Madrid? El vicepresidente del Senado, Pedro Sanz, ha dicho en un primer momento que deberÃ­a ser en la reuniÃ³n de la ComisiÃ³n del jueves a las 17 horas. Pero, el presidente de la CÃ¡mara Alta, PÃ­o GarcÃ­a-Escudero, ha ofrecido posteriormente la posibilidad de que pueda expresarse en el Pleno extraordinario del viernes en el que se aprobarÃ¡n las medidas -en el caso de que tenga el jueves por la tarde Pleno en el Parlament-. Si fuera el viernes, el presidente catalÃ¡n hablarÃ­a ya con el dictamen de la ComisiÃ³n del 155 aprobado y sin posibilidad de alegaciones.

EL JUEVES CITA EN EL PARLAMENT: Â¿HABRÃ DECLARACIÃ“N DE INDEPENDENCIA?

Un juego de tiempos al lÃ­mite. En el Parlament catalÃ¡n tienen previsto celebrar un pleno monogrÃ¡fico el jueves, en el que podrÃ­a incluso aprobarse una declaraciÃ³n unilateral de independencia. La Junta de Portavoces ha dado cauce al anuncio hecho por Puigdemont el sÃ¡bado por la noche con el fin de contestar a las medidas del 155 acordadas por Rajoy.

La hora no se ha fijado todavÃ­a a la espera de la decisiÃ³n del president de acudir al Senado y que, en caso afirmativo, pueda compatibilizar estos dos procesos parlamentarios. Lo que sÃ­ se sabe es que la Junta de Portavoces ha decidido que al finalizar el Pleno del Parlament los grupos puedan presentar resoluciones -lo que podrÃ­an aprovechar Junts pel SÃ­ y la CUP para incluir un texto de declaraciÃ³n de independencia-.

El presidente del grupo parlamentario de Junts pel SÃ­, LluÃ­s Corominas, no ha concretado si el Pleno del Parlament del jueves servirÃ¡ para someter a votaciÃ³n la declaraciÃ³n de independencia. El president Puigdemont, en la segunda carta enviada a Rajoy por el requerimiento, amenazÃ³ con ello diciendo que si el Gobierno impedÃ­a el diÃ¡logo y continuaba con la "represiÃ³n", el Parlament podrÃ­a proceder a votar la declaraciÃ³n formal de independencia que no votÃ³ el 10 de octubre.

Surgen entonces una serie de preguntas y de dudas temporales. Â¿DeclararÃ¡ la independencia el Parlament el jueves por la tarde antes de que el Senado apruebe definitivamente el 155? Â¿Se proclamarÃ¡ la independencia y al dÃ­a siguiente aparecerÃ¡ Puigdemont en Madrid en la CÃ¡mara Alta?

Los socios de Puigdemont siguen apretando hacia el extremo mÃ¡ximo. Desde ERC, Sergi SabriÃ¡, ha asegurado: "La mejor respuesta al ataque del 155 es la repÃºblica catalana". La CUP presiona para que sea ya esa declaraciÃ³n y ha avanzado que van a realizar acciones de "lucha no violenta" para criticar la aplicaciÃ³n del artÃ­culo 155.

Ante estas especulaciones sobre la DUI, se ha escuchado muy atentamente el aviso que ha hecho el fiscal general del Estado, JosÃ© Manuel Maza, que ha asegurado que si Puigdemont declara la independencia, "tendrÃ¡n que ser las Fuerzas y Cuerpos de Seguridad del Estado las que procedan a su detenciÃ³n", ya que "es cuestiÃ³n de las fuerzas de orden pÃºblico".

A no ser que se produzca un giro inesperado, el 155 estarÃ¡ aquÃ­ el viernes. No obstante, la vicepresidenta del Gobierno, Soraya SÃ¡enz de SantamarÃ­a, ha recordado que el Senado tiene capacidad para adaptar el texto del Gobierno ante lo que pueda suceder en la Generalitat y en el Parlament durante la semana. Pero los partidos que acordaron las medidas -PP, PSOE y Cs- no ven a Puigdemont dando un paso atrÃ¡s. Desde el mundo econÃ³mico se ha intentado frenar otra vez al president este lunes, con la llamada del CÃ­rculo de EconomÃ­a a que convoque de manera inmediata elecciones autonÃ³micas, ya que considera que es la Ãºnica alternativa para "reconducir las aspiraciones de unos y otros por el cauce de la normalidad y la legalidad".

Todo estÃ¡ en ebulliciÃ³n, en peligro de quiebra. El 155 tambiÃ©n es cortante en la vida interna del PSOE y su relaciÃ³n con el PSC. El sÃ¡bado anunciÃ³ su dimisiÃ³n de la Ejecutiva federal la alcaldesa de Santa Coloma de Gramenet (Barcelona), NÃºria Parlon, uno de los referentes del flanco mÃ¡s de izquierdas del socialismo catalÃ¡n. Desde el independentismo se han hecho llamadas a los senadores del PSC para que voten en contra del 155. Ferraz rebaja la tensiÃ³n interna y el lÃ­der socialista autonÃ³mico, Miquel Iceta, niega que va a haber una "ruptura" dentro del PSC.

Siete dÃ­as, 155 infartos polÃ­ticos.
TITLE: Una semana de 155 infartos

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTOn 18 October, George Saunders became the second American to win the Man Booker Prize, since it was opened out to writers in English across the world.
To begin with a rather obvious question: tell us the thoughts that crossed your mind when you were named the winner.
I honestly wasn't expecting to win, so my mind went pretty much blank.
I notice that my mind "on Internet" is snarkier, more aggressive, shallower, less kind.
I am also re-reading some James Baldwin at the moment, and had a beautiful experience reading the books of my fellow Man Booker Prize shortlisted writers.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

On 18 October, George Saunders became the second American to win the Man Booker Prize, since it was opened out to writers in English across the world.

Lincoln in the Bardo, the book for which he won it, is his first novel, published at the age of 58 and after a successful career as one of America's finest short story writers.

A haunting story, put together with patchwork quotes from extant sources, historical documents as well as imagined chronicles, Lincoln in the Bardo is unabashedly brave with its formalist experiments.

Moving between 19th century America and that nebulous zone called the Bardo, in Tibetan Buddhist philosophy, where the souls of the dead get stuck on their way to heaven or hell, the novel revisits a grieving Abraham Lincoln, struck by the death of his 11-year-old son Willie in 1862.

The story, featuring apparitions and humans, is complex and layered, but executed with a lightness of touch and spirit of generosity, making Lincoln in the Bardo a contemporary classic.

Saunders spoke to HuffPost India on email soon after he was named the winner.

Many congratulations! To begin with a rather obvious question: tell us the thoughts that crossed your mind when you were named the winner.

Thank you so much. I honestly wasn't expecting to win, so my mind went pretty much blank. Then a surge of gratitude. And then a surge of gladness that I had already written a speech and would not have to improvise, from that state of high adrenaline.

Your transition from short fiction to the longer form has given us a beautiful, structurally complex and many-layered novel. How did this shift affect your writing and thinking? I'm also curious about its physical and emotional impact on you in general.

Well, thank you again. I would say that writing the book put me, for those four years, in a really wonderful, elevated mental state â€” open and curious, having fun on every writing day. Using that 19th century diction (or my approximate version of it) had the effect of opening up new areas of my mind. It felt as if, in the first half, I threw a bunch of bowling pins into the air, and then they came down very deliberately in the second half, as if they had wills of their own â€” a magical and mysterious process that I am still thinking about.

What would you say is the most frustrating moment for a writer and how do you overcome it?

I love this quote from Einstein: "No worthy problem is ever solved in the plane of its original conception." And I try to think that any frustration I feel when writing is, essentially, the story telling me that my current vision of it is too small. It has higher aspirations for itself and my attempts to control it â€” my attempts to handle (and limit) it with my conceptual apparatus â€” is causing the story to throw a small tantrum, until I adjust my vision upwards.

You began writing Lincoln in the Bardo years away from the political moment America is witnessing now. From its conception to publication, did the world of circumstances, especially the upheavals America has been through in the last few years, affect the destiny of the novel?

The book was essentially finished before the rise of the Trump phenomenon. But I think that if a writer is working hard and trying to get her or his work to be as deep as possible, it will accommodate whatever political moment arises. In this case, it was interesting to have written (what I see as) a sort of homage to the honourable and beautiful parts of the American project, only to see the country veer off the path. It felt good to have clarified my relation to my own country, via the book. Then it is possible to see the current administration for what it is â€” an unfortunate and dangerous misunderstanding of our (true, better) national ethos.

Does your writing follow a regime? How do you cope with boredom? What's your relationship with the Internet like?

I try to write every day, although that is getting more difficult with my travel schedule. But when I'm working, I like to start fresh in the morning and work all day. It helps, I've found, if I start out in a happy state of mind. I don't get bored writing. I find that if I re-read what I've already written, that's a good way to start. I can feel all kinds of opinions about the text, and that is...well, that's writing, actually. To start marking up the page, to get into conversation with the text. As for the Internet â€” I am getting pretty sick of it, actually. I notice that my mind "on Internet" is snarkier, more aggressive, shallower, less kind. So I don't do social media, except for a pretty minimally attended Facebook author page. I've recently taken news links and Facebook off of my phone and am trying to be a little more mindful about checking mail. The real world is so beautiful and we are here for so short a time. The "virtual" world is just that â€” not real â€” and our manners in that realm are not so good. So why spend any more time there than is necessary?

As for the Internet â€” I am getting pretty sick of it, actually. I notice that my mind "on Internet" is snarkier, more aggressive, shallower, less kind.

I'm just as curious to know about your reading rituals: e-books or print, marginalia or clean books, the state of your to-read pile and what all there is in it, if you reread any particular books and which ones, your guilty secrets as a reader, the books you liked and disliked among the ones you read last.

I am a dedicated but not prolific reader. I tend to go back to certain favourites that I know will inspire me: Toni Morrison, Isaac Babel, Nikolai Gogol, Flannery O'Connor. I've recently read a brilliant book called Stamped from the Beginning, A History of Racist Ideas in America, by Ibram X. Fendi. I am also re-reading some James Baldwin at the moment, and had a beautiful experience reading the books of my fellow Man Booker Prize shortlisted writers.

If you were to send three books to President Trump, what would those be?

"How to Be a Better and Kinder President of the United States," might be one. Ha ha. No â€” I would send The Bluest Eye, by Toni Morrison â€” a beautifully compassionate book. Maybe Enrique's Journey, by Sonia Nazario, which opens up the dismissive phrase "illegal immigrant" and puts a human face on it. Also, Exit West, the wonderful novel by Mohsin Hamid, my fellow short-listed author, which might help the President have more empathy for refugees. I would also recommend Ghettoside by Jill Lepore, as an antidote for any too-simple thinking about urban violence.

If you weren't a writer who (what) would you have been?

I once heard the great American writer Tobias Wolff answer this question with one word: "Sad."

I likely would have been a musician â€” which, given the extent of my musical talent, would have been sad for everyone, or at least uncomfortable.

Also on HuffPost
TITLE: Man Booker Prize Winner George Saunders On His Craft, The Internet, And A Reading List For Donald Trump

Contestable tant sur le plan arithmÃ©tique que sur le plan politique, la punchline du "solde nÃ©gatif" n'avait Ã©tÃ© brandie pendant la campagne prÃ©sidentielle que par les adversaires les plus rÃ©solus de la construction europÃ©enne et qui faisaient voeu de la dÃ©manteler: Marine Le Pen, Nicolas Dupont-Aignan et FranÃ§ois Asselineau.

C'est Ã  cette pÃ©riode que Jean-Luc MÃ©lenchon acte Ã  la fois l'Ã©chec de la stratÃ©gie de conquÃªte du pouvoir du Front de Gauche et l'impossibilitÃ© d'Ã©chapper aux traitÃ©s libÃ©raux europÃ©ens. Le traumatisme de la forfaiture grecque de Syriza et d'Alexis Tsipras, contraint de ravaler son rÃ©fÃ©rendum et de soumettre son pays aux plans d'austÃ©ritÃ© de ses crÃ©diteurs, est passÃ© par lÃ .

"On oublie que j'ai passÃ© presque dix ans Ã  mener un combat fÃ©dÃ©raliste au niveau europÃ©en avec la gauche du SPD pour aboutir Ã  une assemblÃ©e constituante. Au bout d'un moment, j'ai laissÃ© tomber. Leur Europe, celle des traitÃ©s libÃ©raux, a gagnÃ©. Le pli est dÃ©sormais irrÃ©versible", se remÃ©morait-il cette semaine dans un entretien Ã©clairant accordÃ© Ã  l'hebdomadaire "Le 1".

Sa philosophie souverainiste y est clairement assumÃ©e. Et si elle exclut tout ethnicisme et revendique les valeurs universalistes de la France, elle rompt avec la tradition internationaliste de l'extrÃªme gauche. Mais en s'appuyant sur l'identitÃ© rÃ©publicaine de la France, on peut faire une Europe des nations bien intÃ©grÃ©e", plaide Jean-Luc MÃ©lenchon.

Souverainisme altermondialiste

De fÃ©dÃ©raliste europÃ©en, MÃ©lenchon a basculÃ© dans un souverainisme altermondialiste, inspirÃ© des nationalismes de gauche latino-amÃ©ricains. Chez l'ancien candidat Ã  la prÃ©sidentielle, cette conversion marque un changement de paradigme. En 2014 donc, "MÃ©luche" publie "L'Ere du peuple", oeuvre dont il estime aujourd'hui qu'elle est le "point de dÃ©part" de sa rÃ©volution citoyenne. Assumant "l'Ã©puisement de la vieille gauche", il y rompt avec la matrice de classe (gauche contre droite, dominÃ©s contre dominants) pour y substituer la confrontation entre le "peuple", seul dÃ©tenteur lÃ©gitime de la souverainetÃ©, et "l'oligarchie" (europÃ©enne notamment mais pas seulement) qui la lui confisque.

En vue de la prÃ©sidentielle de 2017, MÃ©lenchon prÃ©pare la rupture avec les traitÃ©s europÃ©ens. Faute d'obtenir une rÃ©vision complÃ¨te des traitÃ©s (plan A), le candidat s'engage Ã  en sortir unilatÃ©ralement pour rebÃ¢tir un nouveau projet europÃ©en. Refus de verser la contribution franÃ§aise au budget de l'UE, rÃ©quisition de la Banque de France, contrÃ´le des capitaux... C'est le fameux "plan B". "Entre la souverainetÃ© du peuple et l'euro, je choisis la souverainetÃ© du peuple", assume-t-il.

Depuis, le dÃ©putÃ© des Bouches-du-RhÃ´ne n'a pas dÃ©viÃ© de cette ligne qui justifie son opposition frontale au projet europÃ©en rÃªvÃ© par Emmanuel Macron. Lors de son discours de la Sorbonne, le prÃ©sident n'a pas fait mystÃ¨re de sa volontÃ© de bÃ¢tir une "souverainetÃ© europÃ©enne", esquissant les contours d'un fÃ©dÃ©ralisme europÃ©en qui ne dit pas son nom. Ce Ã  quoi Jean-Luc MÃ©lenchon se dit "en dÃ©saccord complet", jugeant qu'il n'y a de souverainetÃ© que "dans le peuple".

"Le peuple europÃ©en, qu'est-ce que c'est? Je ne me sens rien de commun avec les pays baltes. C'est le bout du monde, mÃªme les Romains ne sont pas allÃ©s lÃ  bas!" s'enflamme-t-il. En jurant qu'il s'opposera Ã  tout abandon de "souverainetÃ© populaire sous prÃ©texte de cantiques europÃ©istes creux et dangereux".

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Comment Jean-Luc MÃ©lenchon s'impose comme le nouveau champion du souverainisme

TEXT:
La periodista de la emisora de radio independiente Eco de MoscÃº Tatiana Felgenhauer, apuÃ±alada esta maÃ±ana en la redacciÃ³n, se encuentra hospitalizada en coma inducido, segÃºn ha informado el medio.

"Felgenhauer estÃ¡ conectada a ventilaciÃ³n mecÃ¡nica y en coma inducido", ha explicado el redactor jefe de la emisora, el conocido periodista AlexÃ©i VenedÃ­ktov.

En el hospital moscovita donde ha sido intervenida la periodista han calificado su estado de "grave", antes de provocarle el coma inducido.

SegÃºn se ha informado, un hombre armado irrumpiÃ³ esta maÃ±ana en la redacciÃ³n de la emisora 'Eco de MoscÃº' y atacÃ³ con un cuchillo a Felgenhauer, directora adjunta, que resultÃ³ herida en el cuello.

El agresor ha sido detenido por guardias de seguridad y entregado despuÃ©s a la PolicÃ­a.

Fuentes policiales han opinado que el ataque pudo haberse debido a "motivos personales" y que la vÃ­ctima quizÃ¡s conocÃ­a al agresor. "SabÃ­a adÃ³nde iba y a por quiÃ©n", ha asegurado el redactor jefe de la emisora, cuyas oficinas se encuentran en pleno centro de MoscÃº.

"ME MORTIFICABA SEXUALMENTE"

De acuerdo a varios medios y a testimonios en redes sociales, el autor del ataque ha sido identificado como Boris Grits, un ciudadano de Israel de 49 aÃ±os.

Tras su detenciÃ³n, el propio agresor asegurÃ³ que se sentÃ­a "sexualmente acosado" por la vÃ­ctima "a travÃ©s de un contacto telepÃ¡tico". "Utilizando la conexiÃ³n telepÃ¡tica, ella (Felgenhauer) me mortificaba sexualmente", ha dicho Grits en el primer interrogatorio.

Nunca la he conocido en realidad, pero la he visto y sentido. No me la podÃ­a quitar de la cabeza

"Nunca la he conocido en realidad, pero la he visto y sentido. No me la podÃ­a quitar de la cabeza", ha aÃ±adido.

El portal informativo Life ha seÃ±alado, por su parte, que el agresor habÃ­a publicado en un blog su obsesiÃ³n sobre la periodista y se habÃ­a dirigido al padre de Ã©sta para que "influyera en su hija" y ella dejara de "perseguirle".

La UniÃ³n de Periodistas de Rusia ha calificadi la agresiÃ³n contra Felgenhauer como "un ataque contra la libertad de expresiÃ³n".

Por su parte, el Sindicato de Periodistas ha seÃ±alado a travÃ±es un comunicado que parte de culpa del ataque recae sobre la televisiÃ³n estatal rusa, por haber acusado repetidas veces a Eco de MoscÃº y a Tatiana Felgenhauer de ser "agentes del Departamento de Estado de EEUU".

"Creemos que este tipo de programas instigan al odio hacia nuestros compaÃ±eros y han podido provocar el ataque contra Tatiana por parte de una persona trastornada", han seÃ±alado en el sindicato.

Die 33-JÃ¤hrige tanzt darin unter anderem in knappen Hotpants im Funkenregen oder lÃ¤sst sich in einem extrakurzen Kleidchen Ã¼ber die Arme der TÃ¤nzer tragen. Auch oben ohne ist Fischer zu sehen - nur ihre HÃ¤nde verdecken gerade so das NÃ¶tigste.

"Eine super Frau ... auch in meinem Kopf ist eine Achterbahn"

Morgenâ€¦ #helenefischer #achterbahn #sagmalspÃ¼rstdudas #videopremiere A post shared by Helene Fischer (@helenefischer) on Oct 19, 2017 at 8:31am PDT

"Achterbahn", die neue Single von Schlager-Queen Helene Fischer, kÃ¶nnt ihr hier bestellen, streamen oder downloaden

"Achterbahn" ist die erste Single seit dem Megahit "Atemlos durch die Nacht", die ein aufwÃ¤ndiges Musik-Video spendiert bekam - und das scheint sich auszuzahlen.

Binnen weniger Stunden seit der VerÃ¶ffentlichung wurde das Video bereits 650.000 Mal auf YouTube aufgerufen. "Einfach nur geil" oder "Eine super Frau... auch in meinem Kopf ist eine Achterbahn", ist unter anderem in den Kommentaren zu lesen.

Du bist nicht nur Deutschlands erfolgreichste SÃ¤ngerin, sondern auch noch die attraktivste dazu und darÃ¼ber hinaus noch super sympathisch." FÃ¼r die seit September 2017 laufende Arena-Tour mit insgesamt 69 Terminen und bis zu fÃ¼nf Shows pro Stadt sowie fÃ¼r die im Sommer 2018 folgende Stadion-Tournee sind schon jetzt fast eine Million Tickets verkauft.

SUMMARY:
Joti also added that he had not taken "any undue favours from the government".
Joti became an election commissioner in 2015, and is said to have retained the bungalow in Ahmedabad till 2016.
As an official who holds a constitutional position, Joti is not supposed to take any favours from any government.
Joti had defended the decision to not announce poll dates for Gujarat saying it would affect the flood relief operations in the state.
Joti retired as the Gujarat Chief Secretary in January 2013.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Amid reports that he may have taken favours from the Gujarat government even after taking up a constitutional post, Chief Election Commissioner Achal Kumar Joti denied the allegations saying he had not sought favours from the government.

The Wire had reported last week that documents related to a case filed by a senior police officer at the Central Administrative Tribunal, Guwahati bench, showed that Joti had retained the bungalow allotted to him in Ahmedabad by the Gujarat government even after becoming CEC.

Denying these allegations Joti told The Times of India, "I requested the Gujarat government to allow me to keep possession of the house in the Dafnala area of Ahmedabad as I could not have lived with my wife for a year in Delhi's Gujarat Bhavan. I have paid the rent as per Gujarat government norms."

Joti also added that he had not taken "any undue favours from the government".

Joti became an election commissioner in 2015, and is said to have retained the bungalow in Ahmedabad till 2016. As an official who holds a constitutional position, Joti is not supposed to take any favours from any government.

The reports have hence raised questions Joti's ability to maintain a neutral stand.

These reports assume further significance given that the Gujarat Assembly polls have been delayed, and the Opposition has alleged it was to favour Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the Gujarat government.

Joti had defended the decision to not announce poll dates for Gujarat saying it would affect the flood relief operations in the state.

The Hindu had quoted him as saying, "When the model code of conduct is in force, it is not possible to keep them from election duty. All government officials, including Gram Panchayat and Taluk level officials, have to be deployed for elections."

Joti became the CEC in 2017 succeeding Nasim Zaidi. Joti retired as the Gujarat Chief Secretary in January 2013. He was also the Secretary in the Industry, Revenue and Water Supply Departments in the State.
TITLE: Didn't Take Undue Favour From Gujarat Government, Says CEC AK Joti Over Allegations Of Not Vacating Official Bungalow

Meter la compra en bolsas reutilizables es estupendo para el medio ambiente, pero podrÃ­a resultar peligroso para la salud, ya que existe un riesgo de intoxicaciÃ³n alimentaria si no se siguen ciertas medidas de seguridad.
AsÃ­ lo asegura la Agencia de Normas Alimentarias del Reino Unido (FSA en inglÃ©s), que recomienda seguir determinados consejos para evitar que este tipo de bolsas ecolÃ³gicas supongan un riesgo para la salud.
Algunas de las recomendaciones que ofrecen son separar en distintas bolsas los alimentos crudos y los que estÃ¡n ya preparados y lavar dichas bolsas con frecuencia.
Esto no quiere decir que las bolsas reutilizables sean malas.
Los expertos recomiendan guardar los alimentos crudos, los alimentos que ya estÃ¡n listos para comer y los productos no alimentarios (productos de limpieza, por ejemplo) en bolsas independientes.
TEXT:
Meter la compra en bolsas reutilizables es estupendo para el medio ambiente, pero podrÃ­a resultar peligroso para la salud, ya que existe un riesgo de intoxicaciÃ³n alimentaria si no se siguen ciertas medidas de seguridad.

AsÃ­ lo asegura la Agencia de Normas Alimentarias del Reino Unido (FSA en inglÃ©s), que recomienda seguir determinados consejos para evitar que este tipo de bolsas ecolÃ³gicas supongan un riesgo para la salud.

Algunas de las recomendaciones que ofrecen son separar en distintas bolsas los alimentos crudos y los que estÃ¡n ya preparados y lavar dichas bolsas con frecuencia.

Estos consejos fueron publicados en la web de la FSA en agosto, pero no adquirieron bastante repercusiÃ³n hasta hace poco, debido a varias demandas por la deficiente normativa de higiene a la que estÃ¡n sometidos los principales proveedores de alimentos del Reino Unido.

DIGITALSKILLET VIA GETTY IMAGES

De acuerdo con la FSA, incluso los alimentos crudos envasados como el pollo pueden contener "trazas de organismos peligrosos en el exterior del envoltorio", lo que implica que no deben colocarse junto a los alimentos que ya estÃ¡n listos para comer.

Aunque el Servicio Nacional de Salud del Reino Unido (NHS) asegura que bacterias como la salmonela o la campylobacter (dos de las fuentes de intoxicaciÃ³n alimentaria mÃ¡s frecuentes) solo son capaces de sobrevivir entre una y cuatro horas sobre superficies duras o tejidos, otros estudios indican que algunas bacterias como la E. colipueden sobrevivir mÃ¡s de 25 dÃ­as en alimentos como la lechuga.

Un estudio anterior de la Universidad de Pensilvania y la Universidad George MasonrelacionÃ³ la prohibiciÃ³n en San Francisco (EE UU) del uso de bolsas de plÃ¡stico con un aumento repentino de infecciones por E. coli en el Estado.

Los hallazgos del estudio recuerdan a los de un artÃ­culo de 2011 llevado a cabo por la Universidad de Arizona y la Escuela de Salud PÃºblica de Loma Linda (California), que detectÃ³ E. coli en el 8% de bolsas reutilizables analizadas, seleccionadas de forma aleatoria.

Esto no quiere decir que las bolsas reutilizables sean malas. SegÃºn las estadÃ­sticas, en el Reino Unido se emplean 6000 millones menos de bolsas de plÃ¡stico cada aÃ±o desde que dejaron de ser gratuitas, algo que, ademÃ¡s, ha permitido donar mÃ¡s de 29 millones de libras (31,5 millones de euros) a organizaciones benÃ©ficas y grupos comunitarios, solo a partir del precio de las bolsas.

Sin perder de vista esos datos, la FSA ha publicado cuatro consejos para no poner en riesgo la salud:

1. Utiliza bolsas distintas para cada tipo de productos.

Los expertos recomiendan guardar los alimentos crudos, los alimentos que ya estÃ¡n listos para comer y los productos no alimentarios (productos de limpieza, por ejemplo) en bolsas independientes. Para no mezclarlas, recomiendan ponerles alguna marca distintiva. No te desvÃ­es de ese cÃ³digo y no utilices para los alimentos crudos una bolsa que haya estado anteriormente llena de productos listos para comer, y viceversa.

2. Elige bien el material de la bolsa.

Si tienes pensado reutilizar bolsas regularmente y no quieres molestarte en sustituirlas de vez en cuando, la FSA recomienda las que estÃ¡n hechas de algodÃ³n. Aunque suelen ser mÃ¡s caras, tambiÃ©n pueden meterse en la lavadora. Las bolsas reutilizables de materiales plÃ¡sticos, por el contrario, no se pueden meter a la lavadora, pero son mÃ¡s baratas.

3. Utiliza bolsas tÃ©rmicas cuando haga calor.

De esta forma, los alimentos perecederos se mantendrÃ¡n frescos durante mÃ¡s tiempo y se reducirÃ¡ el riesgo de que se echen a perder.

4. Comprueba que no haya derrames.

La FSA aconseja revisar las bolsas despuÃ©s de cada uso por si acaso tienen algÃºn derrame, especialmente jugos de alimentos crudos. Si lo ha habido, conviene sustituir la bolsa (si es de plÃ¡stico) o meterla a la lavadora (si es de algodÃ³n).

Este artÃ­culo fue publicado originalmente en el 'HuffPost' Reino Unido y ha sido traducido del inglÃ©s por Daniel Templeman Sauco.
TITLE: Cuatro consejos para evitar el riesgo de intoxicaciÃ³n al usar bolsas reciclables

SUMMARY:
According to a recent study, introverts are more likely to suffer from a poor nightâ€™s sleep than extroverts.
The researchers asked adults to complete a personality test before answering survey questions about their sleeping habits.
For the study, the researchers asked 1,000 people to complete the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) personality test.
In addition, extroverts are 6.5.% more satisfied with their ability to sleep through the night than their introverted counterparts.
But whether youâ€™re an introvert, an extrovert, or somewhere close to the middle of the scale, poor sleep doesnâ€™t have to be a fact of life.
TEXT:
Being an introvert could be behind your lack of energy. According to a recent study, introverts are more likely to suffer from a poor nightâ€™s sleep than extroverts.

The researchers asked adults to complete a personality test before answering survey questions about their sleeping habits.

They found extroverts are 17.7% more satisfied with their levels of energy during the day than introverts.

Whatâ€™s more, the results indicated introverts have nightmares more often than their extraverted counterparts and are more likely to fall asleep during the day.

Squaredpixels via Getty Images

The research was conducted by a team of researchers working on behalf of bed company Best Mattress Brand.

For the study, the researchers asked 1,000 people to complete the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) personality test.

The test is designed to reveal the characteristics of someoneâ€™s personality and as part of the results, a person is told whether they are an extrovert or introvert.

Under the test, extroversion and introversion are represented on a scale, but broadly speaking, extroverts prefer to focus on the outer world and take their energy from interaction with others, while introverts prefer to focus on their internal world and draw energy from quiet time alone.

After they were given a personality type, the researchers asked participants to share information about their sleeping patterns, levels of alertness and dreams.

Their results suggest extroverts are 17.7% more satisfied with their levels of energy during waking hours than introverts.

In addition, extroverts are 6.5.% more satisfied with their ability to sleep through the night than their introverted counterparts.

In comparison, introverts are also 14.8% less satisfied with the amount they feel alert during waking hours than extroverts.

These experiences may be related to the types of dreams that we have.

According to the data, extroverts have nightmares 8.3% less often than introverts. They are dream about their teeth falling out 14.2% less often and dream about punching something with no effect 14% less than introverts.

At the other end of the scale, the study found extroverts dream about traveling 13.9% more often than introverts.

With introverts struggling to have a restful nightâ€™s sleep, it appears many find it hard to keep their eyes open during the day.

Introverts are apparently 7.7% more likely to fall asleep when trying to stay awake than extroverts, which doesnâ€™t bode well for those Monday morning meetings.

The study did not delve into why these patterns may appear, but simply looked at the key statistics for each personality group.

But whether youâ€™re an introvert, an extrovert, or somewhere close to the middle of the scale, poor sleep doesnâ€™t have to be a fact of life.

Check out our top tips for getting a better nightâ€™s sleep here.

10 Top Tips For An Amazing Sleep
TITLE: How Being An Introvert Could Affect Your Sleep
