", fragte sie mich. Ich antwortete ihr: "Ich bin Deutscher.
Ich entgegnete ihr daraufhin, dass sie schon Deutsch mit mir reden mÃ¼sse, wenn sie denn wolle, dass ich sie verstehe.
Sie hassen das, was 'die da oben' machen, davon sind Sie und er und er und sie und ich alle gleichermaÃŸen betroffen, sagte ich und zeigte auf andere Menschen in der NÃ¤he.
Aber anstatt dass Sie sich gegen die Ursachen Ihrer Probleme wehren, schlagen Sie immer nach unten auf die, die es noch beschissener haben."
TEXT:
Der Berliner Farid Boucher wird in der U-Bahn von einer Frau dazu aufgefordert, sich nicht neben sie zu setzen

Er entschlieÃŸt sich dazu, seine Erlebnisse aufzuschreiben, da er eine Bitte an alle Menschen in Deutschland hat

Im Video oben seht ihr, wie alltÃ¤glich Rassismus in Deutschland ist

Eigentlich ist es nicht meine Art, Dinge, die mich persÃ¶nlich betreffen, jedem auf die Nase zu binden. Aber dieses Mal muss ich es einfach tun. Und ich hoffe, es hilft, euch alle wachzurÃ¼tteln und klarzumachen: Nein, es ist nicht alles okay in unserem Land.

Es passiert immer Ã¶fter, was mir passiert ist.

Vor einigen Tagen stieg ich in Berlin an der SamariterstraÃŸe in die U5 Richtung Alexanderplatz. Die Bahn war ziemlich voll. Ich setzte mich auf einen der Klappsitze, weil ich dachte, das sei fÃ¼r alle FahrgÃ¤ste platztechnisch das Angenehmste.

Auf dem Sitz neben mir saÃŸ eine groÃŸe Frau mit weiÃŸem Haar, blauen Augen und einem Buch in der Hand. Ich schÃ¤tzte sie auf Ende 50, Anfang 60. Uns gegenÃ¼ber saÃŸen zwei blonde Jungs um die 18 Jahre alt, direkt neben uns standen zwei dunkelhÃ¤utige Jungs im selben Alter.

"Das ist mein Land. Ich will nicht, dass so jemand wie du neben mir sitzt"

Kaum hatte ich Platz genommen, drehte sich die Frau zu mir und sagte mit eiskalter Miene: "Es sind noch andere PlÃ¤tze frei". UnglÃ¤ubig, perplex und in dunkler Vorahnung, was gleich folgen kÃ¶nnte, fragte ich, bemÃ¼ht um Freundlichkeit: "Wie bitte?". Sie darauf: "Warum setzt du dich neben mich? Das ist mein Land. Ich will nicht, dass so jemand wie du neben mir sitzt."

So langsam wurden auch andere FahrgÃ¤ste auf unsere Konversation aufmerksam.

Ich erwiderte der Frau: "Nun, wissen Sie, mir scheint, als sei das einzig und allein Ihr Problem, und wie Sie bereits treffend bemerkt haben: Es sind noch andere PlÃ¤tze frei. Es hindert sie also niemand daran, sich umzusetzen." Sie: "Ja du bist ein ganz Schlauer, was? Du armer brauner Wicht." Ich: "Die einzige Person, die mir ein brauner Wicht zu sein scheint, sind Sie."

Die beiden blonden Jungs gegenÃ¼ber lachten lautstark, andere schmunzelten, einige schienen mich fÃ¼r das Problem zu halten.

Einer der beiden dunkelhÃ¤utigen Jungs sagte zu mir: "Lass es, das ist es nicht wert." Ich sagte ihm, dass es das sehr wohl wert sei und dass ich mit niemandem ein Problem habe, aber anscheinend jemand mit mir.

Einige schienen noch immer mich fÃ¼r den StÃ¶rfaktor zu halten

Mittlerweile kam es mir vor, als blitzten die Augen der Frau vor Hass. "Wo kommst du kleiner Wicht Ã¼berhaupt her?", fragte sie mich. Ich antwortete ihr: "Ich bin Deutscher. Nicht, dass Sie das etwas anginge." Sie: "Ja klar. Ach komm, guck dich doch mal an. Und deine Eltern?" Ich: "Die sind ebenfalls Deutsche" Dann gab es fÃ¼r die Frau kein Halten mehr: "Ja klar, auf dem Papier, du...."

An dieser Stelle fing sie an, in einer Sprache auf mich einzureden, die ich nicht ganz verstand. Ich bin jedoch sicher, dass es ein plattdeutscher Dialekt war.

Ich entgegnete ihr daraufhin, dass sie schon Deutsch mit mir reden mÃ¼sse, wenn sie denn wolle, dass ich sie verstehe. Daraufhin fingen ein paar mehr Leute an zu kichern, die Jungs gegenÃ¼ber konnten sich kaum halten und ein, zwei schienen immer noch mich fÃ¼r den StÃ¶rfaktor zu halten.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: "Alle FlÃ¼chtlinge sind doch schwarz!" - was es bedeutet, in Deutschland dunkelhÃ¤utig zu sein

Die Dame wurde immer wÃ¼tender, fing erneut an, mich auf Plattdeutsch zu beschimpfen. Dann sagte sie, dass die Zeiten sich sowieso wieder zugunsten der "wahren Deutschen" Ã¤ndern wÃ¼rden.

Ich wurde immer fassungsloser, was sich da abspielte. Ich wollte mich aber auf keinen Fall von ihr unterkriegen lassen, entschied mich, auf eine Mischung aus AufklÃ¤rung und verbalem Konter zu setzen.

"Das kÃ¶nnen wir ja mal abwarten. Das letzte Mal, als ich nachgesehen habe, waren die Nazis diejenigen, die eine Niederlage einstecken mussten. Und dass wird auch wieder so kommen. Deutsche wie ich werden dafÃ¼r sorgen", setzte ich ihr entgegen.

"Was lesen Sie da eigentlich? Mein Kampf?"

Daraufhin erwiderte sie, dass sich ihresgleichen darum kÃ¼mmern wÃ¼rden, dass das beim nÃ¤chsten Mal anders laufe. Verschwunden seien die Nazis ja sowieso nie. Die hÃ¤tten noch immer wichtige Positionen und Ã„mter inne.

Nun war der Vorhang endgÃ¼ltig gefallen. Ich hatte es also mit einem waschechten Nazi zu tun: "Ach, sieh mal an, war doch nicht so schwierig, kommen Sie, nur keine Scheu, lassen Sie es raus. Geil Massenmord, gell? Geil, Genozid gell?"

Sie: "Ja ja, du wirst schon sehen, die Ã–fen sind noch intakt." Ja, wirklich, das hat sie ernsthaft gesagt.

Ich: "Was lesen Sie da eigentlich? Mein Kampf?"

Die Menschen um uns herum konnten sich kaum halten vor Lachen. Angebracht war das vielleicht nicht, aber immerhin trug es zur Frustration der Frau bei, was mir ehrlich gesagt Genugtuung verschaffte. Sie fing wieder an, mich als kleinen braunen Mann zu bezeichnen.

Ich wollte es noch einmal vermittelnd versuchen. "Wissen Sie, was traurig ist? Wir sitzen eigentlich im selben Boot und ich glaube, Sie hassen mich auch eigentlich gar nicht wirklich. Sie hassen das, was 'die da oben' machen, davon sind Sie und er und er und sie und ich alle gleichermaÃŸen betroffen, sagte ich und zeigte auf andere Menschen in der NÃ¤he. Aber anstatt dass Sie sich gegen die Ursachen Ihrer Probleme wehren, schlagen Sie immer nach unten auf die, die es noch beschissener haben."

Ich zeigte auf die Frau und sagte: "Nazi, nicht Deutsche"

Sie sei nicht sauer auf mich, sondern auf Deutschland, pflichtete mir einer der beiden dunkelhÃ¤utigen Jungs bei.

Inzwischen hatte es der Frau die Sprache verschlagen. Ich stand von meinem Sitz auf, gab den beiden blonden Jungs die Hand, gab den beiden dunkelhÃ¤utigen Jungs die Hand, zeigte nacheinander auf sie alle und sagte: "Deutscher, Deutscher, Deutscher, Deutscher." Dann zeigte ich auf mich und sagte: "Deutscher". Ich zeigte auf die Frau und sagte: "Nazi. Nicht Deutsche".

Ich wollte mich wieder hinsetzen, doch die Frau versuchte, mit ihrem Arm den Sitz zu blockieren. Davon lieÃŸ ich mich nicht abbringen und klappte den Sitz wieder runter.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Ich bin dunkelhÃ¤utig und Deutsche - trotzdem werde ich oft wie eine Fremde behandelt



Den Rest der Fahrt starrte sie mich schweigend an. Beim Ausstieg an der Endstation Alexanderplatz beleidigte sie noch die beiden dunkelhÃ¤utigen Jungs als Affen. Die versuchten, es gelassen zu nehmen.

Einer der beiden sagte: "Ja ich bin ein Affe. SchÃ¤tzen Sie sich doch glÃ¼cklich, normalerweise begegnet man denen nur im Zoo" und fÃ¼gten in meine Richtung hinzu, es sei schade, dass ich kein Politiker sei - ihre Stimme hÃ¤tte ich.

Ich bin froh, dass mir das passiert ist und nicht jemand anderem

Ich bin froh, dass mir das passiert ist und nicht jemand anderem, denn ich weiÃŸ mich zu wehren. Es war auch nicht das erste Mal, dass ich so etwas erlebt habe. Trotz Wut, EnttÃ¤uschung und Fassungslosigkeit hat mich das Erlebnis gestÃ¤rkt.

Doch etwas ganz anderes bereitet mir Sorgen. Jeden Tag sind viel zu viele Leute von solchen fremdenfeindlichen Attacken betroffen. Viele davon reagieren darauf nicht so selbstbewusst wie ich. Vielen von ihnen hilft keiner. Sie werden zurÃ¼ckgelassen mit einem GefÃ¼hl von Ohnmacht, Isolation, Angst.

Ich habe eine Bitte: Lasst uns gemeinsam dafÃ¼r einstehen, dass unser gesellschaftliches Klima nicht immer weiter verroht. Lasst uns wachsam sein, andere unterstÃ¼tzen.

Und wenn ihr solche Angriffe seht, mÃ¶gen sie verbaler oder kÃ¶rperlicher Art sein, helft den Betroffenen, sich zu wehren. Und zeigt ihnen, dass Deutschland besser ist.

Der Text wurde aufgezeichnet von Uschi Jonas.



Oft schauen wir auf gesellschaftliche Entwicklungen nur aus einer abstrakten Perspektive: Experten sprechen Ã¼ber Probleme anhand von Studien. Politiker loben, was gut lÃ¤uft, anhand von grauen Statistiken - all das hat mit dem Alltag der Menschen, die von diesen Entwicklungen betroffen sind oder sie prÃ¤gen, oft wenig zu tun. Diese Menschen kommen jetzt in der HuffPost zu Wort. Denn wie fÃ¼hlt sich Armut in einem reichen Land jenseits der Statistiken an? Wie sieht Deutschland aus der Perspektive eines Obdachlosen aus? Vor welchen Problemen steht ein gerade angekommener FlÃ¼chtling? Wer hat mit seiner Initiative ein gravierendes Problem gelÃ¶st? All das ist Thema in HuffPost-Voices. Diskutiert mit und schickt uns eure Erlebnisse an Blog@huffingtonpost.de.

(jds)
TITLE: An die Frau in der U-Bahn, die nicht wollte, dass ich mich neben sie setze

SUMMARY:
Spoken word artist, creative producer and Roundhouse Resident ArtistLetters Do Not Bring Good News.
Just Bad News, In Good English John Akinde performs his poem Letters in an exclusive vlog for HuffPost UK.
Writer and comedy performerMy Jihad Is About Judging Less And Loving More Spoken word artist Amani Z Saeed performs her poem Radical Love exclusively for HuffPost UK.
Spoken word artist and part of the Roundhouse Poetry CollectiveVoting Is Protesting...
In this vlog for HuffPost UK, in which he performs his poem Why I've Never Voted, he talks about how voting is protest.
TEXT:
Return To Sender - The Letter To The 3 Million EU Nationals Theresa May reiterates that EU nationals will be able to stay. This is not news. This has been said for the last 10 months. For many EU nationals like me who have lived in this country for decades, a promise not to be deported is an affront rather than reassurance. The letter does not contain any more substance than that. The3Million campaign spokesperson

One Day Without Us 2018 We want to restore the courage, heroism and dignity, the adventure and discovery that is part of the experience of migration. As migrants and non-migrants, we want to celebrate and acknowledge the contributions that migrants have made to our country in the past and continue to make today. Author, freelance journalist and blogger

A Year On And Theresa May Has Delivered Nothing But A Weak And Wobbly Government One year of Theresa May is as good a proof as any that Britain is held back by the Tories. The failed politics of austerity have led to a crisis in living standards, millions of children living in poverty, and our health services brought to its knees. Theresa May has failed to deliver on her message of equality and fairness, and has let down working families across the country through her chaotic government. Labour MP for Denton and Reddish

The Prime Minister's Decision To Leave Euratom Shows She Is Willing To Put Ideology Above Jobs And Nuclear Safety Frankly the national interest, access to cancer treatments, and the strength of British industries are far more important than the Prime Minister's pet concerns. That is why Labour has called a debate today in Parliament on our membership of Euratom and why we will continue to put pressure on the Prime Minister to drop her opposition to Euratom and to put jobs and nuclear safety first. Shadow Secretary of State for Exiting the EU, Labour MP for Holborn and St Pancras

I'm Talking But No One Is Listening In the poem Punchline, performed exclusively for HuffPost UK here, spoken-word artist KReimer talks about cuts to mental health services and how hard it is to get help. Spoken word artist, creative producer and Roundhouse Resident Artist

Letters Do Not Bring Good News. Just Bad News, In Good English John Akinde performs his poem Letters in an exclusive vlog for HuffPost UK. In it he touches on how a letter took away the place he called home in the name of gentrification, how letters tell him what money he owes, where to be, and that he needs to vote. However, he doesn't ever get a letter telling him who represents him. Artist and part of the Roundhouse Poetry Collective

Call Me Woman And Feel The Majesty Of It Roll Off Your Tongue Women are stronger when they march together, says writer Michelle Fisher in her poem Terms of Endearment. In a vlog for HuffPost UK she speaks about her disappointment in our female prime minister and her government's decisions, the election of Donald Trump and how when we march as one, we are strong. Writer and part of the Roundhouse Poetry Collective.

Money Can't Buy You Happiness Say The Ringmasters Writer and comedy performer Madi Maxwell-Libby performs her poem Kids, Coins, Cuts in a vlog for HuffPost UK. In it, she speaks about the severe inequality in our society today, benefit cuts and the children left behind. Writer and comedy performer

My Jihad Is About Judging Less And Loving More Spoken word artist Amani Z Saeed performs her poem Radical Love exclusively for HuffPost UK. In the vlog she speaks of her frustration with terrorism and the Islamophobia that follows. Spoken word artist and part of the Roundhouse Poetry Collective

Voting Is Protesting... In Their Language Benna has never voted before. In this vlog for HuffPost UK, in which he performs his poem Why I've Never Voted, he talks about how voting is protest. He says 'the things that happen when I don't vote are the same things that happen when my peers do,' and how it is down to young people to ensure that the 'views from down here' reach the 'silver spoon meeting rooms'. Spoken word artist, social entrepreneur and Roundhouse Resident Artist

I Am Voting, I Just Wish I Knew More Doug Deans, in the poem Bloody Right, describes a conversation between a father and daughter. In this vlog, Doug performs the poem and touches on the frustration one young woman is facing - she doesn't know who to vote for or whether she knows enough. Writer, performer and part of the Roundhouse Poetry Collective

Strong And Stable Kids Need Feeding! In the four years since it launched, The Universal Infant Free School Meals (UIFSM) policy has had a huge impact. Over 85% of children in theirâ€‹ first three years of primary school now eat a healthy school lunch, compared to less than 45% in 2013. That's something to be really proud of, so whyâ€‹ pull it so abruptly!? MBE, world-renowned chef and food campaigner

Putting Ourselves First In This Election This election isn't about the things it's supposed to be about. It's not about leaders, parties, candidates, rallies. It's not about wall to wall news coverage, interviews, speeches and gaffes. It's not about them. It's about us. Writer and musician, writing on politics, music and religion. www.twitter.com/joseph_finlay

The Labour Manifesto Is A New Deal For Public Health The Labour Party has proudly affirmed that the state should act in the interest of the many rather than the few. No doubt you will hear repeated scare-quotes, such as, "Labour plans amount to the biggest state intervention in the economy for decades", that redistribution is "dangerously left-wing" or "unworkable" and that nobody wants to see the return of the "the nanny, interventionist state". Doctor and campaigner working in the NHS, member of the BMA's Junior Doctors committee. Writing in personal capacity.

The Music Industry Is Uniting To Get Young People To Vote United, our brands are penetrating the echo-chamber and introducing the next generation to the policies affecting their future. Electoral registration creates a mental foothold, a subconscious investment which will lead to candidate selection and ultimately voting on June 8th. Music Editor, Headfirst Bristol
TITLE: Beyond Brexit

SUMMARY:
In a letter to the Department of Personnel and Training, the CBI conveyed that it wanted to file the SLP challenging the Delhi High Court order of 31 May 2005 quashing all charges against Europe-based Hinduja brothers in the Bofors case.
Government officials said the CBI was in favour of filing the SLP in 2005 but the then UPA government did not give its nod.
Legal experts feel that the agency will have to do a lot of explanation for condoning the lapsed time period of over 12 years.
On Wednesday, the CBI had said it would look into the "facts and circumstances" of the Bofors scam mentioned by private detective Michael Hershmam, who alleged that the then Rajiv Gandhi-led Congress government had sabotaged his investigation.
Hershman, who was here last week to address a conference of private detectives, also alleged that the bribe money of the Bofors gun scandal had been parked in the Swiss account.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

New Delhi, Oct 20 (PTI) â€” The CBI has written to the government for reconsideration of its 2005 decision and allow the agency to file a Special Leave Petition (SLP) in the Supreme Court in the Bofors case challenging the quashing of an FIR in the alleged scam, officials said.

In a letter to the Department of Personnel and Training, the CBI conveyed that it wanted to file the SLP challenging the Delhi High Court order of 31 May 2005 quashing all charges against Europe-based Hinduja brothers in the Bofors case.

Government officials said the CBI was in favour of filing the SLP in 2005 but the then UPA government did not give its nod.

Legal experts feel that the agency will have to do a lot of explanation for condoning the lapsed time period of over 12 years.

The then Delhi High Court judge RS Sodhi had on 31 May 2005, quashed all charges against the Hinduja brothers â€” Srichand, Gopichand and Prakashchand â€” and the Bofors company and castigated the CBI for its handling of the case saying it had cost the exchequer about Rs 250 crore.

Before the 2005 verdict, another judge of the Delhi High Court, Justice JD Kapoor (since retired), on 4 February 2004, had exonerated the late prime minister, Rajiv Gandhi, in the case and directed framing of charge of forgery under Section 465 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) against the Bofors company.

On Wednesday, the CBI had said it would look into the "facts and circumstances" of the Bofors scam mentioned by private detective Michael Hershmam, who alleged that the then Rajiv Gandhi-led Congress government had sabotaged his investigation.

Hershman, who is the president of the US-based private detective firm Fairfax, claimed in television interviews recently that Rajiv Gandhi was "furious" when he had found a Swiss bank account "Mont Blanc".

Hershman, who was here last week to address a conference of private detectives, also alleged that the bribe money of the Bofors gun scandal had been parked in the Swiss account.

Also on HuffPost
TITLE: After 12 Years, CBI Seeks The Govt's Permission To Reopen The Bofors Probe

SUMMARY:
Michael Pezzullo, Secretary of the Department of Immigration and Border Protection, during a Senate estimates hearing at Parliament House.
CANBERRA -- A fiery exchange in Parliament over Australian's heavily criticised offshore detention program has lead to the head of Immigration Department Mike Pezzullo joking about torture.
Pezzullo was being quizzed by Greens senator Nick McKim in a senate estimates hearing on Monday over the imminent closure of the Manus Island regional processing centre.
The government confirms that basic services at its Manus Island prison will be cut off, despite 600 men refusing to leave.
Pezzullo claims there the refugees refusing to leave the Manus centre are being "animated" by a "vigorous campaign" by activists that they might come to Australia.
TEXT:
Michael Pezzullo, Secretary of the Department of Immigration and Border Protection, during a Senate estimates hearing at Parliament House.

CANBERRA -- A fiery exchange in Parliament over Australian's heavily criticised offshore detention program has lead to the head of Immigration Department Mike Pezzullo joking about torture.

Pezzullo was being quizzed by Greens senator Nick McKim in a senate estimates hearing on Monday over the imminent closure of the Manus Island regional processing centre.

The hearing heard there are still 606 men at the centre, which will have its power and water shut down in eight days before it will taken over by the Papua New Guinea military.

" I don't think torture is a laughing matter"- @NickMcKim and Mike Pezzullo clash over the closure of Manus Island RPC pic.twitter.com/oUAYGwANsj October 23, 2017

The Greens senator is concerned the shutdown may end in violence and injury.

Pezzullo rejected this, but McKim decided to goad Pezzullo him by raising the word "torture", a reminder that the UN has accused Australia of systematically violating the international Convention Against Torture by detaining asylum seekers on Manus Island.

"Spare us the fake sympathy. You have been torturing them for four and half years," the senator declared.

This set off the Department head who was giving evidence to the Greens senator with his arms firmly crossed.

"I reject any assertion that this department has been torturing anyone. The only torture I am aware of is sometimes when we have to appear here," Pezzullo said.

At least one person was heard laughing to that proposition and Pezzullo and minister Michaelia Cash smiled.

McKim took immediate umbrage.

"I don't think torture is a laughing matter, Mr Pezzullo," he fired back.

The government confirms that basic services at its Manus Island prison will be cut off, despite 600 men refusing to leave. pic.twitter.com/cGbAJs6rMr â€” Nick McKim (@NickMcKim) October 23, 2017

Pezzullo attempted to explain.

"I don't know how to get through to you on occasions Senator, whether it is by deft responses or just by frankly sometimes highlighting just how silly these conversations can get," he said.

More torture gags: Kim Carr says it's a "torturous process" extracting answers, Pezzullo jokes "we can't make reference to that" #estimates â€” Michael Koziol (@michaelkoziol) October 23, 2017

Australia is working with the Papua New Guinean Government to close the Manus centre by October 31.

The Turnbull Government says alternative local accommodation and support services have been organised ahead of the centre's closure.

Pezzullo claims there the refugees refusing to leave the Manus centre are being "animated" by a "vigorous campaign" by activists that they might come to Australia.

If the men are still in the centre after October 31 he said they could be in violation of PNG's trespass laws.
TITLE: The Head Of The Immigration Department, Michael Pezzullo, Jokes About Torture In Senate Estimates

SUMMARY:
@ThirdLove just told Iâ€™ve been putting on my bras wrong for twenty years.
ThirdLoveâ€™s three tips instruct users to clasp the bra in the back, hook the bra on the loosest hook (THE HORROR) and tighten the straps every other month.
â€œIâ€™ve been putting on my bras wrong for twenty years,â€ Packnett wrote.
â€œMost women I talk to are wearing a band thatâ€™s too large for them,â€ Cohen told HuffPost.
â€œWhen you put it on the loosest hook, it should feel snug on your body.
TEXT:
.@ThirdLove just told Iâ€™ve been putting on my bras wrong for twenty years.



You probably have, too. pic.twitter.com/eHRWVp11OA â€” Brittany Packnett (@MsPackyetti) October 12, 2017

â€œMY WHOLE POST-PUBESCENT LIFE HAS BEEN A LIE,â€ she tweeted into the hearts of the thousands who responded to her tweet, likely because they were experiencing the same shock she did upon seeing the instructions.

ThirdLoveâ€™s three tips instruct users to clasp the bra in the back, hook the bra on the loosest hook (THE HORROR) and tighten the straps every other month.

â€œIâ€™ve been putting on my bras wrong for twenty years,â€ Packnett wrote.

MY WHOLE POST-PUBESCENT LIFE HAS BEEN A LIE. pic.twitter.com/mhWuZMiOKv â€” Brittany Packnett (@MsPackyetti) October 12, 2017

Packnettâ€™s photo sparked a strong reaction on social media, from people who were experiencing this earth-shattering realization at the same time or people who also experienced some type of bra-related epiphany after many years of wearing one.

Donâ€™t feel bad. I just learned this same information last year. Thereâ€™s a whole generation of wrong bra-ing. â€” Laura Lee ğŸ¦„â˜€ï¸ğŸŒˆ (@derkie313) October 12, 2017

wait, there are women who can actually hook it in the back with it right side up? What chicanery is this? pic.twitter.com/TKHkHPzPdj â€” JenMuse Knits (@unfettered_muse) October 12, 2017

I have been doing this all wrong pic.twitter.com/WoLhWYDWnb â€” Turing Pest (@Krikalitika) October 13, 2017

I thought it was supposed to be on middle hook for ideal fit. Guess Iâ€™m a messed-up bra wearer too! â€” Jennifer (@simplyjennifer) October 12, 2017

RT to save a mf LIFE... https://t.co/RI428zeVKH â€” Bi B.I.E. Heaux (@BrittanyActs) October 12, 2017

So, is it true? Have we all been doing it all wrong? According to Raâ€™el Cohen, ThirdLoveâ€™s head of design, we have.

And thereâ€™s a good reason to reconsider your strategy.

â€œMost women I talk to are wearing a band thatâ€™s too large for them,â€ Cohen told HuffPost. â€œBasically, if you wear a brand new bra on any other hook than the loosest, youâ€™re probably in too big a band size.â€

Uh, what? Our minds are blown. But Cohenâ€™s explanation makes a ton of sense.

â€œWhen you put on a brand new bra, the fabric is brand new, it has all of its elasticity,â€ she said. â€œWhen you put it on the loosest hook, it should feel snug on your body. Because after you wear it for about a week, youâ€™ll start to feel itâ€™s a bit more stretchy. If you wear it on the loosest in the beginning, that allows you two more adjustments as the bra stretches out. You are basically getting more life out of your bra.â€

Weâ€™re on board with making our bras last longer, but why does it matter that we fasten the clasp in the back, rather than pulling off the front-clasp-and-spin move?

Luckily, Cohen said that doesnâ€™t matter quite as much.

â€œYou can definitely do both ways,â€ she said. â€œPeople have their preference. Itâ€™s more ideal to clip in the back because when you clip in the front and shimmy into it, itâ€™s hard to get it exactly lined up in the center, and your wire could be slightly off to one side. So if youâ€™re going to clasp in the front, just make sure the bra is completely centered on your body.â€
TITLE: A Whole Lot Of Women Just Found Out They're Wearing Bras Wrong

Die sieben grÃ¶ÃŸten LÃ¼gen der Schleuser â€“ und die Antworten des AuÃŸenministeriums

Der Skandal um Filmmogul Harvey Weinstein (65) hat hohe Wellen geschlagen und nun kommen neue FÃ¤lle ans Licht.

TEXT:
Wie viele schmutzige Details werden in Hollywood noch enthÃ¼llt? Der Skandal um Filmmogul Harvey Weinstein (65) hat hohe Wellen geschlagen und nun kommen neue FÃ¤lle ans Licht. Ãœber 30 Frauen beschuldigen den US-Regisseur James Toback (72, "Bugsy") der sexuellen BelÃ¤stigung, wie die "Los Angeles Times" berichtet.

Alte Filme und Serien finden Sie auch bei Watchbox, gleich hier anmelden

Dem Bericht zufolge soll Toback die Frauen in den StraÃŸen von New York angesprochen und versprochen haben, einen Star aus ihnen zu machen. Demnach habe er die Frauen in Hotelzimmern oder Parks getroffen und vorgegeben, dass es sich um ein geschÃ¤ftliches Treffen handle. Bei den GesprÃ¤chen habe er mit sexuellen Eroberungen geprahlt und private Details erfragt, wie die bisher 38 Frauen der "Los Angeles Times" mitgeteilt haben. So wollte er etwa wissen, wie oft die Frauen masturbieren wÃ¼rden und wie viele Schamhaare sie hÃ¤tten. Unter den Betroffenen befinden sich unter anderem Musikerin Louise Post (50), die SÃ¤ngerin der Band Veruca Salt, sowie die Schauspielerinnen Adrienne LaValley und Terri Conn.

James Toback weist die VorwÃ¼rfe zurÃ¼ck. Er habe sich mit keiner dieser Frauen getroffen, antwortete er auf Nachfrage der "Los Angeles Times", und wenn es doch so gewesen sein sollte, habe es sich um lediglich fÃ¼nf Minuten gehandelt und er habe daran keinerlei Erinnerung. Zudem gab er an, dass es fÃ¼r ihn "biologisch unmÃ¶glich" sei, so ein Verhalten an den Tag zu legen. Er leide an Diabetes sowie einer Herzerkrankung und benÃ¶tige Medikamente. Weiter sei er darauf allerdings nicht eingegangen.

Seit den 1980er Jahren ist Toback mit seiner Frau Stephanie verheiratet. Sie haben einen gemeinsamen Sohn, Andre. Sein bekanntester Film ist "Bugsy" (1991) mit Warren Beatty, Harvey Keitel, Ben Kingsley und Annette Bening in den Hauptrollen. Er schrieb fÃ¼r den Streifen das Drehbuch und wurde dafÃ¼r im Jahr 1992 fÃ¼r einen Oscar nominiert.
TITLE: VorwÃ¼rfe gegen James Toback: Der nÃ¤chste Skandal in Hollywood

SUMMARY:
Prisons and probation minister and Conservative MP for East SurreyThe Landscape Of Hate Crime Is Changing But Hate Is Hate No Matter How It Is Communicated This week is National Hate Crime Awareness Week.
Conservative MP for Sutton, Cheam and Worcester ParkWanted: The UK's Answer To Macron Watching President Macron's first televised interview this Sunday, two things struck me.
Conservative MP for Eastleigh, member of the Women and Equalities Select CommitteeTory Coup Speculation Is Rife: Will Replacing The Prime Minister Solve The Conservative Party's Problems?
The Conservative Party is a survivalist party with ruthless ambitions.
World Mental Health Day: Helping People Affected By Mental Ill-Health Into Work Mental health is complex and can impact on any - or every - aspect of the lives of those affected.
TEXT:
Friendly Noises From This European Council Summit Shouldn't Disguise Lack Of Brexit Progress Compared to dealing with her own Cabinet, where constant sniping, back-stabbing and regular attempts to depose her as Prime Minister have become the norm, it must have been nice to spend some time abroad with foreign leaders who don't treat her with barely-disguised contempt. On the contrary, many of the noises from European leaders at this Council summit have been rather friendly. Policy and Press Officer at Open Britain

The Unsung Heroes: How Passionate, Driven Individuals In Communities Are Transforming Mental Healthcare We intend to award grants to the most innovative and impactful local collaborations between the NHS, wider public and voluntary sector to support the development of these services. At the same time we will continue to invest in other core NHS mental health services as part of our ambition to treat one million more people by 2020/21. There may be no magic bullet to stem the rising tide of mental ill health - but these initiatives show there is a huge amount that can be done to make a real difference. Secretary of State for Health

We Should Come Down Like A Hammer On Those Who Attack Emergency Workers This is not a party-political issue, it's a topic that affects us all. That's why I am so pleased we are working together across party lines to protect these remarkable individuals. We need to make this kind of behaviour a taboo in our society and tougher sentences for those who carry out these despicable attacks sends the clearest possible message that they will not be tolerated. Prisons and probation minister and Conservative MP for East Surrey

The Landscape Of Hate Crime Is Changing But Hate Is Hate No Matter How It Is Communicated This week is National Hate Crime Awareness Week. At this time every year organisations, charities and individuals get together to raise awareness of all types of hate crime and focus on the issues that blight many in our society today. Conservative MP for South Swindon & HM Solicitor General

On Anti-Slavery Day, We Say To Perpetrators: We Are Coming After You, And There Is Nowhere To Hide Modern slavery is a barbaric crime which destroys the lives of some of the most vulnerable in our society. Most of us are aware of the prevalence of this horrific crime abroad - a fact I imagine sadly wouldn't surprise many Londoners reading this. Conservative MP for Sutton, Cheam and Worcester Park

Wanted: The UK's Answer To Macron Watching President Macron's first televised interview this Sunday, two things struck me. Firstly, wow. This man is eloquent, considered, sensitive, confident, and inspires confidence in his ability as a leader and in France. Deputy Chairman of the Parliament Street Technology Forum

Dialogue Over Division Is The Key To Future Conservative Party Success The Conservatives need to re-establish a unified narrative that explains the benefits of a responsible capitalism. One that aligns with the fairness agenda of younger voters, as well as the more risk-averse agenda of older voters. Group CEO of Verbalisation and Global Influence, and author of, Verbalisation: the power of words to drive change.

The International Day Of The Girl Is A Day For Poignant Reflection On this day, the sixth Annual Day of the Girl, I am grateful to think of the progress this Government has made and eager to see how we can shape the future opportunities for women and girls which are growing and must be taken advantage of - but I must also stress how much further there is to go. Conservative MP for Eastleigh, member of the Women and Equalities Select Committee

Tory Coup Speculation Is Rife: Will Replacing The Prime Minister Solve The Conservative Party's Problems? The Tory party is tearing itself apart through infighting, and the disunity grows by the day. You only have to look at history to discover what happens when a party is disunited - the public will not vote for you. The Conservative Party is a survivalist party with ruthless ambitions. It would not have secured its reputation as the most successful political party in Britain were it not. Former media adviser to Liverpool City Region Metro Mayor Steve Rotheram

Social Media: Politicians' One-Stop Shop For A Cult Of Personality When a cult of personality for a previously "unheard of" backbencher can create public demand and expectation for that person to be front and centre within the party - far more quickly and easily than the social climbing previously demanded to get to the upper echelons of power - it will be interesting to see how this tactic diversifies. Deputy Chairman of the Parliament Street Technology Forum

Reclaiming The T-word What do politics, sports and rock music have in common? It could be a number of things. During the summer of 2017 in the UK it was Tourette Syndrome (... Chartered Psychologist and research manager at Tourettes Action. Raising public awareness and how research improves peopleâ€™s lives.

World Mental Health Day: Helping People Affected By Mental Ill-Health Into Work Mental health is complex and can impact on any - or every - aspect of the lives of those affected. Environment, housing, relationships and, crucially, work can often be intrinsically linked to the problems associated with mental health issues. But that also means they can be a vital part of the solution... Secretary of State for Work and Pensions and Conservative MP for Hertfordshire South West

Only Labour Can Deliver The Transport Investment Britain Needs The Conservatives are refusing to say precisely where the Â£400 million of transport investment will be spent. Why make an announcement without a plan? The reason is that this is a government without a plan, and merely shows how out of the touch the Tories are with the needs and ambitions of the North. Shadow transport secretary and Labour MP for Middlesborough

Oh, Theresa May... If she hangs on, it'll be for one reason and one reason alone. Her party can't think of anyone who they'd prefer. I suspect Jeremy Corbyn is smiling contentedly as he does some gentle digging in his allotment. Journalist and broadcaster

7,000 Words And Not A Single Mention Of Wales After this conference season, it's becoming increasingly clear that Theresa May is content with providing "second best" solutions to the issues which face communities across Wales and the UK as a whole. Member of Parliament for Ogmore
TITLE: Conservatives: Latest news and updates from the Tories, blogs and videos

TEXT:
Ein Berliner fand in seinem Keller eine unangenehme Ãœberraschung

Jemand hatte den Keller als Toilette missbraucht

Seine Reaktion zu dem Vorfall seht ihr im Video oben

Die Liste von Dingen, die man in seinem Keller hat, aber nicht braucht, ist definitiv lang. Was ein Berliner nun allerdings in seinem Untergeschoss gefunden hat, brachte ihn ganz schÃ¶n aus der Fassung: Ein Haufen Exkremente, die offensichtlich ein Mensch hinterlassen hat.

Der Besitzer des Kellers schrieb sogleich einen wutentbrannten offenen Brief, den er im Haus aushÃ¤ngte. Der Zettel hat inzwischen seinen Weg zu â€œNotes of Berlinâ€ auf Instagram gefunden.

"Kack doch in den Hof!"

Der wÃ¼tende Berliner schreibt: â€œAn die Person, die in den Keller gekackt hat: Das nÃ¤chste Mal, wenn du es nicht auf die Toilette schaffst, sch**ÃŸ halt in den Hof! Ich hab dir eine HundekacktÃ¼te angeklebt, damit du den Haufen entfernen kannst. Danke!!â€

Na, hoffentlich erbarmt sich der Unhold und bereinigt den Tatort zeitnah.

Kein Einzelfall

Der Post sorgt auf â€œNotes of Berlinâ€ fÃ¼r viel EmpÃ¶rung, doch es scheint sich dabei nicht um einen Einzelfall zu handeln. Ein Nutzer berichtet davon, eine Ã¤hnliche Erfahrung im Fahrstuhl gemacht zu haben.

Er sei dem Mann sogar begegnet, der sich im Fahrstuhl erleichtert hatte. Dieser schien allerdings keinerlei Reue zu zeigen und meinte mit offener Hose nur, dass es gerade â€œganz schlechtâ€ wÃ¤re, den Fahrstuhl zu benutzen.



Wer auch ein Notiz entdeckt hat, kann diese gerne einsenden an: notes@notesofberlin.com





(lm)
TITLE: Berliner schreibt dem Mann, der seinen Keller als Toilette benutzt - und unterhÃ¤lt damit die ganze Stadt

TEXT:
Marianne Barnard, una artista de California, ha acusado Roman Polanski de abusar sexualmente de ella dos aÃ±os antes de que el aclamado director de cine abandonara Estados Unidos tras ser declarado culpable de violaciÃ³n. En el momento del incidente, que segÃºn Barnard tuvo lugar en 1975, ella tenÃ­a 10 aÃ±os. Inspirada por las denuncias de muchas mujeres contra el poderoso magnate cinematogrÃ¡fico Harvey Weinstein, la mujer ha contado el caso ahora al diario britÃ¡nico The Sun.

Su matrimonio con la actriz Sharon Tate, que fue asesinado por Charles Manson en 1969, tambiÃ©n le habÃ­an convertido en un nombre habitual de la prensa. Por su parte, Barnard habÃ­a hecho algunos trabajos como modelo y al principio no vio nada raro en el encuentro. SegÃºn cuenta, Polanski la fotografiÃ³ con un bikini y un abrigo de piel.

"Entonces dijo: 'QuÃ­tate la parte de arriba del bikini', con la que me sentÃ­a cÃ³moda, y eso que sÃ³lo tenÃ­a 10 aÃ±os y a menudo no llevaba parte de arriba", cuenta Barnard. "Pero entonces quiso que me quitara la parte de abajo. EmpecÃ© a sentirme muy incÃ³moda. Entonces, en algÃºn momento, me di cuenta de que mi madre se habÃ­a ido. No sÃ© adÃ³nde fue y la verdad es que no me di cuenta de que se marchaba, pero ya no estaba allÃ­. Entonces abusÃ³ de mÃ­".

Barnard explicÃ³ sus acusaciones en un tuit el 13 de octubre:

#RomanPolanski took photos of me naked & in fur coat on beach in Malibu, I was 10 yrs old. He went on from there. This ends now #ROSEARMYhttps://t.co/CXoABPSn6H 13 de octubre de 2017

Barnard ha contado a The Sun que todavÃ­a sufre un trastorno de estrÃ©s postraumÃ¡tico, asÃ­ como claustrofobia, a causa de la conducta de la que acusa a Polanski. Recientemente ha iniciado una peticiÃ³n en la que exige a la Academia de las Artes y las Ciencias CinematogrÃ¡ficas de Hollywood que expulsen a Polanski de la organizaciÃ³n basÃ¡ndose en su conducta inapropiada, tal y como ha hecho la Academia con Weinstein.

En 2002 â€”25 aÃ±os despuÃ©s de que Polanski admitiera haber violado a Samantha Geimer, de 13 aÃ±os, por la sentencia de cuyo juicio decidiÃ³ abandonar Estados Unidosâ€”, la Academia le otorgÃ³ el Oscar al Mejor director por el drama El Pianista, ambientado en el Holocausto y protagonizado por Adrien Brody, que tambiÃ©n se llevÃ³ otro Oscar.

Desde las acusaciones de Geimer en 1977, otras tres mujeres han acusado a Polanski, que nunca ha vuelto a Estados Unidos, de abusar de ellas sexualmente cuando eran adolescentes. Barnard ha presentado un informe ante la unidad de delitos sexuales del Departamento de PolicÃ­a de Los Ãngeles y su divisiÃ³n de robo y homicidios, segÃºn The Sun.

Polanski, de 84 aÃ±os, todavÃ­a no se ha pronunciado sobre estas Ãºltimas acusaciones. Su prÃ³xima pelÃ­cula, titulada Basada en hechos reales, se estrenÃ³ en el pasado Festival de Cannes.

Este artÃ­culo fue publicado originalmente en la ediciÃ³n estadounidense del 'HuffPost' y ha sido traducido del inglÃ©s.

SUMMARY:
â€œI am deeply ashamed of the comments I made online, which have emerged today.
â€œI was wrong to make them; I understand why they are offensive and sincerely apologise for my use of such unacceptable language.
â€œI made the comments as a young man, at a particularly difï¬cult time in my life, but that is no excuse.
â€œSince making those comments 15 years ago, I have learned about inequalities of power and how violent language perpetuates them.
â€œI will continue to engage with, and crucially learn from, feminist and other equalities groups so as an MP I can do whatever I can to tackle misogyny.â€
TEXT:
â€œI am deeply ashamed of the comments I made online, which have emerged today.

â€œI was wrong to make them; I understand why they are offensive and sincerely apologise for my use of such unacceptable language.

â€œI made the comments as a young man, at a particularly difï¬cult time in my life, but that is no excuse. Misogyny is a deep problem in our society.

â€œSince making those comments 15 years ago, I have learned about inequalities of power and how violent language perpetuates them.

â€œI continue to strive to be a better man and work where I can to confront misogyny, which is why Iâ€™m so proud to sit on the Women and Equalities Select Committee.

â€œI will continue to engage with, and crucially learn from, feminist and other equalities groups so as an MP I can do whatever I can to tackle misogyny.â€
TITLE: Jared O'Mara: Labour MP Quits Equalities Committee After 'Unacceptable' Derogatory Comments

Or, Ã  proximitÃ© immÃ©diate du site C, se trouve en Alberta un ensemble de 10 000 MW de centrales thermiques polluantes et dispendieuses qu'il faudrait remplacer.

Ã€ Terre-Neuve, en 2011, le gouvernement Williams s'est lancÃ© tÃªte baissÃ©e dans la construction du projet de Muskrat Falls, le plus petit des deux projets Ã©tudiÃ©s, mais aussi le moins rentable. L'estimation de huit milliards de dollars est maintenant rÃ©visÃ©e Ã  plus de treize milliards, une dette Ã©norme pour une petite population de 530 000 personnes, de l'ordre de 30 000 dollars par citoyens ou de quelque 70 000 dollars par payeur de taxes. Quel sera bientÃ´t le prix de l'Ã©nergie pour les mÃ©nages ? De plus, Ã  qui les entreprises devront-elles refiler leurs coÃ»ts additionnels d'Ã©nergie ? Que fera le gouvernement fÃ©dÃ©ral qui s'est permis de garantir pour neuf milliards de la dette ? Cette situation fait la une des journaux locaux presque Ã  plein temps. Or, mÃªme ce projet, intÃ©grÃ© Ã  un rÃ©seau pancanadien, pourrait encore Ãªtre supportable financiÃ¨rement.

En conclusion, il est trÃ¨s intÃ©ressant de voir le Gouvernement du Canada s'intÃ©resser enfin aux Ã©changes d'Ã©nergies entre certaines provinces et d'offrir une participation financiÃ¨re par l'entremise du programme des infrastructures. La situation serait plus prometteuse encore si ce gouvernement voyait assez grand pour comprendre enfin l'intÃ©rÃªt d'un projet dument articulÃ© qui couvrirait cette fois l'ensemble du Canada.
TITLE: Vers un rÃ©seau canadien de transport haute-tension?

SUMMARY:
These are the things we do, and I did, when the epic storm of partnership confusion hits our lives.
My 10-day argument really gave me an opportunity to connect with the world, and everyone in my phone book.
Whether still fighting, or separated, you suddenly realise there is a big wide world out there, and it's time to research it.
What's the harm in looking up real estate roles in the Philippines or applying for beautician school in Kuwait anyway?
Fighting with a partner is a refreshing way to gain a whole new perspective on the world around you.
TEXT:
"All rationality goes out of the window."

My boyfriend and I had a fight recently. A 10-day-long fight. It wasn't about one particular subject (yes, I still think he chews like a cow), it was about four and a half years' worth of issues that we've both been cultivating as an internal and growing resentment balls.

I thought I was being very mature about the whole situation. I thought I was completely in control and was liberated by the thought of independence, adventure and maybe even becoming a cross-country skier one day.

I felt like this until day eight, when my girlfriends commented on my painted nails. It was at this moment that I realised I was that chick. I was following the predictable path that most females do when they fight or separate from their partner.

These are the things we do, and I did, when the epic storm of partnership confusion hits our lives.

Your language changes.

When a relationship is in turmoil, text conversations will be fleeting and 'fine' will become your favourite word.

"Yeah, fine thanks. How are you?"

"Weekend was fun. And you?"

"Is that okay with you?"

"Okay, that's fine."

You will remove all memories.

Whether it's deleting him off Facebook, and hoping that he notices (he won't) or deleting his phone number from your phone (that you know already) there is a cathartic sense of pride in deleting daily reminders from your life.

All rationality goes out of the window.

Picture this, you are putting on a load of washing and you spy his jumper among your clothes. Are you going to be mature and pop it in the machine too?

Hell, no you're not, he can wash his own damn clothes.

Your routine changes.

In happy, routine life, you would split the shopping, cooking and cleaning. In your new life of hatred, you will go above and beyond to cut them out of your routine.

Yes, I ate the same chicken salad for 10 days and didn't have coffee beans because it meant that he might use some of the beans (lord knows he didn't deserve free coffee), but I was totally running my own show.

Your network changes.

My 10-day argument really gave me an opportunity to connect with the world, and everyone in my phone book. Yes, Sarah who I met once at a party when I was 18 was interested to hear from me and, yes, he would have noticed how much fun I was having by my Facebook tags, if only I didn't delete him off it.

Music changes.

At first the music will be sad, and you will cry. And then it will be rock music, and eventually dance and trance music. It's time to party, guys!

You will get hot.

The chicken-salad diet may not have helped my figure. But the fake tan, new hairdo, perfectly manicured nails, microdermabrasion, an entirely new wardrobe and multiple hair removal appointments certainly upped my 'look hot' factor.

You will research your new life.

Whether still fighting, or separated, you suddenly realise there is a big wide world out there, and it's time to research it. What's the harm in looking up real estate roles in the Philippines or applying for beautician school in Kuwait anyway?

Fighting with a partner is a refreshing way to gain a whole new perspective on the world around you. I may have let him back in to the house (for now), but at least I can safely say that I have learned that it is important to shave my legs more often.

A change, no matter how short term, is just as good as a holiday.
TITLE: The Things I Do To Let My Boyfriend Know We're Fighting

SUMMARY:
In a Facebook post, Addams accused her ex-boyfriend Jeordie White â€” who is better known as Twiggy Ramirez, the bassist for Marilyn Manson â€” of rape and physical assault during their relationship in the early 1990s.
Stefanie Keenan via Getty Images Jessicka Addams in Los Angeles in 2015.
He just couldnâ€™t bear to face himself in that mirror.â€GABRIEL BOUYS via Getty Images Marilyn Manson and Twiggy Ramirez in 2010.
Others had also been abused by the man I was referencing,â€ Addams wrote on Facebook.
â€œThe amount of guilt I felt for not reporting him when my rape initially occurred really began to eat at me.â€On Saturday, Marilyn Manson responded to Addamsâ€™s allegations against White.
TEXT:
On Friday, Jessicka Addams, former frontwoman of the band Jack Off Jill and current singer for the band Scarling, came forward with her story of sexual assault and domestic violence.

In a Facebook post, Addams accused her ex-boyfriend Jeordie White â€” who is better known as Twiggy Ramirez, the bassist for Marilyn Manson â€” of rape and physical assault during their relationship in the early 1990s.

â€œI said NO. I said NO. I said it so loud enough, that [a friend] came rushing in from the other room to get him off of me,â€ Addams wrote in her post. â€œBut I had been raped. I had been raped by somebody I thought I loved.â€

According to her post, Addams met and quickly moved in with White in 1993 when she was 18 years old. She said that White began to show signs of abuse and â€œmild violenceâ€ when Addamsâ€™ band started to gain a local following in their home of Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

â€œHe got increasingly jealous when I hung out with male friends,â€ she wrote.

Stefanie Keenan via Getty Images Jessicka Addams in Los Angeles in 2015.

She continued:

â€œHe began to body shame me. He slashed my tires. When I came home late one night, he put one of the stuffed animals he bought me into the burning oven in the kitchen.â€

Whiteâ€™s actions quickly escalated into physical abuse, according to Addams. She describes one unsettling experience in which White reportedly beat her in a car because she struck up a conversation with musician Trent Reznor while partying in South Florida.

â€œHe began driving my car erratically on the highway, all the while punching me [in] the chest several times, knocking the air out of my lungs,â€ she wrote. â€œHe proceeded to rip off the rear view mirror and threw it out the open window. Throughout the madness, this was a rather poignant moment. He just couldnâ€™t bear to face himself in that mirror.â€

GABRIEL BOUYS via Getty Images Marilyn Manson and Twiggy Ramirez in 2010.

Addams said that in 1997 she was warned by her bandâ€™s record company that if she publicly revealed her story â€œthere would be a very good chance that my band Jack Off Jill would be black balled by concert promoters, radio programmers, and other bands and their managers,â€ she wrote on Facebook. She also said that if she came forward, her band ran the risk of losing their record deal.

â€œAs they were certain no one would ever take a rape victim in this male dominated music business seriously, nevermind a ferocious, disenfranchised, outspoken overweight front woman such as myself!â€ Addams wrote.

At the time, Marilyn Manson was enjoying its height of popularity, thanks to the groupâ€™s 1996 album, â€œAntichrist Superstar.â€

In 2015, Addams alluded to her rape and assault in an interview with Alternative Press, which resulted in women contacting her with their own allegations against White.

â€œI was not the only one who was a victim of my rapist. Others had also been abused by the man I was referencing,â€ Addams wrote on Facebook. â€œThe amount of guilt I felt for not reporting him when my rape initially occurred really began to eat at me.â€

On Saturday, Marilyn Manson responded to Addamsâ€™s allegations against White.

In a statement to Pitchfork, he said:

â€œI knew Jessicka and Jeordie had a romantic relationship many years ago and I considered and still consider Jessicka to be a friend. I knew nothing about these allegations until very recently and am saddened by Jessickaâ€™s obvious distress.â€
TITLE: Marilyn Manson Bassist Twiggy Ramirez Accused Of Rape By Ex-Girlfriend

SUMMARY:
Thatâ€™s why when Kristy and John Cotthaus, owners of dog training business Zoom Room Virginia Beach, first heard about Strudel over the summer, they knew they had to help.
Zoom Room Virginia Beach Strudel before her first class with Zoom Room Virginia Beach.
â€œWe didnâ€™t have to use any treats at all because she was motivated to do the agility [course] with just lots of praise.â€Zoom Room Virginia Beach Strudel on her agility course.
)â€Zoom Room Virginia Beach Strudel is happier and healthier after significant weight loss.
Zoom Room Virginia Beach Strudel rests on one of the obstacles in her agility course.
TEXT:
The dramatic weight loss of a severely chunky golden retriever mix could be an inspiration to people caring for overweight pets.

Obesity is a real problem for cats and dogs in the United States, and extra pounds can lead to serious health issues and a lower quality of life.

Thatâ€™s why when Kristy and John Cotthaus, owners of dog training business Zoom Room Virginia Beach, first heard about Strudel over the summer, they knew they had to help.

Zoom Room Virginia Beach Strudel before her first class with Zoom Room Virginia Beach.

Strudel had just come into the care of dog rescue group Hearts for Hounds, where she ended up after the death of her elderly owner. Weighing in at almost 81 pounds, the 7-year-old Strudel was visibly far too heavy and suffering from issues like inflamed joints.

The couple offered their fitness services for free, working with a veterinarian to develop a proper diet plan and designing an agility course that wouldnâ€™t be too strenuous. In spite of her heft, Strudel was a natural.

â€œWe motivate dogs with treats, toys and praise but Strudel was actually easy, itâ€™s almost like she knew what she had to do,â€ Kristy Cotthaus told HuffPost in an email. â€œWe didnâ€™t have to use any treats at all because she was motivated to do the agility [course] with just lots of praise.â€

Zoom Room Virginia Beach Strudel on her agility course.

Strudel is up for adoption through Hearts for Hounds, and in the meantime sheâ€™s being fostered by volunteer Kristen Horton, who canâ€™t stop singing her praises.

â€œStrudel is the sweetest animal we have ever met,â€ Horton said in an email. â€œShe is calm, friendly, loves to play, snuggle, and walk, and is well-trained â€¦ Think gentle giant (though not so giant anymore!!)â€

Zoom Room Virginia Beach Strudel is happier and healthier after significant weight loss.

Horton said that after losing about 25 pounds so far, Strudel is already a more energetic dog. In fact, Strudel had to leave her first foster home because shedding the weight made her a little too energetic around another family pet.

â€œShe had lost enough weight that she was fast enough to antagonize their cat so she came to us at the end of August,â€ said Horton.

Zoom Room Virginia Beach Strudel rests on one of the obstacles in her agility course.

While Strudelâ€™s cat-chasing tendencies are now apparent, Horton said Strudel loves other dogs and would do wonderfully in a home with kids who could â€œkeep her activity up.â€ Aside from that, Horton noted whoever adopts Strudel will have to commit to a regimen including special foods and lots of exercise. Her joint problems make it tough for her to take the stairs, so a home where thatâ€™s not necessary would be ideal, and vets will soon evaluate Strudel to see if sheâ€™s suffering from any internal medical issues related to her weight.

But, Horton noted, Strudelâ€™s already been triumphant at overcoming a major challenge â€• losing weight â€• and thatâ€™s allowed her to get back to living a much more normal dog life.
TITLE: Strudel The Obese Dog's Fitness Journey Is Nothing Short Of Inspiring

SUMMARY:
New rules have come into force that require all providers of treatment on the NHS to establish if patients are eligible for free care as part of efforts to tackle health tourism.
Foreign visitors who are not eligible may have to pay upfront for any non-urgent or planned care under the regulations introduced by the Department of Health.
Hospitals will be required to identify a patientâ€™s chargeable status so any costs can be recovered, however doctors have warned the rules â€œlack clarityâ€ and could burden NHS Trusts with extra bureaucracy.
â€œThe new regulations simply require NHS bodies to make enquiries about, and then charge, those who arenâ€™t entitled to free NHS care.
All the money raised goes back into funding and improving care for NHS patients,â€ he said.
TEXT:
New rules have come into force that require all providers of treatment on the NHS to establish if patients are eligible for free care as part of efforts to tackle health tourism.

Foreign visitors who are not eligible may have to pay upfront for any non-urgent or planned care under the regulations introduced by the Department of Health. It is hoped the move will contribute to Â£22bn of savings needed in the NHS.

Hospitals will be required to identify a patientâ€™s chargeable status so any costs can be recovered, however doctors have warned the rules â€œlack clarityâ€ and could burden NHS Trusts with extra bureaucracy.

PA Wire/PA Images It is hoped the move will contribute to Â£22bn of savings needed in the NHS (file picture)

The government has previously estimated that up to Â£500m could be recovered from overseas visitorsâ€™ and migrantsâ€™ use of the NHS every year. The British Medical Association (BMA) however has described the figure as â€œexaggeratedâ€ and â€œunreliable.â€

Health Minister Lord Oâ€™Shaughnessy said the NHS was open to foreign visitors so long as they make their â€œfair financial contributionâ€ towards care costs.

â€œThe new regulations simply require NHS bodies to make enquiries about, and then charge, those who arenâ€™t entitled to free NHS care. All the money raised goes back into funding and improving care for NHS patients,â€ he said.

â€œWe are clear that some vulnerable groups are exempt from charging and the NHS will never withhold urgent and immediately necessary treatment.â€

Among the treatments exempt from the charging rules announced by Health Secretary Jeremy Hunt earlier this year are emergency care and maternity care.

Charging will also not apply when it is not in the interest of public health to do so, such as treating infectious disease.

Meanwhile vulnerable groups of people, such as asylum seekers, will not be charged for treatment.

Under the new rules, patients will be asked where they have lived for the last six months and if they have been abroad, they will be required to show evidence they are entitled to free NHS care, such as a non-UK European Health Insurance Card. If they donâ€™t have these documents, they may be charged under the scheme.

Dr Chaand Nagpaul, council chair of the BMA, said it was â€œvitalâ€ patients with acute needs, or those from vulnerable groups, do not face bureaucratic or financial obstacles.

To do so would be â€œmorally unacceptable and could end up costing the NHS more money due to lack of timely treatment,â€ he added.

â€œIt is important that those accessing NHS services are eligible to do so, especially at a time when the NHS is under intense pressure and struggling to cope with patient demand,â€ he said.

â€œHowever, the current charging proposals lack clarity around how and when overseas patients should be charged which does run the risk of causing confusion and an additional administrative burden within NHS Trusts.â€

Last week two experts argued the new rules would place a burden on already-overworked doctors and that there was no evidence it would save much money.

In an article in the British Medical Journal, Professor Martin McKee and Dr Lucinda Hiam argued doctors would only be able to determine how urgent a personâ€™s need for care would be by initial tests, which pose â€œconsiderable risksâ€ if they are wrong.

â€œClearly, this requires considerable judgment, based on what will often be incomplete information... Yet, if [doctors] get this wrong, they face considerable risks,â€ the BMJ article says.

â€œIf they breach the guidance by providing treatment to people lacking entitlement, they may reasonably fear potential disciplinary action, even if this threat is not explicitly stated.
TITLE: Foreign Visitors Could Face Upfront NHS Charges In Crackdown On â€˜Health Tourismâ€™

Die "SÃ¼ddeutsche Zeitung" will in einem Artikel herausfinden, wann Frauen am besten Kinder bekommen, ohne damit ihrer Karriere zu schaden. Dazu hat eine "SZ"-Autorin eine Karriere-Beraterin befragt. Die Tipps beider Frauen klingen aber leider eher so, als seien sie gerade aus den FÃ¼nfziger Jahren in die Zukunft gereist.

Die Bloggerin "Juramama" hat sich den Artikel auf Facebook vorgenommen und empÃ¶rt sich vor allem Ã¼ber die Autorin der "SÃ¼ddeutschen Zeitung".

Denn diese schreibt wÃ¶rtlich: "Dass Frauen im BewerbungsgesprÃ¤ch auf die Frage nach der Familienplanung lÃ¼gen dÃ¼rfen, schafft auf Seiten der Arbeitgeber kein Vertrauen. Eine kinderlose Frau um die 30 einzustellen, ist aus ihrer Sicht ein GlÃ¼cksspiel."

Verwunderlich dabei ist, dass die Autorin selbst eine junge Frau ist. "Liebe Karriereberaterinnen und Journalistinnen. Ihr seid Frauen. Stellt anderen Frauen doch nicht die Beine, Ã¼ber die ihr selbst nicht stolpern wollt", schreibt die Bloggerin Juramama zurecht.

Zu sagen, es sei ein "GlÃ¼cksspiel", eine Frau um die 30 einzustellen, ist auÃŸerdem nicht nur frauenfeindlich, sondern auch reichlich Ã¼bertrieben. Nicht alle Frauen wollen ein Kind, viele von ihnen haben mit 30 vielleicht auch schon lÃ¤ngst eines. Streng genommen geht es den Arbeitgeber aber ohnehin nur wenig an.

Rechtlich ist es Unternehmen gar nicht erlaubt, nach einem Kinderwunsch zu fragen. Frauen mÃ¼ssen auf diese Frage nicht antworten.

Beraterin: "Hochschwangere Frauen sollten sich nicht bewerben"

Doch anstatt den Frauen das zu sagen, rÃ¤t die Karriere-Beraterin nur: "Ist ein Kind nicht gerade unterwegs oder zumindest unmittelbar gewÃ¼nscht, sollten sich Frauen auch nicht so verhalten, als ob."

Anstatt sich frÃ¼hzeitig auf eine Situation mit Baby einzustellen, sollte "der Fokus weiter die Karriere sein". Frauen sollten sich immer weiter bewerben, aber nicht mehr, wenn sich "der FÃ¶tus im Ultraschall rÃ¤kelt", schreibt die Autorin. Die Bloggerin "Juramama" sieht das anders.

"Einerseits weiÃŸ niemand wie eine Schwangerschaft weitergeht und ob sie hÃ¤lt. Anderseits weiÃŸ jede Mutter, dass PlÃ¤ne sich schnell Ã¤ndern kÃ¶nnen und man plÃ¶tzlich doch sehr viel frÃ¼her weiterarbeiten mÃ¶chte und kann, als man vorher dachte."

Frauen mit einem "RÃ¤kel-FÃ¶tus" im Bauch sollten deshalb ihrer Meinung nach auf keinen Fall arbeitslos bleiben oder auf einen Karriereschritt verzichten, nur weil sie schwanger sind.

"Die hat doch einen Mann" sollte kein Argument sein

"Schwangere arbeiten ganz normal. Sie haben sogar ein Gehirn mehr! Wie ungemein praktisch! MÃ¼tter brauchen nach der Geburt meist auch einen Arbeitsplatz. Wir wollen nie mehr bei 'die hat doch einen Mann' ankommen - und auch die Zustimmung unseres Ehegatten brauchen wir fÃ¼r eine BerufstÃ¤tigkeit nicht", schreibt die Bloggerin.

Und damit hat sie vollkommen recht.

Den HÃ¶hepunkt des Textes aber bildet zweifellos das Fazit der Autorin. Demnach sei ein "strategisch guter Zeitpunkt fÃ¼r die Geburt des ersten Kindes" nicht das Alter der Mutter, sondern dann, "wenn der Vater etwa 40 Jahre alt ist - gemeinsame Ã¶konomische PrÃ¤ferenzen vorausgesetzt."

Wir Frauen sollen die Geburt eines Kindes also nicht nur mit Fokus auf die eigene Karriere planen, sondern vor allem mit Fokus auf die Karriere unseres Mannes. Bevor er 40 Jahre alt ist, kÃ¶nnen wir leider keine Kinder bekommen - sorry.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Ergebnis von 40 Jahren Forschung: Frauen sind die besseren Chefs - wegen dieser 4 FÃ¤higkeiten

Um es mit den Worten der Bloggerin "Juramama" zu sagen: "Solange Frauen andere Frauen so systemhÃ¶rig beraten und Journalistinnen noch immer unkritisch solche Wertungen der geltenden Rechtslage in die Tastatur hauen, mÃ¼ssen wir uns auch an die eigene Nase fassen, MÃ¤dels", schreibt sie.

"Worte haben Macht."

(ks)
TITLE: Eine Karriere-Beraterin sagt Frauen, wann sie Kinder bekommen sollen - die Antwort macht fassungslos

TEXT:

La fÃ©dÃ©ration norvÃ©gienne de football vient de trouver un accord pour que les membres de ses Ã©quipes nationales masculine et fÃ©minine reÃ§oivent une rÃ©munÃ©ration identique. L'accord a Ã©tÃ© saluÃ© dans le monde entier. Il est mÃªme citÃ© comme un exemple Ã  suivre. Et pourtant, il cache une rÃ©alitÃ© bien diffÃ©rente de la vÃ©ritÃ© officielle. Qu'en est-il rÃ©ellement? Et pourquoi, partout sur la planÃ¨te, les salaires des joueurs et des joueuses de football sont-ils aussi diffÃ©rents? Explication.

InÃ©galitÃ© commerciale

En NorvÃ¨ge, le football fÃ©minin est, depuis toujours, bien plus performant que le football masculin. Alors que l'Ã©quipe masculine n'a jamais remportÃ© de titre majeur au cours de son histoire, l'Ã©quipe fÃ©minine a Ã©tÃ© championne d'Europe en 1987 et en 1993, championne du monde en 1995, et championne olympique en 2000.

Pourtant, jusqu'Ã  prÃ©sent, les joueurs de l'Ã©quipe nationale masculine norvÃ©gienne Ã©taient bien mieux rÃ©munÃ©rÃ©s que leurs homologues fÃ©minins. La raison de cette inÃ©galitÃ© est simple: le football masculin bÃ©nÃ©ficie en NorvÃ¨ge, comme presque partout dans le monde, de revenus commerciaux supÃ©rieurs Ã  ceux que le football fÃ©minin, et donc les Ã©quipes nationales fÃ©minines, parviennent Ã  capter.

C'est en renonÃ§ant Ã  ces revenus commerciaux, se montant Ã  59 000 euros par joueur, que l'Ã©quipe nationale masculine de football norvÃ©gienne a permis Ã  l'Ã©quipe fÃ©minine d'obtenir la mÃªme dotation de sa fÃ©dÃ©ration. Soit une dotation de 640 000 euros par an, pour la totalitÃ© de l'Ã©quipe.

De l'Ã©galitÃ© Ã  l'"Ã©quitÃ©"

Cela, c'est la vÃ©ritÃ© officielle. Mais elle cache une rÃ©alitÃ© bien diffÃ©rente. Car si le revenu "de base" versÃ© par la fÃ©dÃ©ration devient le mÃªme, les revenus tirÃ©s des compÃ©titions jouÃ©es par les sÃ©lections nationales masculine et fÃ©minine, et qui sont versÃ©s par l'UEFA et la FIFA, restent â€“ pour reprendre les termes de Joachim Waltin, le reprÃ©sentant des joueurs et joueuses norvÃ©giens â€“ "Ã©quitables", mais certainement pas "Ã©gaux".

Ces revenus sont "Ã©quitables", dans le sens ou chaque Ã©quipe reÃ§oit 25% des revenus versÃ©s Ã  la fÃ©dÃ©ration norvÃ©gienne par l'UEFA et par la FIFA. Mais ils ne sont pas "Ã©gaux", puisque ces 25% ne portent pas du tout sur les mÃªmes sommes. Et reflÃ¨tent des rÃ©alitÃ©s bien diffÃ©rentes, selon que l'on parle du football fÃ©minin ou du football masculin.

A titre d'exemple, la FIFA a versÃ© 35 millions de dollars Ã  la fÃ©dÃ©ration allemande aprÃ¨s la victoire de son Ã©quipe masculine lors de la Coupe du monde organisÃ©e au BrÃ©sil, en 2014. Mais elle n'a versÃ© "que" 2 millions de dollars Ã  la fÃ©dÃ©ration amÃ©ricaine, suite Ã  la victoire de son Ã©quipe fÃ©minine Ã  la Coupe du monde organisÃ©e au Canada, en 2015.

Dans ces conditions, on comprend que si les salaires "de base" versÃ©s par la fÃ©dÃ©ration norvÃ©gienne de football aux joueurs et joueuses de ses sÃ©lections nationales sont bien identiques, les revenus globaux des joueurs et des joueuses, restent profondÃ©ment inÃ©galitaires.

Deux marchÃ©s diffÃ©rents

Doit-on s'en offusquer? Non. Pas si on prend en compte que la Coupe du monde masculine organisÃ©e au BrÃ©sil en 2014 a rapportÃ© 4,8 milliards de dollars Ã  la FIFA, alors que la Coupe du monde fÃ©minine de 2015 organisÃ©e au Canada n'a rapportÃ©, elle, "que"... 300 millions de dollars.

Autrement dit, s'il existe bien un rapport de 1 Ã  17 entre les revenus versÃ©s aux fÃ©dÃ©rations championnes du monde en 2014 et 2015, il existe un rapport â€“ symÃ©trique â€“ de 1 Ã  16 entre les revenus gÃ©nÃ©rÃ©s par ces deux compÃ©titions.

En rÃ©alitÃ©, le football fÃ©minin et le football masculin relÃ¨vent, comme la plupart des autres sports, de marchÃ©s Ã©conomiques distincts. Vouloir le nier est vain. Vouloir contraindre le marchÃ© du sport masculin pour l'aligner de force avec le sport fÃ©minin n'a pas de sens.

Travailler sur le long terme

Doit-on pour autant renoncer Ã  toute forme de promotion des femmes dans le football ? Certainement pas.

Mais l'outil de la rÃ©munÃ©ration n'est, en revanche, pas le plus appropriÃ© sur le court terme. Et il ne constitue pas, de loin, la bataille prioritaire. Il faut, en rÃ©alitÃ©, travailler sur le long terme. En ouvrant la gouvernance du sport aux femmes. En s'assurant que les fÃ©dÃ©rations nationales, europÃ©ennes et internationales, octroient les moyens nÃ©cessaires au dÃ©veloppement du foot fÃ©minin. En demandant aux chaÃ®nes de tÃ©lÃ©vision publiques, en France comme Ã  l'Ã©tranger, de donner au sport fÃ©minin la visibilitÃ© qu'il mÃ©rite. Ces efforts permettraient sur la durÃ©e au sport fÃ©minin de se dÃ©velopper et de crÃ©er des conditions Ã©conomiques attractives, et pÃ©rennes, pour les sportives.

Rien n'empÃªche d'ici lÃ  les Bleus, qui sont par ailleurs extraordinairement bien payÃ©s dans leurs clubs respectifs, d'imiter leurs collÃ¨gues norvÃ©giens et d'abandonner une partie de leurs revenus perÃ§us via la FÃ©dÃ©ration FranÃ§aise de Football, pour aligner leur rÃ©munÃ©ration "de base" sur celle de leurs collÃ¨gues fÃ©minines, les Bleues. Une mesure qui reprÃ©senterait un petit pas - mais un pas dÃ©cisif - vers l'"Ã©quitÃ©" des sexes.

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
